loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To start Business

loan.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Ignacio is from Pedro Escobedo, Quertaro, a state located approximately in the middle of Mexico. Ignacio has a small glass business that he began 10 years ago when he lost his job. He is a married man with a very unit family.

Ignacio started his business because of his economic situation and his motivation to own a business. At the beginning, he started in an empty space of his home but, like all very hard working entrepreneurs, his business grew little by little and he then had to rent a space that was bigger than his initial place to move his business to. This new place is located in the center of the city and he believes that micro-loan could be very helpful to help his business to succeed and grow. For this reason, he needs a loan of US$ 450 American dollars to purchase raw materials to make his products.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Ignacio es originario de Pedro Escobedo, Quertaro y cuenta con el negocio de Vidriera desde hace 10 aos fecha en la que fue retirado de su empleo, es un hombre casado y tiene una familia muy unida, el empez por la necesidad econmica y tener su propio negocio, inicialmente acondicion un espacio para su negocio en su misma casa y por su gran desempeo y constancia ha visto crecer sus inventarios y sus ventas, por lo que rento un local comercial en el centro de la ciudad, el considera que el micro crdito le ser de mucha utilidad, y un factor importante para el crecimiento de su negocio. Por ello esta solicitando un crdito por US$ 450 dlares americanos para compra de materia prima para fabricar sus productos.

loan.use: Purchase raw material for his business

loan.name: Hilda Margarita

texts.en:
In September of 2005, Hilda started her stationary business because she wanted to earn an additional income to support her husband to pay for their house and their childrens' expenses. Later, she decided to offer other things that her clients wanted and a few months ago she started to offer groceries in response to the demand of her clients. She works in her business and occasionally her children support her. Even though they are little (10 and 9 years old), they are learning about the business and about selling.

Currently, Hilda needs a loan by $ 925 USD to buy a display case and shelves where she may set her products and offer a better service to her clients. She is requesting a term to pay back her loan of 6-12 months.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

En septiembre del 2005 Hilda inici su negocio de papelera pues quera tener ingresos adicionales para ayudar a su esposo a pagar su casa y los gastos de sus dos hijos. Mas tarde decidi ofrecer productos de mercera los cuales tuvieron una buena aceptacin y hace algunos meses empez a ofrecer abarrotes ante la demanda de sus clientes. En su negocio trabaja ella y en ocasiones le ayudan sus hijos que aunque son pequeos (10 y 9 aos) estn aprendiendo el negocio de las ventas.

En estos momentos necesita un prstamo por $ 925 USD para comprar una vitrina y estantes en donde pueda colocar sus productos que ofrece, para de esa forma brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y seguir contando con su preferencia. El plazo que esta solicitando es de 6-12 meses.

loan.use: to buy a display case and shelves

loan.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is an enthusiastic young person who is from Pedro Escobedo, Quertaro. Since he was a child, he needed to help his grandmother who he lives with. He began to sell candies on the buses of the city and, in 2000, Alejandro and his grandmother created a small store called PALETERIA ALEX.

In May of 2001, with great effort, he saved a little money and invested in another business of custom jewelry sales while his grandmother took care of Paletera Alex in the morning.

Alejandro needs a loan for US$1,200 American Dollars, payable in 6 months, to provide merchandise in the Paletera" and also to invest in more varieties of custom jewelry to allow him to help grow his business with his grandmother.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Alejandro es un joven entusiasta originario de Pedro Escobedo, Quertaro, que desde muy pequeo se vio en la necesidad de ayudar a su abuelita que es con quien vive, inicio vendiendo paletas en los camiones y en el ao 2000 entre el y su abuelita pusieron una Paletera ALEX. En mayo del 2001 con lo que pudieron ahorrar pudo obtener un pequeo capital para invertir y as inicio otro negocio de venta de joyera de fantasa, mientras su abuelita en las maanas continua atendiendo la Paletera Alex. Alejandro esta solicitando un crdito de US$ 1,200Dlares americanos a 6 meses para surtir la peletera y tener ms variedad en joyera de fantasa para as sacar adelante a su abuelita.

loan.use: Purchase custom jewelry and merchandise

loan.name: Mara Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is from Pedro Escobedo, Quertaro, and is responsible for her 3 children. In 1998, knowing the necessities of truck drivers on the road, she decided to create her business called Regaderas Escobedo(Regaderas is like a quick shower on the road for all people who work as a truck drivers and many times they need this service because their travels are long and many of them do not rent a motel room). This business, in addition to offering showers, offers clothes washing and ironing, used clothes for sale, and Cokes.

Maria initiated the business with her daughter who is 18 years old. She started with a small amount of capital and later she was able to rent a place for her business. She has been growing little by little to serve her clients and the business allows her to have the resources to maintain her 3 children. Now her 3 children support her in the business.

Maria Guadalupe needs a loan of US$600 American Dollars and offers to repay it in 6 months. The loan is for renewing her work tools and purchasing clothes in order to increase her sales and give better service to her clients.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Mara Guadalupe es de Pedro Escobedo, Quertaro, teniendo la responsabilidad ella sola de la manutencin de sus 3 hijos y conociendo las necesidades de los camioneros, en 1998 decide iniciar su negocio Regaderas Escobedo el cual presta servicios de renta de regaderas, lavado y planchado de ropa, venta de ropa usada y venta de refrescos para camioneros, inicia junto con su hija mayor que actualmente tiene 18 aos. Ella empez reuniendo un pequeo capital, despus rento un local y lo fue acondicionando poco a poco para prestar los servicios que ahora ofrece y que le permiten tener los recursos necesarios para mantener de manera digna a sus 3 hijos que ahora la apoyan en el negocio. Mara Guadalupe necesita un crdito de US $600 Dlares americanos y ofrece pagarlos a 6 meses, esto es para renovar sus utensilios de trabajo y para invertir una mayor cantidad de ropa, y as incrementar sus ventas y dar mejor servicio.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise and tool for her business

loan.name: Deysi Asuncin

texts.en:
Deysi is married and has two children. She needed to give education to her children so she had to sell clothes and jewelry to her friends. Years ago, her husband worked in a company as a worker by journal. But with the pass of time, he saw that his wifes business was good and he decided to support and help her with the business. Now, both are working together as owners of this micro business.

This month, Daysi needs to invest in merchandise because she gives credit to her clients and this affects her because she does not have enough cash flow. For this reason she is requesting a loan of US$ 450 payable in 3 months. Deysi comments that with her business she could live better than years ago and she hopes that the end of this year will be better than other years because her portfolio of clients grows more and more.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Deysi es una madre de familia casada y tiene 2 hijos, quien para salir adelante y poder darles educacin comenz a vender entre sus amistades ropa y joyera. Antes su esposo trabajaba para una empresa como jornalero, pero al ver que el negocio es funcional, decidi apoyarla y ahora entre los 2 manejan la microempresa. Por estas fechas Deysi, necesita invertir en mercanca pues ella maneja crdito con sus clientes lo que le provoca falta de flujo de efectivo. Es por lo anterior que esta solicitando un prstamo de US$ 450 dlares a 3 meses para pagar. Con el negocio Daysi comenta que ha tenido un nivel de vida un poco ms desahogado, tiene la esperanza de que en este fin de ao, que es la mejor poca para su negocio, le vaya mucho mejor, pues su cartera de clientes es cada vez ms grande.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Hipolito

texts.en:
Hipolito and his wife are from Mexico State and they moved to Merida city 7 years ago. Both are determined to start a new life and have a business. When they arrived to the city, they started with a food sales business that was accepted by the people of Merida and they had success. With this business, they could earn money and they decided to invest in another business selling shoes. Now they manage these two business and their sons support them in their businesses.

Hipolito comments that thanks to the income they earned from the businesses, he could educate his sons. At this moment they need capital to invest in shoes because he needs to have an inventory for this season as his demand always rises this time of the year. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $ 475 USD and he promises to repay it in 5 months, at least.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Hiplito y su esposa son originarios del Estado de Mxico, emigraron a la ciudad de Mrida hace 7 aos convencidos de iniciar una nueva vida y poner un negocio. Al llegar a la ciudad, comenzaron vendiendo comida con muy buena aceptacin, inclusive del negocio de las comidas surgi capital para invertir en la venta de calzado. A la fecha manejan los 2 negocios y sus hijos los apoyan en estas actividades. Menciona que gracias a los ingresos de los negocios han podido darles educacin a sus hijos. En estos momentos les hace falta capital para incrementar sus inventarios de calzado, pues a fin de ao la demanda se incrementa; es por lo anterior que estn solicitando apoyo crediticio por la cantidad de US $ 450 pagaderos en 5 meses.

loan.use: purchase merchandise for his store.

loan.name: Rosario Del Socorro

texts.en:
Rosario has more than five years dedicated to cosmetic sales. She is married and from Tixkokob, Yucatan. She became acquainted with the cosmetic business when a friend of hers invited her to be part of a saleswoman group. She began to lose her initial fear of sales and now she comments that sales are part of her diary activity.

With the money that she earns with her business, she can help to support her family expenses. Her husband works in a mariachi group and his income is not fixed so Rosario's business is very important in their family economy. She is requesting a loan of US$ 950 and needs 6 months to repay. A very good season is coming and she needs to stay ready with enough merchandise.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Rosario tiene ms de 5 aos de dedicarse a la venta de cosmticos ella es originaria de Tixkokob, Yucatn y esta casada. Conoci el negocio de los cosmticos cuando una amiga la invito a pertenecer a su grupo de vendedoras, pronto empez a perder el miedo y ahora comenta que es parte de su actividad diaria. Con los ingresos del negocio puede apoyar en los gastos de su casa, su esposo trabaja en un grupo de mariachi y el ingreso no es fijo, por lo que con su negocio es parte importante de la economa familiar. A la fecha necesita un crdito por la cantidad de US$ 950 a 6 meses para pagar, pues se avecina una buena temporada, ya que desde el mes de noviembre la demanda de calzado se incrementa, por lo que necesita estar preparada con suficiente mercanca.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
Four years ago, Maria Isabel decided to open a clothes sales business to help with the family expenses at home. She thought that this activity was simple because she could work and also take care of her home and children. Maria Isabel is married and her husband is a bricklayer. One of her daughters, Enny, helps her with the business by selling her mothers merchandise to her friends and neighbors.

Maria Isabel needs a loan of US$ 475 because her sales have increased and she needs to purchase more merchandise. She comments that thanks to her business she feels independent because her income is good and she does not need to ask her husband for money to cover her basic expenses. She works every afternoon and during the weekends she dedicates more time to the business. She feels so proud of her achievements and she one day wants to have her own clothes store in a good place.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Hace 4 aos Maria Isabel, decidi ponerse a vender ropa para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, consideraba que era una actividad muy prctica, ya que con ella no descuidara su casa y el cuidado de sus hijos. Maria Isabel esta casada y su esposo es albail. Una de sus hijas de nombre Enny le ayuda en el negocio, va y surte mercanca para vender entre sus amistades y vecinos y le ayuda a cobrar los das de pago. Esta solicitando un prstamo de US $475 a 6 meses, pues se le han incrementado las ventas con motivo del cambio de temporada, por lo que necesita invertir en mercanca. Ella comenta que gracias al negocio, se siente independiente, pues las ganancias son buenas y no necesita estar pidiendo dinero a su esposo para cubrir sus gastos ms bsicos. Su negocio lo atiende un rato por las tardes y los fines de semana, que es cuando le dedica mayor tiempo. Se siente satisfecha con lo que esta logrando y no descarta la posibilidad de llegar a tener su propia tienda de ropa bien establecida.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo for many years was working at a meat store, but he had to quit from this activity for health reasons. He always had to stay in very cold rooms and he was sick almost once a month. While he recovered, he was thinking about how he could provide for his family and a friend invited him to a fishing practice. He did not have any resources to practice this sport, so he started to manufacture his own nets. First he learned to fish and when he saw that his work was excellent and much stronger, his friends began to become interested and they wanted to buy from him. Through this, he found that he could do it as a business. At this moment he has 8 years of experience in this business and he sells his products to both friends, and also any sports stores that are interested in buying from him. Marcelo is requesting a loan of US$ 275 because the shrimp season is coming up and he needs to be prepared with enough merchandise.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Marcelo mucho tiempo trabajo en el rea de carnicera, tuvo que retirarse de esta actividad pues su salud se vio afectada por el contacto directo de los cuartos fros, se enfermaba constantemente. Mientras se recuperaba y pensaba como poder sacar adelante a su familia, un amigo lo invito a practicar la pesca deportiva. Escaso de recursos para poder practicar comenz a elaborar sus propias redes, primero para poder pescar. Al ver lo bien hechas y resistentes que le quedaban, sus amigos comenzaron a encargarle redes, fue as como decidi que ese podra ser su negocio. Cuenta ya con 8 aos de experiencia en este ramo y adems de venderlo a particulares tambin ofrece su mercanca en las tiendas de deportes. A la fecha el Sr. Marcelo necesita invertir en cordel y avios para fabricar las redes por lo que esta solicitando un crdito por la cantidad de US$275 a 4 meses, pues se avecina la temporada de pesca de camarn y necesita estas preparado con mercanca suficiente.

loan.use: Purchase raw materials

loan.name: Loida Minerva

texts.en:
Loida has two sons and has had her business for 8 years. She started the business because she needed to help her family economy. In front of her house, she installed a small store with basic and first necessity articles to sell. Her first clients were neighbors and people who live near her home.

With the income from her business, she can cover her family's expenses. Loida needs a loan of US$ 475 and offers to pay back in 5 months. She is thinking of investing in more merchandise because she knows that her clients need to find everything in her store. She has high expectations, knows she has a lot of things to offer to her clients, and hopes to obtain more income.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Loida cuenta con su tienda de abarrotes desde hace 8 aos, se inicio en esta actividad pues tenia la necesidad econmica de sacar adelante a su familia, que esta compuesta por 2 hijos. En el frente de su casa habilito un pequeo tendajon con venta de comestibles y artculos bsicos y sus principales clientes lo conforman sus vecinos y habitantes de las colonias aledaas. Con los ingresos del negocio puede cubrir los gastos de su casa, pues son su nico ingreso, en estos momentos Loida necesita recuperar inventarios por lo que esta solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de $475 a 5 meses. Comenta que esta tratando de invertir en ms mercanca pues sabe que para que el cliente no se vaya debe encontrar de todo en su local. Tiene buenas expectativas, pues ya con la experiencia que tiene con el negocio quiere que cada vez se vea ms surtido, pues esto le generara mejores ganancias.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes bought this tire repair shop from her uncle two years ago. When he moved to Spain he sold it to her for $1000 and though she did not know much about the business she convinced her mom to support her and her sister in this venture. Today she does not regret the decision to take over. Although she could only do small jobs at first she has learned the trade and now manages the business. She has an employee who does most of the heavy work and manual labor. Lourdes is currently studying business administration at night at a local university. Her sister helps her run the business when she has school work to do and her family is in full support of them. She is requesting the loan because she wants to buy materials in bulk and also wants to offer other products her clients are demanding. She wants to avoid borrowing from loan sharks at all costs because she now knows that their rates and terms are abusive.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Materials for her tire repair shop

loan.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is a 41 year old woman who is very dynamic and has been selling for 19 years. She is married and has three children and a husband who help her with her business. She sells sausage and yogurt and has been well accepted by her clients. She started her business four years ago in the local market in order to be self-sufficient and support her family's economy and, over time, she has increased her business.

Teresa is asking a loan of $ 650 USD to buy merchandise in order to increase her inventory and offer better services to her clients. She intends to pay back the loan over a term of 6-12 months.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

La Seora Teresa es una mujer de 41 aos muy activa que se dedica al comercio desde hace 19 aos, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que ayudan en el negocio al igual que su esposo. Su negocio es la venta de embutidos y yogur, los cuales tienen una muy buena aceptacin entre sus clientes. Desde hace cuatro aos inicio su negocio en el tianguis ante la necesidad de generar ingresos y poder ayudar a la economa familiar y durante este tiempo ha hecho crecer el negocio.

Teresa requiere un crdito por $ 650 USD para comprar mercancas y poder incrementar sus inventarios y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, piensa pagar el prstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a single mother with 3 children. She owns a small shop where she sells snacks and other foods. When her husband left her he gave her $500 for the kids. Combined with her savings Jenny was able to set up her business in the front of her home. At first she relied heavily on the local loan sharks but now she realizes their rates are not fair. As a side job she knits childrens clothing for a local store. Shes been knitting and sewing for over 10 years but her primary source of income is her microbusiness. She needs the loan in order to invest in new products to sell at her shop. She is hopeful that these investments will result in a better life for her and her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Increase and diversify inventory

loan.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo has owned this small store for over 10 years. He sells all types of food products from his shop, ranging from rice to snacks for kids. He started this business with $15 (which was worth much more in Ecuador 10 years ago) and only sold rice, sugar, oil and plantains. Although he was one of the first businesses in this area he now faces competition from other stores around him. In order to contest with these businesses Lorenzo is looking to increase and diversify his inventory with this loan. He wants to begin selling chicken, meat, sausages and eggs as well as any other products that may be in demand. Because this is his only source of income he has dedicated his life to his business and is eager to receive a loan that could make it grow.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Diversify product offerings

loan.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos aspires to open a dental clinic in La Isla Trinitaria, one of the poorest neighborhoods in Guayaquil. He lives with his parents who put him through dental school with the help of his brother who owns a small business. Carlos has already used $600 in savings to prepare a room in his house for the business and to purchase some basic dentistry tools. He needs the loan in order to purchase a dentist chair and light as well as other materials. He has studied and practiced dentistry for the last 8 years in rural areas of Ecuador. He now wants to offer his services at affordable prices to the community he grew up with. Carlos believes this is a great opportunity for him and his family to start a business that will provide a service that is not accessible to the people of La Isla Trinitaria. With the profits he also wants to help his younger siblings in the same way his parents and his brother helped him.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Dentist chair and other materials

loan.name: Elisa Del Carmen

texts.en:
Five years ago, Elisa started her gifts and stationery business in her house. She is a single woman and is very enthusiastic and dynamic. She wanted to be self sufficient when she set up her business with her mothers support. She is in charge of her business and she always supplies her business with merchandise that her clients need and prefer.

On this occasion, Elisa is requesting a loan of $925 USD to buy merchandise and prepare for the upcoming Christmas season (because this is one of the best seasons of the year for her sales). The term to pay back is 6-12 months.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Hace cinco aos que Elisa inici su negocio de regalos y papelera en su casa, ella es una mujer soltera muy dinmica y entusiasta que pens en ser autosuficiente al establecer su negocio con la ayuda de su madre. Ella es la que se encarga del negocio y esta al pendiente de surtir la mercanca que demandan sus clientes para poder contar con su preferencia.

En esta ocasin, Elisa esta solicitando un crdito por la cantidad de $ 925 USD para comprar mercancas y estar preparada para la prxima temporada navidea, ya que es una de las mejores pocas del ao en que se ven incrementadas sus ventas. El plazo solicitado para pagar el crdito es de 6-12 meses.

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro owns a bike shop and is a second time lender from Kiva. He is very grateful for the first loan that he received. All his payments were on time and he was able to repay without any inconveniences. Pedro is hopeful that he will receive a follow up loan so that he may continue to grow his business. When his parents ran the shop Pedro never seemed interested in joining the family business but four years ago he found himself without a job and saw the opportunity to join in. Now he runs the shop on his own and is inspired by the loans that he has received from Mifex and Kiva. He plans to buy a new air compressor for the shop and will continue to invest in tools that make him more efficient. His location on a main street allows his business to have great exposure and bring in a consistent flow of customers. Pedro has recently hired an employee, an adolescent without a home who he is lending a hand to.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Compressor and other tools for his shop

loan.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olguita owns a small general store were she sells a variety of items including school supplies and home products. She started this business 3 years ago with her husband. Slowly they saved $300 of the wages he earned from his job as a factory worker. With that money they were able to purchase a used display case and they made preparations so they could launch the business from their home. As an added source of income Olga also makes sandals that she sells locally. With the loan money she will seek to improve her inventory and make minor improvements to the shop. Olga is a 26 year old mother of one and she is happily married. She says she needs her business to return higher profits in order to provide a better living for her son.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Increase inventory and make improvements to her store

loan.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina and her husband sell home products, cosmetics and clothing. Unlike other businesses in her area Sabina does not sell these products out of her home. Instead she is a door to door salesman in her community. This type of business has proven to be successful because many mothers and business owners do not leave their home during the day. Sabina sees this as a business opportunity as she can target these people as potential customers. She also makes her products attractive by allowing her customers to pay in small amounts at a time. She has learned that not all of her clients can afford to buy these items for the full price at the time of purchase, but that they can pay her in small amounts over a two week period. Thus Sabina and her husband have created a business that is convenient and accessible to the community. They are seeking a loan to be able to purchase a larger variety of products for the upcoming Christmas season. They will use the profits to benefit their two children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy more products to sell for the upcoming Christmas Season

loan.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a single mother in charge of caring for two children. Her aunt motivated her to start her own business three years ago, shortly after her husband left her. Today she operates a shop out of her house where she sells kitchen products and other household items. Her first source of finance was her aunt, who lent her $50 so that she could get her business going. With that money she made a down payment to a wholesale seller for pots, silverware and fabrics. She says that she has come a long way in these past three years but still feels the pressure of being the sole provider for her children. She is seeking a loan in order to diversify her product offerings and to make her shop look a little more professional.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in new products

loan.name: Latinka

texts.en:
Latinka T. keeps a little clothing shop in one of the trading halls in the town of Smolian. She has run her little business for 15 years. Before the political changes in Bulgaria in 1989, she had been a waitress in one of the town restaurants, but right after that she had lost her job and decided to start with the trading.

She says that she has always liked the trading and contact she has with customers. The shop is still very small but for the past 15 years in the business she has attracted many regular customers.

The money she earns from her shop is enough to make a stable living, but 4 years ago her husband passed away and now she is experiencing great difficulties. Although her two children are grown up and do not live with her anymore, she still helps them with some money and supports them in some ways. Even through the challenges, she remains an optimist. Her dream is so simple to be in good health, to work hard, and for the shop to be well-supplied so that her customers will be satisfied.

Latinka T. will use this loan of 1000 USD to buy 200 unique sets of children's clothes that she does not already supply in her shop.

loan.use: Working capital - 200 sets of children clothes

loan.name: Venko

texts.en:
Everybody in the town knows Venko K.. He is one of the most popular carpenters in the region. For 15 years he worked in the wood factory in town but 3 years ago, he decided to start his own business.

His workshop is on the first floor of the house he builds for 6 years. Venko K. makes any kind of woodwork furniture, doors, windows, frames. Smolian is close to one of the most popular winter resorts in Bulgaria and therefore lots of hotels and houses are being built nearby. So Venko has many orders for these buildings.

He works alone and nobody helps him but although the work is hard he is not complaining. All the money he earns he puts into the house he builds. There is still to much work until the house will be finished but his dream is to live there with his family.

loan.use: Buying wood for his work

loan.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa K. is a tailor for 20 years. First she worked for The Producers Co-operative Society in Smolian but when in 1992 it was closed she rented a part of the building and opened her own tailoring workshop.

She makes every kind of clothing but is well known with the folklore costumes that she makes. Because of the fact that she is in this business for such a long time Rosa is one of the most popular tailors in the town and has lots of clients. When there are too many orders she hires some other tailors to help her.

The problem that bothers her at the moment is the high rent that she pays for her workshop and that is why she dreams of her own and better equipped hall in which to set her atelier. Rosa has one more dream to design her own fashion line.

The loan will help her change her old sewing machine with a new one which will raise the quantity of her work.

loan.use: Buying a new sewing machine

loan.name: Velichka

texts.en:
Velichka S. keeps a small grocery in one of quarters of Smolian Ustovo. There are some other groceries in the quarter but her one is maybe the neatest and well-supplied. Her neighbours say that prices in the grocery are the lowest in the quarter.

Velichka S. graduated German language in University. Some years she worked as a German teacher in 11th classes but she was not satisfied and got quit of school. In 1997 she started her business. First she has kept a stall in the town but in 1999 she opened the grocery in Ustovo. On the stall now works her sister.

One of her biggest problems remains sales on credit. Although the dificulties she has no serious problems in collecting her debts.

Velichka will spend this 800 USD loan on buying wasing materials that she will supply in her grocery.

loan.use: Buying washing materials for the grocery

loan.name: Humberto Cesar

texts.en:
Humberto works in a restaurant and earns a fixed salary but it is not enough to cover the economic needs of his wife and two children. Nine years ago, he was under an economic depression and he needed to generate adittional income. This is the reason he started to invest in selling clothes.

His business has been growing with his wifes support and his income has been expanding. His children have been able to keep up their studies.

Nowadays he has a stand in the local market where he offers his merchandise, and with the unconditional support of his wife, he hopes his business continues to grow.

He is asking for a loan of $475 USD to pay over a term of 6-12 months because is a good season is coming. Christmas parties increase the demand of his products and he wants to be able to supply it.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

El Sr. Humberto es empleado de un Restaurante, sus ingresos son fijos, pero no son suficientes y tiene responsabilidades econmicas de una esposa y 2 hijos. Hace 9 aos senta que las presiones econmicas lo agobiaban por lo que era necesario buscar generar mas ingresos; fue as como empez a invertir en ropa para vender.

Con el apoyo de su esposa poco a poco fueron aumentando los clientes y mejorando los ingresos, gracias a ello, sus hijos han continuado sus estudios.

A la fecha ya cuenta con un puesto en un tianguis para ofrecer sus mercancas, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposa, por lo que espera que su negocio crezca todava mas.

Esta solicitando un crdito por la cantidad de $475 USD a 6-12 meses, pues se avecina una buena temporada, con las posadas y fiestas navideas, se incrementa la demanda de ropa, por lo que necesita estar preparado con suficiente mercanca.

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Isabel De La Caridad

texts.en:
She is a housewife and divorced with a daugther. Five years ago she had her child and she now has this responsability and every day she works hard to be able to supply her daugther with what she needs. The reason she started her business is because her daugther was a little girl and she did not want a full time job so she decided to sell clothes among her friends, because it would give her a flexible schedule.

In five years time, she feels satisfied because with her vision she has made her business grow and she is able to cover all the familys expenses and she is the source of the family income.

Isabel needs working capital to invest in merchandise because December is a very good season for selling her products. This is the reason she is asking for a loan of $650 USD to pay back in a term of 6-12 months.

She is convinced with this loan that she will be able to offer a great variety of products to her clients and will obtain a better profit.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Isabel es una ama de casa, divorciada y con una hija, hace 5 aos se quedo con esta responsabilidad y con la necesidad de sacarla adelante. Como su hija es pequea, no era posible trabajar en alguna dependencia por lo que decidi ponerse a vender ropa entre sus conocidos.

A 5 aos de distancia se siente muy satisfecha pues gracias a su visin ha logrado mantener adelante su microempresa, de ah sale para cubrir todos sus gastos, por lo que piensa seguir echndole ganas a su negocio pues es parte importante de su economa familiar.

Isabel necesita realizar inversiones pues en Diciembre son las mejores fechas para la venta de sus productos, es por lo anterior que esta solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de $650 USD el cual piensa pagar en 6-12 meses.

Esta convencida de que con esta inversin estar en condiciones de ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes y as poder mejorar sus mrgenes de ganancia.

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
Nine years ago, Maria Magdalena decided to enter into the cosmetic sales business. She is from Merida, Yucatan and her husband is a bricklayer. At the time that she started her business, her children were in school and, because of that, she needed to support her family's expenses and find an activity that let her take care of her children.

Initially, she received an invitation from a friend to sell cosmetics and little containers. She is happy because she is now independent and her business is a very important part of her family's economy. Her children continue to go to school and Maria wants to support them as much as she can.

She is requesting a loan of US$ 475 to be prepared for the season with enough merchandise.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Hace 9 aos Maria Magdalena tomo la decisin de dedicarse a la venta de cosmticos, ella es originaria de Mrida, Yucatn, y esta casada. Su esposo es obrero y como sus hijos estaban en edad escolar, haba la necesidad de apoyar con los gastos de la casa, pero tena que ser una actividad en la que se pudiese estar al pendiente de los hijos. Fue asi como acepto la invitacin de una amiga para comenzar a vender cosmticos y vasijas y se siente contenta pues con ello se siente independiente y forma parte importante de la economa familiar, sus hijos continan estudiando, y quiere apoyarlos lo mas que se pueda para que salgan adelante. Esta solicitando un crdito por la cantidad de US$475 a 6 meses, pues se avecina una buena temporada. Y necesita estar preparada con suficiente mercanca.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma made a decision to help her husband with the family expenses two years ago, and she started her business preparing cookies and meat pies that she sells to her neighbors and friends. Irmas family experienced an economic crisis because she has anemia and for this reason, she has a lot of medical expenses and also family expenses. However, she never falls down and she continues to fight because she is convinced that her suffering is something transitory. Irma is a very enthusiastic entrepreneur and has all the support of her husband who also knows how to cook the products. Irma is requesting a loan of US$475 with a promise to repay in 6 months. She plans to purchase raw materials because she needs to increase her production because in cold season her demand grows. She wants to run a successful business and she is thinking about putting a mark or special name as an image of her products. But she just needs a little more time and more sales first. Irma feels fortunate to have an activity that lets her do something good and also allows her to support her family.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Hace 2 aos Irma tomo la decisin de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares por lo que inici la elaboracin de galletas y empanadas que vende entre sus vecinos y amistades. La crisis econmica se les vino encima a raz de los problemas de salud, pues Irma padece anemia y constantemente tiene gastos mdicos que cubrir, para poder salir adelante; sin embargo ella no se desanima, pues esta convencida de que esto es algo transitorio. De hecho es una empresaria muy entusiasta, y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quin inclusive conoce el proceso de elaboracin de repostera. Irma est solicitando un crdito por la cantidad de US$475 a 6 meses para invertir en materia prima, necesita incrementar la produccin pues en temporada de fro se incrementa la demanda. Esta decidida a volver su negocio en una actividad exitosa, por lo que esta pensando en poner imagen a sus productos a travs de un nombre y la presentacin para la venta, solo necesita un poco de tiempo y que se venda cada vez mas su producto. Se siente afortunada de poder desarrollar una actividad que le permite realizarse y salir adelante con su familia.

loan.use: To purchase raw material to her business

loan.name: Maria Reyna

texts.en:
Maria Reyna is from Queretaro and her business is perfume sales. She sells her products door to door and gives credit to her clients. Maria has business with more than 50 people and they buy her merchandise frequently. She has two years of experience in this business.

Maria is married and has one daughter who has juvenile diabetes (she is 14 years old). This causes Maria to be dependent on the health of her daughter and also requires her to buy insulin for her daughter monthly.

Maria Reyna is requesting a loan of US$ 925 to invest in more merchandise in order to be prepared for the upcoming Christmas season. She has in mind a project to establish her own store because she is currently working at home.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Mara Reyna es originaria de Quertaro y se dedica a la comercializacin de Perfumes y esencias. Ella trabaja vendiendo casa por casa, su mercanca en abonos, y cuenta con una cartera de ms de 50 clientes, a quienes le surte sobre pedido la fragancia a veces perfume de marca, en ocasiones esencia de perfume. Cuenta con mas de 2 aos de experiencia como comerciante, esta casada y tiene una hija con diabetes juvenil (14 aos), esto ha ocasionado que Mara Reyna, tenga que estar al pendiente de la salud de su hija y tener que gastar mensualmente en la compra de insulina. Mara Reyna esta solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de US$ 925 a 6 meses para poder surtirse y estar preparada para las ventas de la temporada navidea que se avecina. Tiene como proyecto a futuro poder establecerse mas formalmente pues ahora trabaja en su propio domicilio y vende casa por casa su mercanca.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marinas business is cosmetics sales by catalogue and she has 5 years of experience in this activity. She is married, her husband is a bricklayer, and they have four sons. Because these sons are all young, family expenses are high and Marina decided to help her husband by starting her business.

A friend of Marina's invited her five years ago to start her business and now she is seeing the results of her sales. If she invites other people who want to be in cosmetics sales into her business she can earn a little bit more money.

Marina comments that she has to be prepared for this season and for this reason she needs a loan of US$ 925 to invest in her business. She will purchase merchandise and believes that her sales will increase by 50%

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Marina se dedica a la venta de cosmticos por catalogo, tiene 5 aos de experiencia en esta actividad, esta casada, su esposo es obrero y tiene 4 hijos. Todos sus hijos son menores, por lo que los gastos familiares son altos, es por eso que decidido apoyar a su esposo y tomo la decisin vender cosmticos, una amiga la invito y a 5 aos ahora ve los resultados gana por sus ventas y si ingresa personas que tambin quieran iniciar en las ventas gana un poco mas. Comenta que se tiene que preparar para la temporada de Diciembre, es por este motivo que necesita un prstamo pues la mercanca la tiene que comprar de contado y ella tiene que fiar a los clientes por lo que ocupa un crdito por la cantidad de $925 a 6 meses. Con esta inversin sus ventas podrn mejorar hasta en un 50% e igual sus ganancias, adems contar con muy buen inventario para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Ampara De Jesus

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Amparo, and I make and sell bedding, curtains, cushions, and other accessories for the house. Ive had my small workshop for four years, and its helped me support my family. Currently, I only work with requests from clients, who are store owners. My dream is to make my business grow and be able to hire people to help me make clothes. This is why I need to increase my inventory so I can offer new designs and color variety.

Loan Use: Purchase fabrics, thread, lace, zippers, pins, buttons, sponge, flannel.

SPANISH
Hola me llamo Amparo y me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de ropa de cama, cortinas, cojines y otros accesorios de hogar. Tengo cuatro aos de tener mi pequeo taller el que me ha ayudado a sostener a mi familia, actualmente solo trabajo por encargos de clientes que tengo dueos de tiendas y almacenes. Mi sueo es hacer crecer mi negocio poder contratar a otras personas que me ayuden a confeccionar la ropa, es por eso que necesito surtir mas el inventario para poder ofrecer modelos nuevos y en variedad de colores.

loan.use: Tela, hilo, encajes, zipper, broches, botones, esponja, franela.

loan.name: Evelin Margarita

texts.en:
My name is Evelin Margarita. In my community, Im known as Margarita the tortilla lady. Thats because I make and sell corn tortillas. I open my store at 6 a.m. and I close at 8 p.m. I make tortillas three times a day, around every meal during the day. Ive had my business for five years, and its been going very well. Ive been able to help my family with the profits.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, lime, wood, and others.

Mi nombre es Evelin Margarita en mi comunidad me conocen como Margarita la tortillera, es porque me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas de maiz, abro mi negocio a las 6:00 am y lo cierro a las 8:00 pm, hago tortillas 3 veces al dia para cada tiempo de comida. Tengo 5 aos de tenerlo y me ha ido muy bien, ya que de las ganancias he podido ayudar a mi familia.

loan.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, lea y otros.

loan.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Ive had my food business for five years. I offer breakfast, lunch, dinner, and also sweets, depending on what my clients request. Right now Im starting to sell ready-to-cook chicken, which is sold pretty quickly, and that way I have an extra income. My business has grown because I have clients from office buildings in the area who buy meal packages from me. My income has increased, allowing me to cover my childrens education and my familys expenses. Currently, I have one employee helping me, and Im planning on hiring another one so Im able to sell more. That way, well improve our quality of life.

Loan Use: Purchase of sausage, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, beans, cheese, and others.

Tengo cinco aos de tener mi negocio, me dedico a la venta de comidas como desayunos, almuerzos, cenas y golosinas, dependiendo de lo que pida mi clientela. En este momento estoy iniciando a vender pollo crudo, que se vende bastante rapido y obtengo otro ingreso. Mi negocio ha crecido debido a que tengo clientes de oficinas cerca de mi negocio a quienes les vendo los tiempos de comidas. Mis ingresos han mejorado por lo que he podido cubrir con la educacion de mis hijos y cubrir con los gastos de nuestra familia. Actualmente tengo una muchacha que me ayuda, pero voy a contratar otra para poder vender mas y de esta manera mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.

loan.use: Compra de chorizo, tomates, chiles, cebollas, frijoles, queso y otros.

loan.name: Yesica Guadalupe

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Yesica. I have a small store in my home. I sell breakfast meals and other sweets according to my clients likes. Ive had this business for three years. Ive had earnings that have allowed me to, little by little, build my home and give my children an education. Currently, I want to make a small room in the house larger, so I can put tables and chairs there, and offer my clients a place to eat my tasty meals.

Loan Use: Purchase tortillas, cheese, eggs, beans, butter, and others.

Hola me llamo Yesica, tengo un pequeo negocio en mi casa, vendo desayunos y otras golosinas segun el gusto de mis clientes, tengo 3 aos de dedicarme a este negocio, con el que he tenido ganancias y poco a poco contruir mi casa y darles una educacion a mis hijos. Actualmente estoy queriendo ampliar una pequea pieza de mi casa para colocar algunas sillas y mesas para atender a mis clientes y personas que quieran degustar mi rica comida.

loan.use: Compra de tortillas, quesillo, huevos, frijoles, mantequilla y otros.

loan.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
For five years, I've been dedicated to the purchase of bed clothes, shoes, clothes to people and clients of offices that I visit. Thanks to my business I have been able to support my daughter, since I am unmarried mother. Christmas is approaching, so from November to December I need a loan in order to fill my inventory. This way I will have the variety needed to meet the needs of my customers!

SPANISH
Tengo cinco aos de dedicarme a la compra de ropa de cama, zapatos, ropa en general y la vendo a personas y clientes de oficinas que visito, mis ventas las hago de contado y al credito. Gracias a mi negocio he podido mantener a mi hija, ya que soy madre soltera. En este momento se acerca la epoca de navidad en la que desde Noviembre comienzo a vender mas mercaderia, por lo que necesito tener variedad de producto y poder suplir las necesidades de mis clientes.

loan.use: Compra de juegos de ropa de cama, sartenes, zapatos, ropa de hombre y mujer.

loan.name: Socorro Maribel

texts.en:
In my area I have been selling tortillas for several years. I am unmarried mother and selling tortillas helps me to have to my children studying and with basic household expenses. I also contracted a girl that helps me sell the tortillas on a daily basis.

At this moment I am trying to finish constructing our house, and this has become difficult for me because I don't have the raw materials needed to finish the construction. This has slowed down my tortilla production. I need the loan so that I can finish my house and further the business.

SPANISH

En mi colonia me llaman Socorro, todos me conocen porque vendo tortillas desde hace varios aos. Soy madre soltera y el vender tortillas me ayuda a tener a mis hijos estudiando y con los gastos familiares. En este momento estoy tratando de terminar de construir nuestra casa, que se me ha dificultado por no tener materia prima para producir mas tortillas. Recien contrate a una muchacha para que me ayude con la venta de mis tortillas, y se que voy a crecer gracias a los esfuerzos familiares y apoyo que me brinden.

loan.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal y otros

loan.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a single mother who has a six years old son. Ten years ago due to her income, Clara started to sell food in her house. Clients began to ask her for more diverse merchandise and she had to invest in different products like bread, milk, soups, etc. In a short time she had a general store in front of her house.

Clara's business is the only income for her family and, for this reason, she knows that she must have a full stock of different products and a clean store.

In order to achieve this, she is requesting a loan of US$ 750 and offers to pay this loan in 6 months. Clara needs this loan to purchase merchandise to continue supporting her son in a honest way and, with this loan, she can increase her sales and give her clients better service.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Clara, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 6 aos. Desde hacer aproximadamente 10 aos por cuestiones econmicas empez a vender en su casa frituras y refrescos, los clientes empezaron a llegar y a solicitarle mas mercanca por lo que invirti en pan, leche, sopas, etc, hasta llegar a tener una tienda bien surtida en el frente de su casa. El negocio es su nica fuente de ingresos por lo que esta conciente de que siempre tiene que tenerlo bien surtido y con muy buena presentacin. Es por eso que esta solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de US$750 a 6 meses para compra de mercancas. Su tienda le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos de una manera digna con trabajo y constancia. Con el prstamo podr incrementar sus ventas, darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y como consecuencia obtener mayores utilidades.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.en:
Ive had my small business for five years. I make and sell tortillas. I have set clients that pay me daily, weekly or monthly. My business has improved over time, and I am glad to now be able to help my children with their education. I didnt have a chance to study a career, so I want them to be have the opportunity to become professionals, and improve their quality of life.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, lime, wood, and others.

Tengo cinco aos de tener mi pequea empresa de elaboracion y venta de tortillas, mis clientes son fijos ya que algunos me pagan diario, semanal o mensual. Mi negocio ha mejorado con el tiempo y me alegra ya que ahora puedo ayudarles a mis hijos con sus estudios, yo no tuve la oportunidad de estudiar asi que quiero que ellos puedan ser profesionales y que mejoren su nivel de vida.

loan.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, lea y otros

loan.name: Maria Alicia

texts.en:
A typical dish in our country is the nacatamales accompanied by a cup of cafe well calientitos, I dedicate myself to the elaboration of rich nacatamales that I distribute in some small markets, restaurants and neighbors that order the ends to me week, in epoca navidea but they are looked for since all the people eat nacatamales. I hope to be able to continue selling but to help to my children in its university races.

Nacatamales are a delicious meal enjoyed by Nicaraguans. Usually eaten for late Sunday breakfasts, this dish is normally served with buttered toast or tortillas and coffee. You can enjoy Nacatamales from home by following these simple recipe and instructions.

SPANISH

Un plato tipico en nuestro pais son los nacatamales acompaados de una taza de cafe bien calientitos, me dedico a la elaboracion de ricos nacatamales que distribuyo en algunos mercaditos, restaurantes y vecinos que me encargan los fines de semana, en la epoca navidea son los mas buscados ya que todas las personas comen nacatamales. Espero poder seguir vendiendo mas para ayudar a mis hijos en sus carreras universitarias.

loan.use: Hoja de huerta, amarre, harina de maiz, manteca, sal, especias, cubitos, papas y otros

loan.name: Maria Blanca

texts.en:
By my age no longer I can work in a large company, so I needed to start my own business. I sell sweets, fruits and treats in one of the main streets of my community. The majority people in my town are clients and they usually buy candies first. This way, I can cover the medical expenses for me and my family as well as my house. At this moment I want to buy grapes, apples to begin to sell this Christmas season. I am sure that this will really help sales this year.

SPANISH

Por mi edad ya no puedo trabajar en alguna empresa asi que decidi dedicarme a mi propio negocio, vendo dulces, frutas y golosinas en una de las principales calles de mi comunidad, que esta ubicada frente a la Alcaldia por lo que es bastante transitada. La mayoria de personas son clientes quienes me estiman y me compran dulces todos los dias de esta manera puedo obtener dinero para cubrir mis gastos medicos, alimento y casa. En este momento quiero comprar uvas, manzanas para comenzar a vender en epoca navidea, estoy segura que me ira mejor en mis ventas.

loan.use: Compra de churros, dulces, galletas, uvas, manzanas y otros.

loan.name: Wilmer

texts.en:
Wilmer is a butcher and owns a small stand where he sells beef. His father taught him the family trade over 35 years ago and had him help him in his shop. Wilmer eventually started his own business but about 8 years ago his store caught on fire and he has not been able to buy a new place to sell from. Therefore, Wilmer has been selling meat from a table and a stand that he made himself. He is need of a loan so that he may begin to buy different kinds of meats including poultry and fish. He wants to increase his revenue so he can save money for a new store. His goal is to increase his profits and buy a new refrigerator for leftover meats. For the time being he can only buy amounts he knows he will sell because he does not have sufficient storage for leftovers. He believes that having the flexibility to generate more revenue he will eventually be able to have a store of his own again and he will be able to provide a better living to his three children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy a larger variety of meats including poultry and fish

loan.name: Haydee Argentina

texts.en:
My name is Haydee and for many years I have been selling clothes for girls, boys and for people that ride horses. Right now, I need to vary my inventory because Christmas approaches and all my clients buy clothes for me and their children. With the income that it generates to me my business I have been able to move my daughters ahead in school. I feel very proud because they are good students and they help me in the house when I leave to sell. I want to be able to improve my house and to continue helping to them so that they can graduate.

SPANISH

Me llamo Haydee y tengo algunos aos de dedicarme a la venta de ropa para nio, dama y caballero, en este momento necesito variar mi inventario porque se acerca la Navidad es una epoca en la que todos mis clientes me compran ropa para sus hijos. Con las ganacias que me genera mi negocio he podido sacar adelante a mis hijas que estan estudiando en escuelas y de las que me siento muy orgullosa porque son buenas estudiantes y me ayudan en la casa cuando yo salgo a vender. Quiero poder mejorar mi casa y seguirles ayudando para que puedan graduarse.

loan.use: Compra de ropa interior para dama, caballero y nio.

loan.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario has a stand in the local market where he sells fruits and vegetables. He started the business over 15 years ago after working at a fruit stand with his uncle. With $30 dollars he was able to set up a stand and with money from loan sharks he was able to buy the fruit. He works an early schedule from 5:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. with the support of his wife. This stand is the only the source of income for his family and has provided enough for them to buy a small home and barely enough to send his kids to school. He says that there is certainly enough demand to sell more fruit but he does not have the money to purchase higher quantities. For this reason he has approached Mifex and Kiva for a loan.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy a larger variety of fruits and vegetables for his stand

loan.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Don Miguel is a vendor who has recently moved to the city after living most of his life in rural Ecuador in a town named Quevedo. Although Don Miguel and his wife are older they refuse to be burdens to their children who do not make much money. They purchase certain fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices from his town and take them into the city. They also bring goods from the city back to Quevedo where they can resell them for a profit. He travels back and forth about twice a week and is happy with his business. He is requesting this loan in order to buy more products to sell in his home town of Quevedo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy goods to sell in rural sectors of Ecuador

payment.comment: Pago su credito total. aplica para un segundo.

loan.name: Elsa Lilia

texts.en:
Before she had her own business, Elsa was working in a business that made jewelry from stones and crystals. She began as an auxiliary to her boss in this business and learned this activity.

Elsa is married and has two children. She started to work because she needed to support her family's expenses. Unfortunately, two years ago her husband had legal troubles that sent him to prison (where he still is) and because of this Elsa had to support her family expenses by herself. After her husband left, she needed more income and quit her job to start her own business manufacturing and selling custom jewelry. She did this because she could increase her income this way.

Fortunately she has a good time with her business and now needs to invest in raw materials. For this reason she is requesting a loan of US$ 650. She comments that with this loan she could increase the number and variety of products that will help her to increase her sales and her family income.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Anteriormente Elsa trabajaba en un negocio que se dedica a la elaboracin de joyas de piedras y cristales, comenz como ayudante, pues esta persona maneja grandes volmenes, all aprendi el oficio. Elsa esta casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad; comenz a trabajar pues necesitaba apoyar con los gastos familiares, pero lamentablemente hace 2 aos, su esposo se vio envuelto en un problema legal que lo mantiene en la crcel; por lo que ella quedo a cargo de la manutencin de sus hijos. Esto provoco que buscara independizarse y crear su propio negocio de elaboracin de joyera de fantasa, pues as podra generar mayores ingresos. Afortunadamente le ha ido bien y a la fecha necesita hacer inversiones por lo que esta solicitando apoyo por la cantidad de US$ 650 que puede pagar a 6 meses, para comprar materia primar para elaborar sus joyas. Con el prstamo desea incrementar la variedad de sus productos y consecuentemente mejorar sus ventas y su ingreso familiar.

loan.use: To purchase raw materials

loan.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline has three sons and approximately four years ago her husband went to the United States looking for better opportunities. Unfortunately, she never learned what happened to him and has not heard anything. With all of the responsibility of taking care of three sons and sending them to school, Jacqueline had to generate economic resources to survive. Her family gave her some money to invest in a business and she started to make tamales and sell them to her friends.

Fortunately, Jacqueline has been well accepted by her clients and she has had the business now for 4 years. Her business is the the only income she has. With her income she can offer the minimum support and education to her family.

At this moment, Jacqueline needs to purchase on volume to take advantage of the lower costs. She needs a loan of US$ 475 to repay over 6 months. With this loan she will increase her sales and obtain better utilities at the end of the year.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Jacqueline es una madre de familia con 3 hijos. Hace aproximadamente 4 aos, su esposo sali de casa con la idea de buscar mejores oportunidades en los Estados Unidos, desafortunadamente, la Sra. Jacqueline no ha tenido noticias de l, desde entonces. Con la responsabilidad de 3 hijos en edad escolar, se vio en la necesidad de generar recursos para poder sobrevivir, su familia le ofreci ayuda econmica para que se pusiera a hacer algo, por lo que se puso a elaborar tamales y venderlos entre sus conocidos. Afortunadamente tuvo buena aceptacin, y ya tiene 4 aos con esta, que es su nica fuente de ingresos, con lo que gana en su negocio, puede ofrecer lo ms bsico y educacin a sus hijos. En estos momentos Jacqueline necesita realizar compras en volumen para aprovechar costos de oportunidad pues al comprar ms, le bajan los precios, es por lo anterior que ocupa un prstamo por la cantidad de US$475para pagarlos en 6 mensualidades. Con esta inversin estar en condiciones de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ganancias a finales de este ao.

loan.use: To purchase raw material

loan.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a married woman with a husband that works in a factory in town. In 2002, they had serious economic problems and, because her husband was a worker, they were not able to pay off their debt. For this reason, Flor had to think of something to do to generate income that would allow her to also take care her children.

Pedro Escobedo is a cold weather city and Flor started to sell Bedspreads and down quilt because she thought it was a very good opportunity. Then, she began to sell these articles to her neighbors and husbands friend.

Flor formed groups of ten persons and each one gave her 10% of the cost of the article that they wanted to buy each week. Through this, Flor could purchase merchandise and each week she would give one of the products to a person through a lottery.

Flor knows that if she wants to earn more money she should invest more. It is for that reason that she is requesting a loan of US$ 925. With this loan she could be prepared to sell more products next winter.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Flor esta casada, y su esposo trabaja en una fabrica de la localidad. En el 2002 tuvieron serios problemas econmicos y siendo su esposo obrero no podan cubrir las deudas contradas. Por este motivo ella busco alguna actividad que le permitiera obtener ingresos, pero que al mismo tiempo le pudiese estar al cuidado de sus hijos. Siendo Pedro Escobedo una ciudad con clima fresco y fro, pues vender Colchas y Edredones es una buena opcin, as pues entre sus vecinos y con los compaeros de trabajo de su esposo empez a vender esta clase artculos. Como carece de recursos implemento un sistema de ventas a manera de Tandas en donde, forma grupos de 10 personas, cada persona debe aportar por semana la dcima parte del costo del artculo que quiere comprar, y con esto, Flor puede comprar la mercanca y as darle vuelta al dinero pues como se rifa la entrega de los productos, solo entrega un artculo por semana. Sin embargo esta consciente de que para poder generar mas ingresos necesita invertir ms, es por este motivo que esta solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de US$ 925 a 6 meses, con el cual podr estar preparada para las ventas en el prximo invierno.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Francisco C. Puente has dedicated the past 7 years to the production of construction blocks. At the beginning, he made the block manually. He used to mix and compress Portland cement and sand, this process demanded extreme physical effort. At the present time he has machinery, but the electrical motor is currently broken and he needs to fix it. Until he is able to fix it, Mr. C. is now making the block by hand again. This problem has diminished the production. Mr. C. is asking for a loan of $900. He would like to pay it back in 6 months. This amount will be used to repair the motor and buy raw material. This will allow him to work faster and increase his block production business.

ESPANOL

El Sr. Francisco Puente C. se ha dedicado durante 7 aos al produccin y venta de block para la construccin. En un principio l mismo lo hacia manualmente que consiste en el prensado de dos materiales bsicos: arena y cemento. El proceso era manual, lo que exiga un desgaste fsico extremo. Actualmente cuenta con equipo mecanizado para la hechura del block, pero el motor elctrico que hace funcionar el equipo de elaboracin se averi y estn haciendo nuevamente el proceso manualmente, lo que ha disminuido su produccin. El Sr. Francisco Puente solicita un prestamo por $900.00 USD para reparar el motor y para comprar materia prima que le permita tener mas inventario y surtir los pedidos, el piensa pagar en 6 meses.

loan.use: motor repair and raw materials

loan.name: Rumen

texts.en:
Rumen V. is 36 years old. During his whole life he has been in restaurant business. 15 years he has been a waiter in some of the most popular summer resorts on northern sea coast of Bulgaria Golden Sands, Albena, Balchik, Kranevo.

Two years ago he has decided to open his own coffee shop in his native home town Silistra. When he first found the place where his coffee shop now is it was seedy and untended. Rumen has put much efforts to make this place one of the most popular and cosy cafes in the town.

Now the caf is overcrowded and Rumen has many regular and devoted clients. Since the coffee shop is very small and has just 6 tables Rumen is considered to set up an outside space which will be very useful during summer months. And that is the initiative for which he applies for this 1000 USD loan.

loan.use: to set up an outside space of the cafe

loan.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Loacted within the Central Piata (Market) in Balti one can find anything their heart desire and attracts people from all over the north of Moldova. Balti is the 2nd biggest city in Moldova or also called the capitol of the North and this is where one can find Valentina I.. She is 48 years old, married with two kids and has worked her stall by herself for the past four years. Her husband and older son work half the year in Moscow as construction workers.
Valentina likes to think of Balti as a fashionable city, and this reflects in the cloths which she sells. Geared towards many ages with her eclectic range of clothing she tries to caters to the students who attend the local university to older professional working women into her stall. She noticed when she started her business that there were too many other stalls just selling jeans and sweaters and she had to be different and diversify in order to succeed.
Her goal for the future is to one day move to a better location within the market. Her current stand is located in an unpaved and over crowded section. For now, she would like to secure a loan through Kiva to purchase jackets for the coming winter. Last year she had to wait to buy jackets till her fall clothing sold to raise the capitol necessary and it was one of the worst winters people could remember, the temperature dropped as low as -30 Celsius. This year she would like to be prepared and beat the competition by buying the jackets early.

loan.use: To purchase 30 jackets for retail.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To improve on the business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To add stock to the business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To increase stock of drugs.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To increase stock.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To increase stock

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To increase stock.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To add stock.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To increase stock.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Hannah wants to buy two young bulls

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To improve on his stock.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To increase stock.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Jerusha wants to buy a bale of used clothes.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To increase stock of produce.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Alice would like to buy animal feeds to increase productivity.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Gladwell wants to buy different types of spices.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Mercy wants to start a retail shop, which sells household products.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Mary wants to buy animal feeds

loan.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores has a food business selling gorditas and tacos. She sells these products at home and also delivers to offices near her house. In 1998 her husband left her and she was responsible for taking care of her three children alone. Currently, her older daughter is 11 years old.

Dolores always worked doing housework and the first thing that came to her mind was to sell food because that was an activity she knew very well. So, she started her business selling food and now her children help her in the business as delivery persons and doing food preparation at home.

Dolores needs a loan of US$ 725 because she wants to purchase raw material in volume to obtain lower costs from her supplier. She needs to take advantage of this because it will allow her to have higher income. She promises to pay this loan in 8 months, at least.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Dolores tiene un negocio de alimentos: gorditas y tacos, los cuales vende en su domicilio y hace entrega en oficina cercanas. En 1998 sufri el abandono de su pareja y se quedo con la responsabilidad de 3 hijos, en ese entonces su hija mayor tenia 11 aos apenas. Dedicada a las labores propias del hogar, lo primero que se le vino en mente fue vender alimentos actividad que por genero ella sabe hacer muy bien. Fue as, como para sacar adelante a su familia desde entonces, vende Tacos y Gorditas, ahora sus hijos la apoyan en el negocio, tanto en la elaboracin como la entrega. A la fecha necesita un crdito pues si compra materia prima en volumen sus proveedores le bajan los costos, y ella necesita aprovechar esta oportunidad pues le representara mayores utilidades. Es por lo anterior que esta solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de $725 a 8 meses.

loan.use: To purchase raw material for her business

loan.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matildes husband worked as a truck driver but in 2000 he was fired. Because of this, economic problems appeared for Matilde's family.

Matilde's husband did not get a job and Matilde knew how to build bricks so she told him that it was necessary to build a furnace in her house to make the bricks. They invested part of the money they had and started their microbusiness. Matilde has three sons and now everyone in her house knows how to build bricks because they all work together in the business.

Matilde is requesting a loan of US$ 925 to invest in raw material. She comments that if she invests right now she could be prepared for December and January because these months increase her demand according to her past experience.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

El esposo de Matilde se desempeaba como Trailero, pero en el ao 2000 lo desemplearon y con ello se vinieron los problemas econmicos. No lograba volver a contratarse con ninguna empresa. Matilde conoca el oficio de fabricacin de ladrillos, por lo que lo convenci para construir un horno en el patio de su casa y ponerse a fabricar ladrillos. Fue as como invirtiendo parte de la liquidacin iniciaron su microempresa. Tiene 3 hijos y ahora todos conocen el oficio de la fabricacin de tabiques, pues todos trabajan en el negocio. Matide esta solicitando apoyo para poder invertir en materias primas, necesita un crdito por la cantidad de US$925 el cual piensa pagar en 6 meses. Esta inversin le permitir solventar la inversin inicial, pues existe todo un proceso de fabricacin y hacia diciembre y enero, la demanda aumenta, por lo que necesitan estar preparados con suficiente mercanca. Comenta que la experiencia de aos anteriores le ha enseado a sacar ventaja de la oportunidad que se le presenta.

loan.use: To purchase raw material

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Six years ago, Maria Elena decided to use the first room of her house for a business and installed shelves. She used her savings and a lot of effort to invest in merchandise to open a general store. She made this decision because she is married and has 9 children. Her husband works as a worker and his salary is not enough to cover their family expenses.

Maria Elena feels that all of her efforts in her business have helped her to find her business vocation and personal realization. All her families work in the store helping her in different types of labors and all of them have benefited the business.

Maria Elena is requesting a loan of US$ 925 to purchase merchandise because she is sure that if there was more merchandise that her clients could see, they would buy more.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Hace 6 aos Mara Elena, decidi utilizar la primera habitacin de su casa, para acondicionarla con estantera y con sus ahorros y un gran esfuerzo invirti en mercancas para poner una tienda de abarrotes. Tomo esta decisin pues esta casada y tiene 9 hijos su esposo se desempea como obrero y su sueldo no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos familiares. Siente que a travs de su trabajo y tenacidad ha encontrado su vocacin comercial y su realizacin personal. Toda su familia participa, en la tienda la apoyan en la atencin a clientes, acomodo de mercancas, surtido de pedidos, pues les comenta que todos obtienen beneficios con el negocio. Esta interesada en obtener un prstamo por la cantidad de $925 a 6 meses pues asegura que mientras ms mercanca ven los clientes, ms compran.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
When Maria Guadalupe was young she was working as an employee in a general store and she knew how to manage this business well, so later this skill was very useful to her. She got married and had 4 sons, but unfortunately, 8 years ago her husband started to drink more frequently and he never could leave the alcohol. Maria Guadalupe or their sons could not rescue him. He lost his job and his family did not have enough income to survive, so at this moment Maria Guadalupe made a decision to start her own business to keep her family alive. As she already knew how to run a general store, she decided to open one. She needs a loan of US$ 475 to purchase merchandise and she offers to pay the loan back in 6 months. She also comments that all cash pay in merchandise will be better prices and she can obtain more income and grow.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

De joven Mara Guadalupe trabajo como empleada en una tienda, por lo que conoci el oficio, que mas tarde le seria til para salir adelante. Resulta que se caso y tuvo 4 hijos pero desafortunadamente hace 8 aos su esposo empez a beber cada vez con ms frecuencia hasta convertirse en una enfermedad de la que ni ella ni sus hijos lo han podido rescatar. Ante esta situacin, perdi el empleo y la familia resinti en los ingresos familiares, fue cuando Mara Guadalupe orillada por la situacin tomo la decisin de poner un negocio para poder sobrevivir, conociendo el oficio se inclino por la tienda de abarrotes. Ella trabaja en su casa, en la parte de entrada coloco anaqueles y estantera que ahora vende entre sus vecinos. Esta solicitando un crdito por la cantidad de US$475 para invertir en mercancas, piensa que lo puede pagar en 6 meses. Comenta que al comprar mercanca de contado pueden mejorarle el precio as ella obtendr ms ganancia y con esto poder seguir abastecindose.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Edwin Edgardo

texts.en:
