Margaret has saved and 100,000/= and has also recently started selling beads she makes from paper at home through the LiA CAN! export coop, which has increased her monthly income to a point that she feels comfortable servicing a loan. Therefore she is seeking loan amount of 800,000/= to top up her saving so that she can take this big step of building her own home. Below is her budget:

1000 bricks @ 50 .......50,000/=

15 bags of cement @ 18,000.270,000/=

1 trip of sand@ 60,000/- ..60,000/=

12 iron sheets of 32 gauge @ 11,000 = 1320 00/=

20 roofing poles @ 1400...28,000/=

Labor.....................150,000/=

2doors @ 30,000 ......... 60,000/=

2 windows @ 15000/=.......30,000/=

Transport.................70,000/=

Kcc charges...............10,000/=

Water.....................10,000/=

Roofing nails 2kgs @ 5000.10,000/=

Other nails 2kgs @ 3000...6,000/

Other expenses...........14,000/=

-Total ...................900,000

loan.use: construction materials and labor

payment.comment:

Margaret was able to recover from some earlier financial challenges, and made a final repayment on her loan in Dec 2008

loan.name: Balex

texts.en:
O. Balex came to Kampala in 0ctober 2004 when his elder brother was killed by rebels and their houses and properties burnt down! As a result he had to run away from Northern Uganda to Kampala for the safety of his life. Things have not been so favorable for him in Kampala, which pushed him to take up a security job that bears nothing but risks of life! Not forgetting the mega income.

By Gods grace Balex came across life in Africa, which he joined as a part-time gardener, and that became a great opportunity for him. Along side his gardening work, Balex has also been involved in arts and crafts production and quality control. He's also been able to join the Internet4Change program, where he's learning how to create blogs and loan applications for other members. In October, he was offered a full time position at Life in Africa as an assistant to the newly appointed Director of Ugandan Communities (Kiva borrower Grace Ayaa). After years of feeling alone and hopeless in life, young Balex now has direction and purpose.

As an ambition, Balex has saved 200,000/= that he plans to use for building a three roomed family house on a plot of land that he acquired from the king of Buganda. This is intended to solve the pressure from the landlord and also help him provide for his future wife and children. To complete this project, Balex is seeking a loan amount of 800,000/=.

Below is his budget in detail.

15 bags of cement @ 18,000/= .........270,000/=

1500 bricks @ 50/= ....................75,000/=

2 trips of sand and transport@ 60,000.120,000/=

Labor ................................250,000/=

12 iron sheets of 32 gauge @ 11,000...123,000/=

20 roofing timbers @ 5000.............100,000/=

Lime 4 bags @ 18,000...................72,000/=

2 wooden doors @ 50,000...............100,000/=

2 glass windows @ 50,000/.............100,000/=

2kgs of roofing nails @ 5000...........10,000/=

2kgs of 6icn nails @ 3000................6000/=

Water @ ...............................10,000/=

City Council charges....................5,000/=

Other transport costs..................21,000/=

Total...............................1,000,000/=

loan.use: Building materials and labor

loan.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
My name is Alejandro V.. I have been working for 40 years as a carpenter. I love this job, and I learned it from my father. From that time I have made several types of wood furniture, like kitchens, doors and cabinets. I feel a great satisfaction because I had the opportunity to provide a college education to my son, thanks to this business. But I still have responsibilities with my family and new projects to make.

I would like to start making wood moldings. There is a good demand in the local market, but I need to buy new machinery to make them. This is why I require an industrial winch. Im planning to obtain this equipment through a loan of $1200 and to pay back in a term of 1 year. With this new machinery I can make a new product, grow the business, and give a better life to my family

Spanish

Mi nombre es Alejandro V. me dedico a la carpintera desde hace mas de 40 aos siento un gusto especial por este oficio, el cual aprend de mi padre, desde ese tiempo he fabricado varias clases de muebles de madera as como cocinas, puertas y gabinetes. Siento un a gran satisfaccin por haber proporcionado una carrera profesional a mi hijo gracias a este negocio, pero aun tengo responsabilidades con mi familia y nuevos proyectos que cumplir, como la elaboracin de molduras de madera, las cuales requieren de un torno Industrial el cual planeo conseguir a travs de un prstamo de $1200.00 y pagarlos en un plazo de 1 ao, con ello podr elaborar un producto diferente en el mercado, el cual tiene mucha demanda y proporcionar mejores condiciones de vida para mi familia.

loan.use: buy machinery and raw materials

loan.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria M. M. is a single mother. She has a small coffee shop inside an elementary school here in Nuevo Laredo. Her menu is tacos, burritos, corn, juice, soda and some snacks, and she sells her food to the students at lunch time. She wants to incorporate more healthy food for the students instead of only snacks, and this is why she is applying for a loan of $900. With this money she will buy more ingredients to make healthy snacks and give a better option to the students and this will also increase her family income.

Espaol

La Sra. Candelaria Martnez Martnez es Madre soltera y tiene una pequea tiendita en una escuela primaria de Nuevo Laredo en la cual les vende alimentos a los estudiantes (como tacos, lonches, fritos, elotes, refrescos, jugos y etc.) en la hora de recreo. Ella quiere elaborar comida ms saludable para los estudiantes de la escuela y con esto generar un mejor ingreso para su familia, incrementando sus ventas y dando mejores opciones de alimentacin a los estudiantes, por ello solicita un prstamo de $900.00 con los cuales pretende comprar los ingredientes para su proyecto. Este crdito piensa pagarlo en un ao y generar un mejor ingreso familiar.

loan.use: healthy food

loan.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a married mother of three who works in Guayaquil, Ecuador running a small restaurant which serves traditional Ecuadorian breakfast, lunch and afternoon snack called merienda. Ms. D. was faced with starting her own business to bring in extra income or else her family would surely go hungry. Because her husband only contributes a modest salary, Vera relied on her mother who lives in New York to send money, so that this young entrepreneur could open her restaurant. It has been twelve years, and slowly Veras place has grown. Her clients are very loyal, as she has them hooked on her tasty breakfasts. Above all, Ms. D. says that she loves her job because she gets do to what she loves cook and make people happy. She employs three people who are all single mothers, and they all work together from 7a.m. until 9p.m. at "La Flipper" together. Vera is applying for this loan so that she can purchase stock inventory like rice, sugar, oil as well as utensils like dishes and pots. If she buys in cash, she can receive big discounts from the wholesalers, instead of buying each item separately on a daily basis. Vera has taken out loans from loan sharks in the past who charge 20% monthly, and now she has been given a unique opportunity to grow her business and support her family affordably.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Vera is applying for this loan so that she can purchase stock inventory like rice, sugar, oil as well as utensils like dishes and pots.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Lillian wants to buy hair chemicals and manicure sets

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Joyce wants to buy 4sacks of sugar, 3sacks of flour, 5boxes of soap and 100kg of cooking fat.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Nelly wants to buy a dairy cow

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To Transform her retail shop to a wholesale shop

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Loan Use: Increase stock of Soft drinks,Peanuts,Cigarettes

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: cathrine wants to rent a plot of land to be growing rice instead of buying

loan.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is a married woman, has three children and she isdistinguished by being active and hard working. She started her business three years ago. She likes cooking and prepares unbeleivable Tamales." In order to support to her husband with the familys expenses, she needed to generate an adittional income because her husband is a merchant in the flea market and his income is variable. For that reason, her business is becoming important to her family and is contributing and supporting the education of her son, who is in high school. She needs a loan of $ 250 USD to be able to supply the raw materials such as meat, sheets corn, spices and condiments in order to be prepare and be able to supply her clients who have increased their orders this next season. She is requesting a 3-6 months term to pay back her loan.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Adriana es una mujer casada que tiene tres hijos y se distingue por ser muy activa y trabajadora. Hace tres aos que ella inici su negocio de elaboracin de tamales y venta de zapatos teniendo como objetivo ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ya que tenia necesidad de generar ingresos adicionales, pues su esposo es comerciante en los mercados rodantes y tiene ingresos que son muy variables y es por ello que su negocio se ha vuelto importante para la familia pues as complementan los gastos y contribuyen a la educacin de su hijo que esta estudiando la preparatoria. Actualmente ella tiene la necesidad de un prstamo por $ 250 USD para poder comprar las materias primas como carne, hojas para tamal, especies y condimentos, as como para comprar zapatos para estar preparada y poder surtir los pedidos que se incrementan en esta prxima temporada. Esta solicitando un plazo para pagar su crdito de 3-6 meses.

loan.use: To purchase raw material

loan.name: Ana Maria Del Pilar

texts.en:
Ana Mara is married and has two little children. Her husband is a driver and had problems because his salary was not enough to cover the family expenses. The kids are studying at the elementary school and in order to suppourt them and her husband, she decided to start her own business selling Tupperware products three years ago. Her business has been growing and she continues to satisfy her clients. She knows during November and December her sales will increase and for that reason she needs a loan by $ 250 USD to buy merchandise and be able to supply the orders of her clients, the term to repay the loan is 3-6 months.

** "This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Ana Mara esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeos, su esposo es chofer de transportes y tena problemas pues no le pagaban lo suficiente en su trabajo y no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de la familia, ya que sus hijos acuden a la escuela primaria y ante esta situacin ella decidi iniciar su propio negocio de venta de tupperware desde hace tres aos, el cual ha hecho crecer debido a la buena aceptacin entre sus clientes. Pensando en que Noviembre y Diciembre son los meses en que se incrementan sus ventas, Ana Mara esta requiriendo un prstamo por $ 250 USD para comprar mercancas para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, adems el plazo que solicita para liquidar el crdito es de 3-6 meses.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Eight years ago, Leticia started her own small business of selling shoes and jewelery. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a construction worker and he earns a variable salary and sometimes it was not enough to cover all the family expenses and for that reason she decided to start her business to support her husband with the family maintenance. When she started her business, she only offered her products among her family and friends. Later she was including her neighbors and everybody who wanted her products. The highest season sale is coming and she wants to be prepare to take all the orders of her clients. This is the reason why she requires a loan by $250 USD to buy shoes and jewelry, she is going to pay back in a term of 3-6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Hace ocho aos que Leticia inici su propio negocio de venta de zapatos y joyera, ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es albail y trabaja en la obra de construccin, pero como sus ingresos son variables en ocasiones resultaban insuficientes para costear todos los gastos de la familia, esa fue la razn por la que decidi iniciar su negocio para apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de la familia. Cuando inici su negocio solamente ofreca sus productos entre sus familiares y amistades y con el paso del tiempo fue extendindose con sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta por iniciar la temporada de ventas altas y es por eso que quiere estar preparada para atender a sus clientes, para ello que requiere de un prstamo por $ 250 USD para comprar zapatos y joyas, para pagar en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Servando

texts.en:
In February of 2004, Servando was unemployed. He is a carpenter but works many other jobs as well for other companies. One friend invited him to start the natural products sales. This was something new for him but he decided to try. Fortunately everything was good and the customers were convinced about the quality of the products he recommends to everybody. His portfolio of clients is increasing and he feels so proud with his achievements. However, he always wanted to work like a carpenter so with her job as a salesman of natural products he can saved some money and in December of 2005 he will enter in a partnership with another person and both will open their own business as carpenters and they are working building furniture. Now he has two jobs and Servando is requesting a loan of US$ 475 payable in 4 months at least, and with this loan he could buy raw materials.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

En Febrero de 2004 Servando estaba desempleado, y no lograba contratarse l es carpintero de oficio, pero siempre haba trabajado empleado en otros talleres. No lograba contratarse y un amigo lo invito a vender Productos Naturales, era algo nuevo para l, pero decidi probar, afortunadamente le fue bien, y convencido de la calidad de los productos los recomienda ampliamente. Su cartera de clientes se ha incrementado considerablemente, y se siente satisfecho con los resultados. Sin embargo siempre estaba aorando su oficio de carpintero, fue as como gracias a los productos naturales logro hacerse de unos ahorros y en Diciembre de 2005 se asocio con otra persona para montar una carpintera, en donde se fabrican muebles a la orden. Como en los 2 negocios es su patrn ahora alterna su tiempo entre las ventas y su negocio de carpintera. Esta solicitando un crdito por la cantidad de US$ 475 que piensa pagar en 4 meses, este prstamo lo utilizara para compara madera, pegamento, clavos, para poder fabricar piezas y ofrecerlas para su venta. Este negocio se ve favorecido en el mes de Diciembre, pues es cuando la gente invierte para comprar muebles para su hogar; por lo que Servando quiere estar preparado y poder aprovechar esta temporada.

loan.use: To purchase raw materials

loan.name: Alma Nelly

texts.en:
Alma has two sons that help her to run her business. She has worked eleven years with her business and her business is electronics devices and videos games sales. These video games are in great demand for people, especially kids. Alma purchases a great part of her merchandise in the United States of America because she has the option to travel there because it is near to Nuevo Leon. Another benefit of buying in the USA is better prices than in Mexico so she can competes with their products in Mexico and obtain more income. Alma is requesting a loan of $ 750 to purchase merchandise this season because she knows that her demand will increase this Christmas due her historic analysis and experience. Alma offer to pay back this loan in four months and also she is very sure that all her merchandise will be sold because she has a lot of clients that ask her for more, better and newer video games.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Alma tiene dos hijos y ellos antes le ayudaban en el negocio, con el que ya tiene 11 aos. Su negocio es vender aparatos electrnicos y video juegos, estos ltimos son muy demandados por las personas en especialmente la gente joven y los nios. Alma compra gran parte de su mercadera de los Estados Unidos, ya que tiene la opcin de viajar debido a la cercana con ese pas, adems comprando en EE.UU. los precios que obtiene por los artefactos y por los video juegos son muy bueno y as puede competir con sus productos en Mxico y obtener utilidades. Alma esta solicitando un prstamo por US$ 750 para comprar mercanca en estas fechas, ya que para navidad, la demanda de video juegos se incrementa segn sus estudios histricos de su demanda. Ella ofrece pagar el crdito en 4 meses y esta segura que vender toda la mercanca que adquiera por que ya tiene muchos clientes fijos que le comentaron su necesidad de ms, mejores y nuevos video juegos.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Javier

texts.en:
My name is Javier Isidoro O.. Im the owner of a corner store, which is my only revenue source for me and my family.

I had 10 years of experience in the field and in this period my profits have been very good. I would like to have more products in my store and give a better service to my customers in this popular neighborhood where the people appreciate me a lot.

I'm asking for loan of $600 which I will pay back in 1 year. With this money I will buy different products and my customers will have more buying options.

Espaol

Mi nombre es Javier Isidoro O., soy dueo de una pequea tienda, la cual es la nica fuente de ingreso para mi y mi familia.

Tengo 10 aos de experiencia en el campo, sin embargo, en este tiempo a pesar de que mis ingresos han sido buenos quiero tener mas variedad de producto para mis clientes y brindarles un servicio, en esta vecindario tan popular y en donde la gente me aprecia mucho, por lo cual estoy solicitando un prstamo de $600.00 el cual pienso pagar en un lapso de un 1 ao, con este importe comprar productos diferentes y mis clientes tendrn ms opciones de compra.

loan.use: different products

loan.name: Domitila

texts.en:
My name is Mrs.Domitila V. Verastegui. Im a very entrepreneurial person and I love to sell. Im the kind of person who says that: there isnt any age limit to reach your goals, so it doesnt matter if you are very young or if you are an older person. You can reach your goals anytime if you work hard to get it. Now I have in mind to increase the number of shoe models and offer to my clients different kinds of shoes. Thats why Im asking for a loan of $600.00 to increase the shoe models and have some stock. Im planning to pay back the loan in one year on a monthly basis.

Espaol

Mi nombre es Sra. Domitila V. Verastegui, soy una persona muy emprendedora y me encanta vender. Yo soy de las clases de persona que dicen: No hay limite de edad para alcanzar tus metas, as que no importa si eres muy joven o una persona de edad, en cualquier momento tu puedes cumplir tus metas si trabajas duro.por eso ahora tengo en mente incrementar el numero de modelos de zapato y ofrecer a mis clientes diferente clase de zapato, por lo cual estoy solicitando un prstamo de $600.00 para incrementar los modelos de zapato y tener en stock, planeo pagar mensualmente durante un ao.

loan.use: buy different shoe models

loan.name: Oscar

texts.en:
My name is Oscar P.. I sell shoes and seasonal products since 2000 in El Oriente community, close to Nuevo Laredo. I would like to have more products to sell in my small store. I want to offer basics items, like: bath soap, laundry detergent, toothpaste, etc. I sell my products in my community and give them a very good price because there isnt any other store near here and the people have to drive or walk long distances to buy these kinds of products. That is the reason why Im asking for a loan of $600. With this amount I will buy these products and offer them to the people of the community.

Espaol

Mi nombre es Oscar P., vendo zapatos desde hace 5 aos en La comunidad Oriente, cerca de Nuevo Laredo. Me gustara tener ms productos que vender en mi pequea tienda. Quiero ofrecer productos bsicos como: jabn de bao, detergente, pasta de dientes, etc. En mi comunidad y dar el mejor precio, porque no hay tiendas cercanas que vendan esos productos y la gente tiene que manejar o caminar distancias largas para poder conseguirlos, esa es la razn principal de la solicitud de mi crdito por $600.00, con este importe pretendo comprar Esos productos y ofrecerlos a la comunidad.

loan.use: different basic products

loan.name: Maria Graciela

texts.en:
Maria Graciela is married and has two sons. She has a shoe sales business and has more than six years with the business. She started her business due her economic situation. She needed to start her own business in order to suppourt her family and educate her two sons. She has the opportunity to travel frequently to Moroleon and this city is one of the most competitive cities in Mexico in leather also in shoes. Buying there, she could obtain a great margin of utilities selling her merchandise in Nuevo Leon. Maria Graciela is requesting for a loan of US$ 650 to purchase merchandise and take advantage of this change of season and Christmas. She comments that she will pay this loan in six months at least, and if she gets this opportunity she could increase her sales and also her incomes.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Maria Graciela esta casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ya tiene en este negocio ms de seis aos, inicio en este negocio por la necesidad econmica y tenia que aportar ingresos para los gastos familiares y para poder vivir y educar a sus hijos. Comenz en este negocio por que ella tiene la facilidad de ir a Morolen muy a menudo y en esa ciudad es una de las ms competitivas en artculos de piel y zapatos en general, por ello comprando all puede obtener utilidades vendiendo los zapatos en Nuevo Len, ya que son de buena calidad y a buen precio, por ello Maria Graciela esta solicitando un crdito por US$ 650 para comprar mercanca y poder vender en este cambio de temporada y poca de navidea. Comenta que pagar este crdito en 6 meses y que si le brindan esa oportunidad podr incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades.

With this commercial location I will increase my food sales and revenues that will give my family better living conditions.

Hola, mi nombre es Maria Hermila D. Len Ochoa, Vendo deliciosos tamales D. carne en Nuevo Laredo y chocolate caliente, tambin vendo tacos y refrescos, esta es la nica fuente D. ingreso con la que cuento y mi negocio crece da con da.

Por eso estoy solicitando un prstamo D. $900.00 ya que me gustara invertirlo en ingredientes para comida y rentar un local, para establecerme ah, poder incrementar las ventas e ingresos y darle mejores condiciones D. vida a mi familia.

texts.en:
My name is Mirna M. and my business is to manufacture bed linens. I have been in business for 3 years, and my clients favor the quality of my product. My business generates income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory and production capacity. I'd like to to remodel my home and support my family.

Mi nombre es Mirna M. me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de ropa para camas, tengo mi negocio hace 3 aos, mis clientes son buenos ya que les gusta la calidad de mi producto, mi negocio me genera ingresos para mantener a mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con los ingresos que obtenga poder remodelar mi hogar y mantener a mi familia.

My daughters help me in the business as well. My goal is to increase my inventory and production line. My goal is to be able to remodel my house, buy a new machine to cook, and to sustain my family.

Mi nombre es Silvia S. me dedico a la produccion y venta de ropa para camas, tengo mi negocio hace 2 aos, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, tengo la ayuda de una de mis hijas para la venta de mi producto, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios para una mejor produccion y con los ingresos que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa, comprar una maquina nueva de cocer y sustentar mi familia.

My name is Holy H., and I'm dedicated on sale of products of popular consumption, has my business for 3 years. My business generates income to me for the sustenance of my family. My goal is to increase my inventory to have a greater assortment of product to sell. I'd like to give my son an education.

Mi nombre es Santos H., me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace 3 aos, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi clientela es muy buena ya que yo personalmente los atiendo y son los vecinos de mi colonia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta de productos y tener mas surtido mi negocio con las ganancias que obtenga quiero acondicionar mejor mi negocio y darles estudio a mi hijo.

loan.name: Maria Virginia

texts.en:
Maria Virginia is married and has two sons. She has had her business for 12 years and her sons asisst her in this business. 12 years ago, she had to begin working because she had to help with the family expenses. She loves to cook and decided to open a small bakery that has been doing very well. As time has passed her business has grown and based on this she strongly believes it will continue growing. She hopes in time to be a successful female entrepreneur and leave her sons a business which could help them and continue growing. For this reason she is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200 that she offers to pay back in six months. With this loan she will purchase raw materials for her bakery and will be prepared for the upcoming months which, in her experience, are the best of the year.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Maria Virginia esta casada y tiene dos hijos, ya tiene con su negocio 12 aos y la ayudan en el negocio sus hijos. Hace 12 aos ella se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para poder tener el sustento de la familia y como le gusta mucho la repostera, decidi abrir un pequeo negocio de venta de pan y pasteles que a la fecha le ha ido muy bien. Con el paso del tiempo el negocio ha ido creciendo y fortalecindose y por ello Maria Virginia tiene muchas expectativas de seguir creciendo y llegar a ser en algn momento una mujer emprendedora exitosa y dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio y un negocio del cual puedan ellos continuar y salir adelante econmicamente. Por ello esta solicitando un crdito por US$ 1,200 que ofrece pagarlos en 6 meses y lo usar para comprar materia prima para la panadera y estar lista para estos meses que segn su experiencia son los mejores del ao.

She started the business 3 years ago. The business is growing and running very well, that's why the business needs a bigger freezer. This new freezer will give a better customer service and more meat sales.

Mrs.Evangelina R. needs a bigger freezer because the current one is very small and is not working very well. Mrs Evangelina knows that most important for a butcher shop is a good freezer. She is asking for a loan of $1200. With this money she plans to buy the freezer. Mrs Evangelina R. wants to pay back in 1 year.

Espaol

La Sra. Evangelina R. Marquez tiene una pequea Carnicera. Sus Hijos la ayudan en el negocio, ella comenz vendiendo abarrotes y luego cambio a la venta de carne. El negocio va bien y va creciendo, por lo cual necesita un congelador mas grande y mejor. Este nuevo Congelador proporcionara un mejor servicio a los clientes y mayores venta de Carne razn por la cual la Sra. Evangelina R. necesita para su negocio un congelador nuevo, con mayor capacidad y con mejor funcionamiento, ella sabe que lo mas importante para un a carnicera es un buen congelador. Ella solicita un prstamo de $1200.00, con este importe planea comprar un congelador nuevo con mayor capacidad, planea pagarlo mensualmente durante un ao.

Me llamo Edwin y me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, ropa de nio y ropa interior, mi negocio lo tengo desde hace 1 ao y esta ubicado en uno de los boulevares de Danli. Tengo mi negocio ubicado en el Boulevard la Democracia en la ciudad de Danli, soy madre soltera mi hijo tiene cinco aos de edad, por lo que decidi invertir algo de dinero y me ha ido bien en el negocio. En estos meses es cuando mas ventas hay por lo que necesito hacer una buena inversion para tener ropa variada para satisfacer a mis clientes.

He thought, and decided to open his own business doing what he knew how to do. 10 years ago he started the business of repairing machines like televisions and washing machines, etc. Since he didn't have to make a large investment, it seemed at that moment sensible to open his business at home, and quickly soon after he had more and more clients. Now his business has grown and is growing, and as a result he needs to have a stock of pieces and spare parts to repair the equipment that people bring to him. For this reason he is requesting a loan of US $750 which he offers to pay back in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Rodrigo esta separado y tiene un hijo. Ahora como su negocio a mejorado el necesita obtener un stock de piezas y refacciones para los equipos que le lleven a reparar, por ello esta solicitando un prstamo por US$ 750 que promete pagarlos en 6 meses.

My name is Ana O.. I have been selling softdrinks for four years. My customer base is very good because near my business are mechanical factories. My business supports the family. My goal is to increase my inventory of softdrinks since the demand is very great. I would like to remodel my business and give a good education to my children.

loan.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is from Queretaro, he is a married man and works with his wife in a socks sales business. In 1987 he had to support his family and he did not have sufficient economic resources to do so, so he decided to open his own business. Queretaros weather is cold most of the year, and he saw the opportunity to start selling socks. His business was a success, he sold his products in a popular market and his wife joined the business to help in sales. Then he opened another small place in a different popular market. In this way, his business has continued growing and he feels happy. He does not have enough money to invest in more merchandise to offer his clients. For this reason he is requesting a loan of US $550, and with this loan he will purchase more merchandise and a variety of products to offer his clients, and have more sales and a greater income as well.

loan.name: Fiacre Gabriel

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by three entrepreneurs from the Dikasofoor Association in the village of Diouru. Their representative, Fiacre Gabriel D., gave us the following business plan description:

Senegal has about 10 million inhabitants, of which over half are youth. The problem of unemployment is becoming ever more pressing. Cities are being invaded by this segment of the population in search of work. Immigration is becoming the most popular recourse for young people, but it has not proven to be the best solution.

The Dikasofoor Association, conscious of the problem, has decided to take up the raising and commerce of poultry. The products of poultry farming are highly prized among the restaurants, hotels and households of Senegal. This activity will allow the members of the association to contribute to socio-economic development and resolve the problem of unemployment. The goal of the project is to keep young people in their home region, fight poverty and reduce violence by establishing a profitable, revenue-generating activity.

The business activity consists of buying chicks, raising them and selling them at the market, to restaurants or to individual households. This work will be done as a team. One member will take charge of seeking out clients, and the two others will take charge of raising the chickens. In order to closely monitor the development of the chicks, a group meeting will be held each week. Another meeting to make the monthly loan repayment installments will be held each month. Profits from this activity will go to the Associations account.

Original French:

"Le Sngal est peupl denviron 10.000.000 habitants. La jeunesse reprsente plus de la moiti. La demande demploi connat des proportions de plus en plus importante. Les villes sont envahies par cette couche de la population la recherche du travail. Limmigration devient la solution la plus prise par les jeunes mais elle ne se rvle pas colle la meilleure solution.

Lassociation Dikasofoor, consciente du problme, dcide de se lancer dans llevage et le commerce de la volaille. Les produits de laviculture sont trs priss au Sngal notamment dans le domaine de la restauration, des htels et chez les particuliers. Cette activit permettra la rinsertion des membres de lassociation dans le dveloppement socio-conomique et rsoudre le problme de chmage. Le projet a pour objectif de fixer la jeunesse dans son milieu, lutter contre la pauvret et rduire les violences par le dveloppement dune activit gnratrice de revenu et rentable.

Lactivit consiste acheter des poussins, les levs et les vendre dans le march, les restaurants ou des particuliers. Cela se fera en travail dquipe. Un membre se lancera la recherche de ma clientle et les deux autre soccuperont du poulailler proprement dit. Pour suivre de trs prs lvolution des poussins, une runion se tiendra chaque semaine. Une autre runion pour dgager le montant du remboursement de la somme mensuelle se tiendra tout les mois. Le compte de lAssociation sera aliment par les bnfices tirs de lactivit."

Background

Senegal is one of the worlds poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loan.name: Sophie Bernadette

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by three women from the village of Diourou, represented by Sophie Bernadette C.. The group describes their business plan as follows:

This project aims to commercialize the products of African artisans, offering its clients various opportunities to market hand-dyed Bazin (a traditional African cloth), better known as thioub. For this purpose, the group will purchase a supply of both rich Bazin and second-quality Bazin, to match the preference and purchasing power of our clientele.

The clothing market is thriving in spite of the poor economic situation. The traditional boubou (a long robe or dress typically worn in West Africa) is commonly worn by the Senegalese people young and old, men and women especially during family celebrations such as marriages and baptisms, on Fridays (when Muslims gather at the mosque for prayer), during Ramadan (a holy month of fasting for Muslims), for the festivals of Korit (known outside Senegal as Eid al-Fitr, this holiday celebrates the breaking of the fast at the end of Ramadan), Tabaski (known outside Senegal as Eid al-Kabir, this celebration marks a high point during the season of pilgrimage to Mecca), etc.

There is strong demand in this sector. In order to be competitive, we plan to set our prices reasonably in relation to our various market targets. We will take full advantage of our address book, which will surely play an important role [in establishing a good clientele base]. This market generally requires a fairly large initial investment, and the profit margins are quite good.

This project aims to meet the clothing needs of our target clientele children, adolescents, and adults. Its goal is to create employment, and it will allow us to contribute to the economic development of our country, because our long-term objective is to form an official SME (Small/Medium Enterprise, a status which entitles holders to various state-sponsored business promotion services in Senegal), to hire paid staff and therefore create employment, and to import from and export to other African countries such as the Ivory Coast with Wax (a traditional African cloth) skirts, Gabon with Gabonese robes, Morocco with jallab and other leather or artificial leather accessories and why not? with the countries of Asia as well.

Original French:

"Le projet est destin commercialiser les produits des produits africains (art). Ce projet propose ses clients plusieurs services dans le domaine de la commercialisation du Bazin teint plus connu sous le nom de thioub. Pour cela, la promotrice sapprovisionnera en Bazin riche et en Bazin de seconde qualit selon le choix et le pouvoir dachat de sa clientle.

Le secteur de lhabillement est un march porteur malgr la conjoncture. Pour ce qui est du boubou traditionnel il y a une tendance pour les sngalais (petits et grands, hommes ou femmes ) shabiller dans ces tenues surtout lors des crmonies familiales (mariages, baptmes etc.) et aussi les vendredi, en priode de ramadan, lors des ftes de korit, Tabaski etc.

Il y a une demande forte par rapport ce secteur. Pour tre comptitif par rapport nos concurrents, nous comptons pratiquer des prix raisonnables pour nos diffrentes cibles. Nous mettrons profit notre carnet dadresse qui jouera srement un trs grand rle. Ce march a besoin dun prfinancement souvent assez lourd o les marges bnficiaires sont assez bonnes

Ce projet cherche rsoudre les besoins de nos cibles jeunes, moins jeunes et adultes en habillement. Il a pour autre objectif la cration demploi et nous permettra de participer au dveloppement conomique de notre pays car nous avons comme objectif long terme de nous constituer en PME, de recruter du personnel (donc la cration demploi) et de faire de limport/export vers des pays africains comme la cte dIvoire avec le pagne Wax, le Gabon avec les robes gabonaises le Maroc avec les jallab et autres accessoires en cuir ou en simili cuir et pourquoi pas vers les pays asiatiques."

Background

Senegal is one of the worlds poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Bertha wants to grow and create a better quality of life for her and her family. For this reason she works very hard to achieve her dream, and is now requesting a loan of US $ 1,200. With this loan she could purchase more merchandise in a greater quantity and obtain better and lower prices by buying the merchandise prior to the season, and in this way she could increase her income. She offers to re-pay this loan in 6 months at least.

loan.name: Awa

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by five members of the womens savings association Jabboot, whose representative, Awa G., submitted the following business plan description:

The women of the village who are members of the Jabboot Association are very active in weaving cloth for skirts and other articles of clothing, and those who are teachers have innovated with the sale of textbooks and school supplies in the local schools.

The overall objective of this project is to improve the profitability of the small-scale commercial activities of the Jabboot Association members. The first activity will consist of buying school books and supplies in bulk at a very good price, and reselling them at very fair prices in the schools, where the parents associations do not have a functioning cooperative. Throughout the year the pupils will need new school supplies and books. The second activity is the production and sale of skirts, blankets, bed sheets and other articles of clothing (robes etc).

Jabboot is a group whose members are quite active and experienced in the area of selling school supplies and school books; the lack of financial support has always been the obstacle to strengthening and expanding these activities. This is a group of women who dedicate themselves at the same time to the sale of skirts and other articles of clothing, and this activity is very profitable. With a little financial support the group members will make a great deal of profit, with a learning impact on other sectors such as traditional artisanry.

With the framework that the village committee has put in place for the management of this loan, we will fulfill all our responsibilities under the repayment plan, taking into account the time required for production at each stage, and the management plan will have as its goal adherence to the loan repayment schedule.

Original French:

"Les membres ( femmes ) de l covillage regroupes dans (JABBOOT) sont trs actives dans le domaine du tissage des pagnes et autres effets vestimentaires mais les membres enseignants ont innov avec la vente de manuels et fournitures scolaires dans les coles.

Objectif gnral : Amliorer les activits du petit commerce au profit des membres du groupement JABBOOT

ACTIVITES :

Activs 01

Il sagira dacheter dans un premier temps du matriel scolaire( manuels et fournitures) de trs bon prix et les revendre avec des prix trs adapts dans les coles ou les associations des parents dlevs n`ont pas de cooprative fonctionnelle. Durant toute l`anne les lves sont confronts aux besoins de fournitures courants et de manuels.

Activit 02

Confection et commercialisation de pagnes, couvertures, draps de lit et autres effets vestimentaires ( robes et autres ) .

Conclusions : JABBOOT est un groupe de membres trs actives est trs expriment en matire de vente de fournitures et de manuel scolaire, le manque d`appui a toujours t le frein pour le renforcement et llargissement des activits. C`est un groupe de femmes qui s investit en mme temps dans le petit commerce de pagnes et autres effets vestimentaires et cette activit est trs rentable. Avec un peu dappui les membres bnficiaires tireront beau coups de bnfices avec un effet entranement. pour les autres secteurs comme lartisanat. Avec les outils de gestions adapts que le comit locale a mis en place pour la gestion du prt nous prendrons toutes les dispositions vis a vis du plan de remboursement, en tenant compte du temps de production a chaque tape et le plan de suivi aura comme objectif le respect des dlais d engagement (remboursements)"

Background

Senegal is one of the worlds poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loan.use: School supply cooperative/Fabric and clothing manufacture

Peter is a married father of three boys who has dedicated himself over the last 22 years to learning the insect and rodent extermination business. His wife helps him run the business by purchasing many of the supplies. Having worked in a laboratory in the past, his wife knows how to mix the proper chemicals and can spot a deal when it comes. When the company they worked for went out of business, it was Peters wife who encouraged him to open a business with the $10 they had 17 years ago. The C.s children help sell their products door-to-door and in the locations in town where customers come to buy things of that nature. Peter is applying for this loan, partly so he can obtain the necessary sanitation registration which costs $100, as well as materials used everyday during business such as sealant and materials for presenting his work. Peter used to borrow from a loan shark, but now he has been given a chance to borrow well below the 15% monthly rates. His whole family helps run the business, and they all have worked hard to build the house they currently live in. They thank Kiva and Mifex for giving them an opportunity at financial independence.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Peter is applying for this loan, partly so he can obtain the necessary sanitation registration which costs $100, as well as materials used everyday during business such as sealant and materials for presenting his work.

loan.name: Limamou

texts.en:
This loan will be shared by the seven members of the Propaf group, represented by Limamou S.. Their village, Ker Gu Mag, is located in the arid grasslands of central Senegal, where people depend on a mixture of subsistence agriculture and cash cropping for their livelihoods. The loan funds will be used to purchase stocks of local grains principally millet and corn during the harvest season when supply is abundant and prices are low. The grains will then be processed and sold at retail as flour and animal feed throughout the year.

Background

Senegal is one of the worlds poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loan.use: Millet and Corn Retail

loan.name: Awa

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the 28 members of a handicapped womens group, Sant Yalla des Handicaps, who produce the vibrant hand-dyed fabrics and batiks that are popular for traditional clothing in West Africa. The groups leader, Awa G., describes their business plan:

The Social Development Funds Agency (AFDS) has already built a training center for the handicapped people of the Foundiougne region. Therefore, in the hope of making this resource useful over the long term, the women of the group solicit this loan in order to boost the incomes of its members. This is a cloth-dying project that fits well with this goal. The objectives of the loan are: 1) to create employment for young handicapped women and increase the income of the groups members; 2) to enter the batik market, which is quite strong in the tourist city of Foundiougne; and 3) to continue to make use of the training center that has been provided to the group. Planned activities include: 1) the purchase of fabric and various other materials; 2) dying the fabric with the colors and designs that are ordered by customers or in vogue; and 3) selling the finished hand-dyed fabric. The training center has a display room that doubles as a boutique shop. Sales will be made on site or at customers homes, depending on the nature of the order. The loan will be repaid in accordance with the agreed schedule.

Original French:

"LAgence du Fonds de Dveloppement Social (AFDS) a dj construit un centre de formation lintention des handicaps du dpartement de Foundiougne. Ainsi dans le but de prenniser cet outil, les femmes du groupement sollicitent ce prt afin daugmenter les revenus de ses membres.

Ce prsent projet de teinture entre dans ce cadre.

Objectifs du Prt :

o Crer des emplois au bnfice des jeunes filles handicaps et augmenter les revenus des membres du groupement

o Assurer la commande du march du batik, trs important Foundiougne qui est une ville touristique.

o Prenniser les activits du centre de formation par la mise disposition de FDR

Activits :

- Achat de pices et de matriels divers

- Teinture des pices suivant les couleurs et les motifs commands ou en vogue

- Vente des pices dj teintes

Le centre dispose dune salle dexposition qui fait en mme temps office de boutique. La vente se fait sur place ou domicile selon la nature des commandes. Le remboursement peut seffectuer suivant les chances fixes."

Background

Senegal is one of the worlds poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loan.use: Traditional Cloth Dying

payment.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loan.name: Alioune

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten members of the Thialene association, who hail from the tiny village of Nder at the edge of the Sahara desert in northern Senegal. Subsistence is always a battle in this arid region, where most people still depend on rain-fed cultivation of their staple crops: millet, yams and peanuts. Investment in irrigation here can improve crop yields dramatically, increasing the surplus that the villagers sell for much-needed cash. The leader of the Thialene group, Alioune S., describes their plan to invest loan funds in an irrigation pump:

The loan will be used to provide the group members with an irrigation pump with a capacity of 300 cubic meters per hour, which can irrigate 10 hectares of land. The pump will be managed by a maintenance person who will take charge of ensuring its good working condition. The team overseeing this project will make regular visits to all the fields where the pump is being used, and as soon as the first harvests begin we will start to collect the loan repayment without any difficulty.

Original French:

"Il sagit de mettre la disposition des membres du groupement un groupe moto pompe dune capacit de 300m3/heure pouvant irrigu 10 ha de culture et sera gr par un pompiste qui assurera lentretien et le fonctionnement. Lquipe de suivi du projet fera des descentes dans tous les projets et ds la fin des premiers rcolte commencera faire le recouvrement des crdits sans difficult."

Background

Senegal is one of the worlds poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loan.use: Irrigation pump
