loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Fishing equipment purchase

loan.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married and has one daughter. Her husband works as a baker, and Eva began work 17 years ago making suits for men and women. Her mother sent her to an arts college, and when she left Ms. T. was given a sewing machine. From a very young age, she loved to sew, so Eva decided that she would continue with this line of work when she got older. Her customers come to her because they can count on quality and low prices. Eva as well as her husband take turns going to wholesalers so they can purchase things like fabric, thread, utensils. With this $600 loan, Eva is hoping to buy another sewing machine and new fabrics that are popular. Rather than 20% per month, Eva is now able to afford a loan and build her business so that she can improve her familys standard of living.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: With this $600 loan, Eva is hoping to buy another sewing machine and new fabrics that are popular.

loan.name: Denny

texts.en:
Denny is a very simple, hardworking woman. She comes from a very poor family, and since she was young she has had to work. More than anything else, Denny says that she is unafraid to venture alone because she has had to fend for herself all her life. Ms. P. has three children, and her husband works as a security guard at a local business. Denny has learned how to many things, but her specialty is writing manuals for finely-crafted artisan goods. Some of the most beautiful woven rugs and tablecloths come from Manualidades Denny. She sells her goods close to her home where she is well known, and she sells to customers nearby the church. The income she brings in from this business helps to support her familys basic needs, but she is applying for this credit so that she can get raw material: special painting for the engravings, fabrics and the material to elaborate the portfolios. She and her husband wish to continue outdoing themselves and growing to where they can send their children to good schools. Their aspiration is to have their own house and to continue giving their children opportunities.
Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: She is applying for this credit so that she can get raw material: special painting for the engravings, fabrics and the material to elaborate the portfolios.

loan.name: Yorma

texts.en:
Yorma is a married mother with four children, and her husband is a salesman. He lost his job recently when the company he worked for shut down. Luckily, the Alvarezes planned ahead and were able to tap into their savings to open a hair salon where Yorma runs the show. Her husband helps out any way that he can by washing customers hair, but this is the only source of income for their family right now. Yorma learned how to cut hair eight ears ago, but only two years ago did start cutting hair professionally. Her daughter who is 17 years old gives manicures and paints nails while her mother cuts hair. Yorma has borrowed from the loan sharks before, but she was hardly able to scrape enough money after having to pay them 20% monthly! This hard-working entrepreneur wants this loan so that buy more products like hairdryers, hair-washing sinks, hair and skin treatments, conditioners, permanent hair dyes, spray, enamel, and acetone. Yorma is hoping that with this loan she will be ready to re-open her hair salon with an improved look and all the tools to make it a professional shop. The months of November and December are usually the busiest, so she is hoping to ramp up quickly before the season starts.
Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: This hard-working entrepreneur wants this loan so that buy more products like hairdryers, hair-washing sinks, hair and skin treatments, conditioners, permanent hair dyes, spray, enamel, and acetone.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Capital equipment

loan.name: Idriz

texts.en:
Idriz is a 64-year old Roma man from Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly referred to as gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of Europe.

For most of his working life, Idriz had a job at a state-run light bulb factory in Sliven. When communism was dismantled in the mid-90s, the factory was shuttered and Idriz was out of work with very few transferable skills. Being in his mid-50s at the time, Idriz and those of his generation were in a particularly tough spot. Under communism, he was not paid a significant amount and did not have considerable savings as he trusted that the state would continue providing for him in his retirement. Unfortunately, that has not happened. Those in his age range have been the hardest hit by the transition to free markets. Idrizs pension from the government totals approximately 35EUR per month.

To support himself, he started a barbershop in the Roma ghetto of Sliven. He charges 1EUR a haircut, 0.5EUR for a shave. He is happy to have a way to support himself and is always thrilled when he can buy something for one of his four grandchildren with his earnings. Idrizs shop runs on a tight budget, with a significant amount of the earnings from one week going to buy new supplies for the next week. As a result, the proceeds of this loan will be going into working capital for his shop.

loan.use: Working capital

payment.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loan.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is married with three children. She lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She owns a stall at Tandika market selling used clothes. She purchases these clothes from wholesalers and resells them in retail.

Through her savings, she has managed to start keeping layers as a supplementary business. She came to notice that the second business needs more capital than she had originally anticipated. To smoothly run her businesses she needs USD 550. The money will be used to buy layers of feed and some medications. Ashura has attended Business and Entrepreneurship Training offered by Youth Self Employment Foundation.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Yombo, in the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children. Two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Elizabeth owns a small pharmacy near her residence selling human medications. She has seven years in this business and it is licenced by the authorities.

She is frequently faced with stockouts of medications for malaria and water contamination diseases like cholera, typhoid and amoeba. The situation is intense especially in the raining periods. Dar es Salaam is now in rain season, so this makes her business very demanding. She is in need of USD 400 to replenish her stock.

loan.use: Working Capitl

loan.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver lives in the Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Oliver owns a shop selling different consumable items, especially food.

She is in the process of expanding her business. Limited with her narrow capital base, Oliver fails to cope with the demand from her clients. She sees this as a lost opportunity, which needs to be utilized. From her own savings, she can contribute 20% of the expansion project. She still needs USD 950 to facilitate her plan.

loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is married with four children. She lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. Clara runs a nursery school near her residence. She runs her nursery school in a rented premise. She is planning to buy a plot and build a nursery there to put away with rental charges.

She has ten years experience in this business. In addition to her savings she needs USD 750 to facilitate the plan. Clara had attended a formal pre-primary school teaching training at Manumba Centre-Nachingwea in Lindi region for one year.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Paskazia

texts.en:
Paskazia lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. She runs a tailoring business. She makes and repairs both mens and womens clothes. She has employed one assistant and she needs an additional capital of USD 400 to expand her business.

This amount will be used to buy sewing machines and other tailoring supplies. The expansion strategy will help her increase her income. One of her two sons is expected to join secondary school early next year. The planned increase of income will help her pay for school fees and other associated costs.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Selemani

texts.en:
Selemani is married with three children. He lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. Selemani had attended training form Small Industries Development Organisation (SIDO) for one year. Selemani makes and sells household items like local charcoal cookers, animal feed utensils, steel chairs and tables, steel doors and the like.

Steel sheets and timber are the main raw materials for his business. The steel price has currently risen due to a recent longer term problem of power shortage. Steel is made from local industries. Selemani is now unable to buy the required quantities of steel as raw material. He is in need of USD 950 to boost his working capital.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married with six children. He lives in the Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. Charles keeps Cows and Chickens as his business. He supplies milk and eggs to retailers. He is in the process of increaseing the flock of animals, especially broilers.

Along side animal keeping, Charles grows vegetables and fruits of which he sells in wholesale and in retail. Droppings from animals are used as manure for the farm. He needs USD 550 to buy some insectsides for treating his farm and increaseing the flock of chickens. Charles has expectations that one day he will become a big supplier of farm products in his region.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda lives in the Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Two are in primary school and the other two are in Secondary school. Hilda keeps chicken broth broilers and layers. She supplies chicken meets and eggs to different restaurants in the Temeke district of Dar es Salaam.

She has nine years experience in this business. Limited with capital, Hilda fails to meet the demand of her customers. She is in the process of expanding the size of her business. The additional capital of USD 1000 will help her suffice this requirement. The expansion strategy will help her increase her income. Next year, her third born will join secondary school and the extra income will help pay for school fees.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with six children. Joseph keeps layers and grows vegetables. He supplies the eggs and vegetables himself using a bicycle. The bicycle he is currently using is out of order and cannot be repaired and he is desperately in need of a new one.

He also needs a wheelbarlow to facilitate moving manure from chicken huts back to his farm. The new equipment will help him run his business smoothly. USD 400 will help him implement his plans.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is married with five children. She lives in the Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam and she keeps cows for milk production. She has employed two assistants to help with the cows. She supplies milk to various restaurants and nursery shools in the Temeke disrict.

She wants to buy new bicycles and vessels that will facilitate a greater supply of milk. Together with this business she owns a shop selling shoes. She wants to increase the stock of shoes as there is an expected rise in price. The two businesses need USD 1000 as the working capital to grow as she plans.

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is from Queretaro, is married and with her husband they work together selling art and crafts, and handmade articles. She decided to open her business 6 years ago because the economic situation that she and her family experienced was bad so she and her husband did not have resources to maintain her family. She knew how to make the hand made art and also learned how to make typical art and crafts of the city. This city is a touristy place and attracts many people from all over the world. When Francisca began her business she started to sell arts and crafts which were made manually but with the passing of the time her business was growing and she could not make enough merchandise so she began to buy art and crafts from other people to sell to her clients. Her husband saw that the business was a success and decided to support her and actually they have two small stores. Now she does not have enough money to invest in more merchandise, especially Christmas art and crafts which are the most popular this season, for this reason she is requesting for a loan of US$ 275 and offer to pay in 5 months at least.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Francisca es originaria de Quertaro, esta casada y junto con su esposo se dedican a la venta de artesana y manualidades. Ella estableci su negocio hace 6 aos atrs impulsada por la necesidad econmica que estaba atravesando su familia y no contaba con los medios necesarios para mantenerla. Ella conoca el arte de hacer manualidades y aprendi tambin a hacer artesanas tpicas de la ciudad, ya que es una ciudad muy turstica y siempre tiene visitantes locales y extranjeros. Al inicio ella comenz a vender las artesanas que realizaba manualmente y tambin algunos artculos hechos por ella misma, pero con el paso del tiempo su negocio fue creciendo y no se abasteca con lo que estaba haciendo entonces comenz a comprar artesanas y venderlas tambin. Su esposo al ver el xito del negocio decidi apoyarla y actualmente tienen 2 tiendas, pero para estas fechas no cuentan con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de artesana navidea que es la que ms se vende por esta temporada, por ello Francisca esta solicitando un prstamo de US$ 275 y ofrece pagarlo en 5 meses.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Lesbia Yaneth

texts.en:
My name is Lesbia Yaneth and I have a cosmetics business that I run from my home. I also travel to different areas. This business allows me to help cover family expenses. I have been doing this for three years. I need to invest in more inventory in order to offer my clients a greater variety of products.

Loan Use: Purchase deoderant, baby powder, shampoo, lotion, lipstick, compacts, body cream and other supplies

Mi Nombre es Lesbia Yaneth, tengo un negocio de venta de cosmeticos en mi casa de habitacion los que distribuyo de manera ambulante, este negocio me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares, cuento con 3 aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, necesito mayor inversion para ofrecer a mis clientes mayor variedad de productos.

loan.use: Compra de Desodorante de Hombre, Talcos para bebe, chapoo,lociones de mujer, listip, polvos compacto,esmalte para uas,crema para el cuerpo y otros.

loan.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.en:
My name is Maria Suyapa and I have a specailty food business in my home. I also sell my products in various factories in the city. I have been doing this for several yars and earn enough to pay for family expenses and for my children\\\'s education. I need to invest in order to meet the demand of my clients.

Loan Use: Purchase of Maseca, sugar, fruits, meats, vegetables, cuitos, spices, tracing paper, bags, pajillas, butter, firewood.

Mi Nombre es Maria Suyapa, cuento con un negocio de venta de golosinas (productos para consumo Humano) en mi casa de habitacion, y tambien lo distribuyo en las diferentes fabricas de la ciudad, tengo varios aos de realizar esta actividad la que me genera ingresos para los gastos familiares y gastos de educacion de mis hijos, necesito invertir mas para satisfacer la demanda de clientes.

loan.use: compra de Maseca, Azucar, frutas, carnes, verduras, cuitos, especias, papel trazo, bolsas, pajillas,manteca, leas.

loan.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is married and is 57 years old. He has been a farmer and also business man for all his life. He has a family of 6 children where four of them are married and the other two are studying at the school and help him with the business. Francisco purchases and sells fruit, but most of the fruit is from his farm. In 1996 he started his business, because he learned about business helping his parents since he was a child. He adapts a small store in his home to sell his products and he goes to the city to offer his products in his truck. His family sells in his home, while he goes to the city to offer in small barrels his merchandise to customers. Francisco is requesting a loan of US$ 650 to repair his truck and to makeover his store. He is offering to pay this loan in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Francisco esta casado y tiene 57 aos de edad. El es agricultor y comerciante de toda la vida, tiene una familia compuesta por 6 hijos, 4 de los cuales ya estn casados y los 2 restantes asisten a la escuela y ayudan con el negocio. Francisco compra y vende fruta, mucha de la cual cultiva directamente en su tierra. En 1996 el empez su negocio, aprendiendo todo este giro desde su niez ayudando a sus padres. Hace poco adapto en su domicilio un lugar para la venta de sus productos y mientras el sale a ofrecer sus productos en su camioneta en la ciudad, su familia se queda a cargo del negocio en casa, el ofrece en la ciudad su mercanca en cubetas aprovechando la calidad de fruta cosechada en su tierra. Francisco esta solicitando un prstamo por US$ 650 para poder reparar su camioneta y mejorar la presentacin de su local, ofreciendo pagar el prstamo en 6 meses.

loan.use: To repair his truck and paint his store

loan.name: Lourdes Yanette

texts.en:
My name is Lourdes Yannette. I have a cosmetics business. I have been doing this for several years and earn enough to cover my family\\\'s expenses including heath and education costs. Actually, I need to supply my business because during the Christmas season the volume of sales in increased.

Loan Use: Purchase lotion for men and women, shampoo, creams, lipstick, compacts, nail polish, deodorants, talcs and other supplies.

Mi Nombre el Lourdes yanette, cuento con un negocio de venta de Cosmeticos, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios aos de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos familiares, educacion, salud y otros. actualmente necesto surtir mas mi negocio tomando en cuenta que ya se aproxima la Navidad, y el volumente de venta es mayor.

loan.use: compra de Lociones para dama y caballeros,champoo, cremas, lapiz labial, polvos compactos,delinadores, esmaltes de una, desodorantes, talcos y otros.

loan.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo H. and his wife have 2 years with the business. This business have been growing too much, its was the first one in the neighborhood, they neighbors didnt have a place to buy basic products. Mr. Ricardo H. is asking for a loan of $1200.00, he plans to buy a freeze and then offer to his clients, milk, and frozen foods. In this neighborhood there isnt any Supermarket and that is an advantage for him. His business probably will grow much better. Mr. H. goal is to grow the business and be a good provider for his family. He wants to repay in a term of 12 months.

Espaol

El Sr. Ricardo Hernndez y su esposa tienen 2 aos con su negocio y ha crecido mucho, pues fue la primera tienda de su colonia. Sus vecinos no contaban con algn lugar para comprar productos bsicos. El Sr. Hernndez solicita un prstamo de 1,200.00 para comprar un congelador y ofrecer a sus clientes, lcteos y productos congelados. En este vecindario an no existen supermercados por lo que considera podr tener xito en el crecimiento de su negocio. El Objetivo del Sr. Ricardo Hernndez es hacer crecer su negocio, y ser un buen proveedor para mi familia.

loan.use: buy a freezer

loan.name: Raul

texts.en:
Mr. Raul H. and his family have a grocery store. He also works at night in a Maquiladora Plant here in Nuevo Laredo because he wants to obtain a better income for him and his family. He would like to have a better stock in his grocery store to give different kind of products to his customers and keep growing the business. For that reason he is asking for a loan of $500. He wants to repay in a term of 12 months.

Espaol

El Sr. Ral Hernndez y su familia tienen una tienda de abarrotes, el tambin trabaja en una planta Maquiladora aqu en Nuevo Laredo, porque quiere obtener un mejor ingreso para el y su familia. A el le gustara tener un mejor stock en su tienda de Abarrotes para ofrecer a sus clientes, mejores productos y si seguir creciendo el negocio, por esa razn esta solicitando un prstamo de $500.00, el cual planea pagar en un periodo de 12 meses.

loan.use: buy more products for his store

loan.name: Martha Francisca

texts.en:
Mrs Martha is a married woman, has threes children, and her husband works in a factory. She is a hard working woman, always trying to improve her economic situation and give a better future to her children.

Six years ago she had hard times because her husband was fired and this forced her to work by herself, and then she decided to start a small business of selling clothes. This business has been growing and has let her contribute in an important way to the family income.

In this moment she is planning to buy seasonal clothing and be able to offer a great variety of styles to her clients. For that reason she is requesting a loan of $375 USD to pay in a term of 4-8 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Doa Martha es una mujer casada que tiene tres hijos, su ,esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa, ella es un mujer muy trabajadora que siempre ha tenido en mente mejorar y brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Hace seis aos vivi momentos muy difciles, cuando su esposo se quedo sin empleo y esa fue la razn que la empuj a trabajar por su cuenta y fue entonces que se decidi a iniciar su pequeo negocio D. venta D. ropa, el cual ha ido creciendo y le ha permitido contribuir D. manera importante al ingreso familiar.

En este momento tiene planeado comprar una paca D. ropa D. temporada para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad D. estilos, es por ello que requiere D. un prstamo por $ 375 USD a pagar en un plazo D. 4-8 meses.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria is from Queretaro and is a single mother. For this reason she decided to open her own business in order to maintain her family. Since 5 years ago she decided to sell fruits and vegetables, but she did not have start-up money, so a friend of hers gave her some merchandise to offer her clients. She repaid her friend and also was able to save her own capital to start her own business, and she did it. First she offered her products from her house, and now she has a small store located in a small but very famous market in her city. The success of her business is specialization, because she only sells fruits and vegetables of the season. For this reason she is well known among her clients because she always has fresh products of the season. Maria is requesting a loan of US$ 275 to invest in merchandise for this season that is coming and she wants to be prepared and also keep her clients.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Maria es de Quertaro y es madre soltera, por ello tuvo la necesidad de tener su negocio propio y al estar teniendo que mantener a su familia no tena los medios para hacerlo. Hace 5 aos atrs decidi vender frutas y verduras, pero como no tena los medios para hacer esa inversin, una amiga le facilito algo de mercanca para que ella luego de venderla le pagase y que obtenga poco a poco su propio capital y as ya poder salir adelante. Comenz vendiendo casa por casa sus productos y le fue bien y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta ahora establecerse en un mercadito muy concurrido en su ciudad, el xito de su negocio se debe a que se especializ en la venta de frutas y verduras de temporada, por ello es conocida y las personas ya saben que si quieren algo fresco y de la temporada acuden a ella sin dudarlo. Maria esta solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de US$ 275 por el cambio de temporada que se avecina y necesita invertir en su negocio para que siga creciendo y manteniendo su clientela, este crdito ella piensa pagarlo en 6 meses.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Doris Margot

texts.en:
My name is Doris and I make my living by selling clothes in various markets in the city from Monday to Sunday. I have had this business for two years and I have earned enough money to support my children. The last months of the year in the Christmas season are already here. This is when there are the most sales. People buy clothes for their children. For this reason, I need to invest money now in more products.

Loan Use: Purchase of underwear, shirts, socks, t-shirts and other inventory

Me llamo Doris y me dedico a la venta de ropa ambulante, mi negocio es vender en mercados y colonias de la ciudad de lunes a domingo. Este negocio lo hago desde hace 2 aos, el que me ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de mis hijos. En estos ultimos meses es cuando mas venta hay, ya que se acerca la epoca navidea y hay personas que comprar la ropa de sus hijos por lo que necesito invertir para comprar mas producto.

loan.use: Compra de ropa interior, camisas, calcetines, camisetas y otros

loan.name: Delmi Johana

texts.en:
I have had a small beauty salon located in my house for two years now. Because of my good service, I have a variety of clients. I work Monday to Saturday and have Sundays at home. I cut hair for both men and women. I decided to start my own business because I couldn\'t find work ina company and needed money for the care and education of my son. It\'s a difficult job but I like making people feel pretty. In the upcoming months there will be more business because of graduations, weddings and Christmas. I am looking for somehting to embellish things a little more. It might be possible to cancel the last months of my son\'s primary school education in order to prepare for his enrollment in highschool next year.

Loan Use: Purchase of dryer, hair products, acrylic nails and other supplies

Tengo un pequeo salor de belleza instalado en mi casa desde hace 2 aos, y por el buen servicio que brindo tengo varia clientela, atiendo de lunes a sabado y los domingos a domicilio. Hago cortes de pelo para dama y caballero, asi como otros trabajos. Decidi instalar mi propio negocio porque no pude encontrar trabajo en alguna empresa y necesitaba tener ingresos para los cuidados y estudio de mi hijo. Es un trabajo cansado pero me gusta que las personas se sientan bonitas. En estos ultimos meses es cuando mas clientes tengo ya que hay graducaciones, bodas y navidad, por lo que me buscan para que las embellezca un poco mas y me ayuda a aumentar mis ganacias y podre cancelar los ultimos meses de estudio de mi hijo y prepararme para su inscripcion colegial el proximo ao.

loan.use: Compra de secadora, producto para el cuidado del cabello, uas acrilicas y otros.

loan.name: Jose Gustavo

texts.en:
My name is Gustavito and I sell clothes in a stall in the market. I have had my business for five years and I have been able earn enough money to let my business grow. Now I need to invest because I am selling wholesale and my clients demand variety and quality. The products that are sold include blue jeans, t-shirts, caps, girdles and portfolios. With this investment, I am going to obtain greater income to support my family.

Loan Use: This loan will be used to purchase clothes for men, women and children

Me conocen como Gustavito, y me dedico a la venta de ropa en general, tengo un puesto de ropa ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad. Tengo cinco aos de tenerlo, el que me ha generado ingresos para hacerlo crecer, ahora necesito invertir ya que estoy vendiendo al por mayor y mis clientes demandan calidad y variedad. Los productos mas vendidos son los blue jeans, camisetas, gorras, fajas y carteras. Se que con la inversion que haga voy a lograr obtener mejores ingresos para apoyar a mi familia.

loan.use: Compra de ropa para dama caballero y nio.

loan.name: Domitila

texts.en:
I have been making and seling tortillas for three years. Prior to this I worked for a houese cleaning company. I became ill and was asked to leave the house cleaning company at which point I began my tortilla selling business that has allowed me to support my family and take care of my health.

Loan Use: Buy corn lime and firewood

Me dedico a la elaboracion y ventas de tortillas, desde hace tres aos. Anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa de limpieza, enferme y me despidieron por lo que comence con mi negocio del que estoy contenta porque he obtenido ingresos para sostener a mi familia y tener para cuidar de mi salud.

loan.use: Compra de maiz, cal, lea.

loan.name: Lilia Celina

texts.en:
I sell milk products, catered foods and snacks. I do all of this from the comfort of my home which is wonderful for me and my family. I live in a neighborhood with alot of businesses which gave me the idea to create sellable lunches for the business people that work in the establishments. I created a dining area for them to buy and enjoy their lunch during their work day. I sell tacos, enchiladas, carne asada. Thanks to the success of this business I have been able to have the funds to build my home and put my children throught school. My goal is to be able to rent a larger space to create a buffet style dining room and also cater to special occasions.

Loan Use: Buy cheese, butter and other milk products

Me dedico a vender lacteos en mi colonia, tambien comidas por encargo y golosinas por las noches de jueves a domingo. Toda esta actividad la realizo en mi casa, esta es una gran ventaja y comodidad para mi familia y para mi. Vivo en una zona donde existen bastantes negocios por lo que se me ocurrio hacer almuerzos para estas personas, ellos llegan a mi casa donde habilite un espacio y puse mesitas para atenderlos y otros solo llegan a comprar y se van. Igual vendo tacos, enchiladas, carne asada por la noche, gracias a este esfuerzo que he hecho durante aos he podido terminar de construir mi casa y educar a mis hijos. Mi meta es poder rentar otro local mas grande y dar servicio buffet y prepar alimentos para reuniones, fiestas y cumpleaos.

loan.use: Compra de queso, quesillo, mantequilla.

loan.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is married and has 2 sons. He wants to have his own patrimony and for this decided to open his own business. He knew how to repair domestic machines but initially he did not have the resources to rent a place to work. He started working at home because he needed to maintain his family, so for 12 years he has run his own business. Little by little his business grew and he earned more clients. He needed more space so he decided to rent a place in which to work. His two sons help him in their free time in the business; this business is the only income to his family. He has a lot of demand so he needs more money for tools and repair parts to cover his demand and for this reason he is requesting for a loan of US$ 475 to invest in his business. He aims to pay this loan in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Jos esta casado y tiene dos hijos. El quiso tener su propio patrimonio y por ello decidi abrir su propio negocio. Como el saba el oficio de reparar aparatos electrodomsticos entonces como no tenia los recursos econmicos para rentar algn local fue en su casa donde abri su negocio. Aparte de tener su patrimonio y algo que dejarles a sus hijos en el futuro, necesitaba mantener su familia entonces fue hace 12 aos que inicio con su negocio. Poco a poco se hizo de ms clientes y por ello ya en su hogar no tena espacio por lo que amplio su negocio a un local comercial que hasta la fecha lo est rentando. Sus dos hijos le ayudan en el negocio en sus tiempos libres, este negocio es la nica fuente de ingresos de Jos. Debido a la demanda que tiene le hacen falta refacciones y herramientas para poder cumplir con los trabajos pendientes que tiene y por ello esta solicitando un prstamo de US$ 475 para invertir en su negocio, pagando el prstamo en 6 meses.

loan.use: To invest in tools and reparation parts

loan.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.en:
I sell clohing items from door to door to neighbors, business offices,markets, etc. I am doig this to support my children and get them ahead in life. Because my work is door to door it is very tiring but very worth it because it is enabling me to continue making payments on a piece of land where I can have the opportunity to build my own house one day. As the holidays approach business can be fruitful as people seek to purchase new clothes for their children or household items.

Loan Use: Purchase of blouses, skirts, t-shirts, clothes and other supplies.

Mis ventas las realizo ambulantemente, visito mis vecinos, oficinas, y mercaditos para vender mi productos. Por la necesidas de darles a mis hijos sus gastos he tenido que esforzarme y sacarlos adelante. Es bastante cansado el visitar a mis clientes pero el esfuerzo vale mucho, ya que casi termino de pagar un terreno en el que pienso comenzar a contruir mi casa propia, y despreocuparme de alquilar. En estos meses las ventas mejoran ya que todas las personas buscan comprar ropa nueva para sus hijos o utensilios para el hogar.

loan.use: Compra de blusas, faldas, camisetas, ropa de bebe y otros

loan.name: Ariola

texts.en: Ariola is a saleswoman in her neighborhood. Primarily she sells bibles to the people from her church and her community. She started off with $50 of investment capital and has slowly expanded her businesses. She also sells clothing and other products targeted towards women. In order to make her products affordable to her clients she takes half of the payment at the time of purchase and charges the rest on a weekly or bi-weekly rate. She is eager to receive a loan in order to buy more products for her clients like more bibles, CDs and clothing. She hopes that she can receive the loan before the busy Christmas season begins. This business is a complementary source of income in her household of 6 children. Her husband works as a bricklayer but he does not make enough money to provide for his family on his own.

loan.use: Buy bibles, clothing and other miscellaneous products to sell

loan.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa has been separated from her husband for over ten years and she is in charge of raising their only child. For several years her ex-husband would send her money in order to help cover the expenses for her household but now she is fully dependent upon her business. She opened her small store thanks to the support of her aunt who always encouraged her to find a means to sustain herself. From her small store she sells a variety of products ranging from condiments to detergent. She needs the capital in order to increase and diversify her inventory by buying from wholesalers. With the extra profits she hopes to continue to invest in her market and save for the future of her child.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Increase and diversify inventory

loan.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen owns a shop where she makes ceramic decorations. She learned how to work with ceramics from her parents when she was 18. When she got married 10 years ago she and her ex-husband set up the business in her home with the help of her parents who provided the ceramic oven which cost $100 at the time. Slowly she bought the molds for her decorations which became popular in her neighborhood. Now she not only sells ceramics she also teaches others how to make them through her courses. She is seeking investment capital in order to invest in molds and paints for her ceramics. She is anxious to receive the loan so she may improve her business and provide a better living for her 3 children whom she cares for on her own.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy molds and materials for ceramic production

loan.name: Manuela Oralia

texts.en:
Manuela is very dynamic woman. She is a widower as of few years ago, and she decided to start a small business of making art picture sales (especially religious pictures) to help her generate her own income and with this income make her living and educate her son. She started selling her products to her friends and little by little her business grew. Now she has an excellent portfolio of clients that constantly want to buy her products. Manuelas idea is to obtain a loan of US $475 to purchase raw materials for her business and maintain a stock of pictures for her clients. She hopes to pay this loan in 6-12 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Doa Manuela es una mujer muy dinmica, qued viuda hace algunos aos y decidi iniciar un pequeo negocio de venta de cuadros de arte (especialemente de motivos religiosos)para ayudarse generando sus propios ingresos y as poder sacar adelante a su hijo que estaba estudiando y no quera que descuidara sus estudios. Ella inici vendiendo con sus conocidos y poco a poco fue aumentando sus clientes hasta tener una cartera ya formada que permanentemente le solicita productos. La idea de Manuela es poder contar con un prstamo por $ 475 USD para poder comprar la materia prima para sus productos y as poder ofrecrselos a sus clientes para seguir contando con su preferencia, el plazo para pagar ser de 6-12 meses.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Katiuska

texts.en: Katiuska runs a small store where she sells medicines to the locals. She started this business with her ex-husband who worked as a medicine distributor in the city. 2 years ago he left her and the business. She now runs it on her own and is seeking a loan to make it grow. Katiuska wants to invest in new products geared towards infants like formula and bottles. She sees this business as her future and she is happy to be self sufficient. She hopes this loan will allow her to make her business grow without having to borrow from loan sharks who charge extremely high rates.

loan.use: Buy medicines for her small pharmacy

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a small store where she sells food and other household items. She started the store 4 years ago with the help of her daughter who gave her $150 of her savings from a job. At first she only started selling fruits and other foods but she has slowly been expanding her product line into other items for the home. She has 3 children who all help her run the business and depend on the store as the main source of income. Maria hopes to use the money from this loan to invest in products such as toys that will be popular for the upcoming Christmas season. She also wants to expand into the sale of beef and chicken.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in new products such as chicken and beef

loan.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia owns a beauty salon in her local community. She is married to a welder who encouraged her to take a course where she learned how to cut and style hair along with other skills. With the money he has saved up he bought her all the necessary supplies for her beauty salon which they have built in a part of their home. Virginia now wants to invest in new products for her clients such as shampoo, conditioner, hair dye, perfume etc. She is hoping that she will receive this loan because her husband does not have any more money and he has already sacrificed most of the savings set aside to invest in his own business. They have 1 child and they both hope that with this loan they will be able to provide a better future for him.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in products to sell at her beauty salon such as shampoo and perfume

loan.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth sells clothes in a local market for tourists in Guayaquil. Her husband works in the tile industry for a large company but his wage is very low. They have three children but one of them is mentally handicapped and therefore requires more of a financial and time commitment from his parents. Janeth has been a sales woman in this market since she was 20 years old when she began selling at the market named Bahia with her sister. She specializes in selling womens clothing but it is very difficult for her because she only has $50 in working capital. Her busiest days are on the weekends in the market and during the week she tries to sell to locals in her neighborhood. She is seeking the loan in order to buy more clothing in bulk.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy women's clothing at larger quantities

loan.name: Ligia

texts.en:
Ligia is a local saleswoman of bottled water and soft drinks. In the poor neighborhoods in Ecuador drinking water is scarce. Ligia takes advantage of this situation by providing safe drinking water and other beverages to the members of her community. She uses a tricycle with a platform on the back to sell and deliver these products. She has also discovered that many of her clients would also like the convenience of receiving other products at their door step. Ligias clients most often request chicken and seafood from her. She is seeking the loan in order to invest in these new products for her target market and also the buy the drinking water in larger quantities for a better price. She and her husband have four children. He helps her with this business and also creates hand made sandals to sell.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Purchase bottled drinking water in bulk and invest in new products to sell

loan.name: Rosa

texts.en: For over 8 years Rosa worked as a maid in upper class homes in Guayaquil until the responsibility with her children did not allow her to leave her home unattended and continue that line of work. Rosa now owns a small shop out of her home where she sells fruits, vegetables and other food items to the general public. This business has allowed her to maintain a close relationship with her 5 children while also bringing in a consistent flow of income. Her husband works as a shoe salesman in La Bahia the local tourist marketplace. Although she was able to launch her business with only $100 she is now in need of more capital in order to make it grow. She will invest the money in buying new products at better prices and at larger quantities. She has decided not to lend from loan sharks due to the very negative experiences have close friends have had with them.

loan.use: Invest in new products at better prices and at larger quantities

loan.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 56 years old and she is very good entrepreneur. She is a single mother and has one son. This is the reason that seven years ago she decided to start her own business. She started with very little merchandise, but little by little her business grew and she also started to sell clothes with excellent results. She is very clear about the secret of success in a business like hers; She knows it is the variety of products that she offers because if a client is looking for something that she does not have, he or she may never return to her, for this reason she tries to be with good stock. Valentina is requesting a loan of US$ 475 to purchase merchandise and new clothes for the season and she is hoping to repay the loan in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Valentina es una mujer de 56 aos de edad muy emprendedora, ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo, motivo por el cual hace siete aos decidi iniciar su negocio de mercera de manera muy incipiente, poco a poco fue hacindose de mas mercancas hasta incluso incluir la venta de ropa, con excelentes resultados entre sus clientes. Ella esta conciente de que el xito de un negocio como el suyo esta en el surtido de mercancas que tenga, ya que si un cliente busca algo y no lo encuentra ya no querr volver, es por eso que procura siempre estar bien surtida, es por eso que necesita un prstamo por la cantidad de $475 USD para comprar diversa mercanca, as como algo de ropa de la nueva temporada, su plan es pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa has been separated from her husband for over ten years and she is in charge of raising their only child. For several years her ex-husband would send her money in order to help cover the expenses for her household but now she is fully dependent upon her business. She opened her small store thanks to the support of her aunt who always encouraged her to find a means to sustain herself. From her small store she sells a variety of products ranging from condiments to detergent. She needs the capital in order to increase and diversify her inventory by buying from wholesalers. With the extra profits she hopes to continue to invest in her market and save for the future of her child.

loan.use: Increase and diversify the inventory at her small store

loan.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a young girl and is 24 years old. She is dynamic and enthusiastic. She is single and has three daughters, and for this reason she decided to started her own business. Her daughters are the motivation of her life and they are her first thought when she wants to grow her business because she wants to offer them a better future. Her business is selling crystal and sets of dishes. Her products have so far done well in the marketplace and for this reason she is requesting a loan of US$ 475 to purchase merchandise and satisfy all of the orders that she has. Her demand will also increase this Christmas season. She offers to pay this loan in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Anglica es una mujer joven de 24 aos, muy dinmica y entusiasta, ella es soltera y tiene tres hijas, es por eso que hace tres aos decidi iniciar su negocio, sus hijas son el motor de su vida y son en las que piensa cuando quiere hacer crecer su negocio, pues quiere estar en condiciones de poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Su negocio es la venta de vajillas y cristalera, sus productos tienen muy buena aceptacin entre sus clientes y es por eso que requiere de un prstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 USD para comprar mercanca del agrado de sus clientes y satisfacer sus pedidos los cuales se incrementan en esta prxima temporada navidea, la idea que tiene Anglica, es pagar el crdito en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Karen Melissa

texts.en:
I have been selling candy for five years. This is a family tradition. My grandmother taught me how to make candies and now I sell them to general stores, markets and neighbors who like to eat my chocoate candies. Thanks to my sales, I am able to help my husband with family expenses and the cost of educating our children.

Loan Use: Buy milk, cocoa, sugar, cinnamon

Tengo mi venta de dulces desde hace cinco aos, esta es una tradicion familiar, mi abuela me enseo a preparar los dulces y ahora me dedico a venderlos en pulperias, mercaditos y vecinos quienes les gusta comer mis dulces de coco. Gracias a mis ventas puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de la famiia y el estudio de mis hijos.

loan.use: Compra de leche, coco, canela, azucar.

loan.name: Nuvia Veronica

texts.en:
My name is Nuvia and I create and sell sweets such as dulce de leche and chocolates. My major buyers are people who own pulperias(cafe/stores) sweets stands, and some restraunts. I have had my business for 5 years, and I have generated earnings enough to continue my studies because my parents do not have many resources and I study at night. Right now I am making baskets for the holiday season so that I can carry my sweets in them.

Loan Use: Purchase milk, cocoa, cinnamon and other items

Me llamo Nuvia y me dedico a la preparacion de dulces de leche y conservas de coco. Mis mayores compradores son personas que tienen pulperias, casetas de dulces, algunos restaurantes. Tengo cinco aos de dedicarme a este negocio que me ha generado ingresos para continuar con mis estudios ya que mis padres son de escasos recursos y estudio por la noche. En este momento por epoca navidea las personas que preparan canastas me hacen encargos para colocar mis conservas y dulces en sus canastas.

loan.use: Compra de leche, coco, canela y otros

loan.name: Nora

texts.en:
My name si Nora and I sell blouses, shirts, socks and plastic containters. I store my merchandise in my house and I travel to neighbors and offices in the afternoon to sell. My profits help my support my family with food and education. It is the Christmas season and I need to provide inventory and increase my sales.

Loan Use: Purchase clothing for men and women, bedding and plastic articles

Me llamo Nora y me dedico a vender al por menor blusas, camisas, calcetines, recipientes de plasticos y otros de forma ambulante. Mi mercaderia la tengo en mi casa de habitacion y por las tardes salgo a vender a vecinos u oficinas donde me conocen. Los ingresos que tengo de mis ventas me ayudan a sostener a mi familia en alimentacion y estudios. Por temporada navidea necesito invertir para poder surtir mi inventario y mejorar mis ventas.

loan.use: Compra de ropa de caballero, dama, cobertores de cama y articulos plasticos.

loan.name: Pauline

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by around twenty women who have formed a rotating savings and loan association called Niaq Jarinu in the rural village of Mbam in central Senegal. Represented by group leader Pauline D., the Niaq Jarinu association describes how they will invest the loan:

Our group is already active in the buying and selling of various products (i.e. purchasing local food products such as mangoes or salty dried fish directly from producers and selling them at retail prices from roadside stands a traditional womens occupation in Senegal). The loan will finance the business of selling local grains (millet) and seafoods, to be undertaken by the women following a rotation schedule of ten people per lending period (In other words, the loan will go into a group fund which will be lent to ten members to finance their individual enterprise activities for a fixed period of time, then lent in turn to the remaining ten members. Funds reimbursed to Kiva would be replaced by contributions from the group members profits). The fruit and vegetable market is not saturated in Foundiougne, which is a large city (near Mbam). This system of revolving credit permits us to better take advantage of investment opportunities, because it allows for the division of credit among our members, and thus a sharing of risks.

Loan objectives:

Boost the income of the women in the group

Start a fund for the eventual establishment of a collective vegetable garden

Support the achievement of our members buying and selling objectives

Activities:

Selling of seafood products and vegetables

Operating street-side stalls that sell cooked meals and fresh produce

Buying and selling of various local food products at market

Original French :

Le groupement est dj actif sur la commercialisation de produits divers. La prt doit couvrir un projet de vente de crales locales et de fruits de mer lintention des femmes suivant une rotation de 10 personnes par priode de prt. Le march des fruits et lgumes nest pas satur Foundiougne qui est une grande ville. Le crdit revolving permet de mieux rentabiliser linvestissement dans la mesure o il favorise une division du crdit entre ses membres et un partage des risques.

Objectifs du Prt :

- augmenter les revenus des femmes membres du groupement

- disposer dun fond de dpart pour lamnagement ultrieur dun potager collectif

- appuyer les bnficiaires dans la ralisation de leurs objectifs dachat et de vente

Activits :

- vente de produits halieutiques et de lgumes

- restauration et vente

- petit commerce

Background

Senegal is one of the worlds poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loan.use: Retail sale of local food products

loan.name: Jean Christophe

texts.en:
This loan will be shared by a team of six teachers who manage a childrens education and activity program called TIC in the village of Parcelles Assainies. The teachers plan to add computer training to their curriculum, and have applied for a loan to finance the purchase of P3 computers and other necessary supplies. The demand for computer literacy training in Senegal is strong and growing even in rural areas, and the group plans to earn a profit by charging a small tuition fee to the large number of students expected to enroll. The program director who will sign for the loan, Jean Christophe D., described the project:

The TIC childrens program was born from the realization of childrens lack of access to the educational opportunities offered by the recent explosion of information technology in Senegal. This situation is due to the inexistence of an institutional framework for bringing information technology to children, the failure to adapt existing computer education programs to children, parents lack of interest in this tool and in the opportunity it offers, and the prohibitive cost of Cybercafs for children. The TIC childrens program responds to this need and is designed to raise childrens level of access to information technology. It aims to contribute in this way to the early education of young children as well as the training of young adolescents.

The objective of the loan is to finance the purchase of computers and the establishment of a working capital fund for the various activities to be undertaken as part of this project:

The installment of the necessary infrastructure and computers

The launch of computer education classes

The marketing of the computer classes

The organization and management of the program

The execution of computer classes for 90 children per month, each of whom will pay a tuition fee of 3000 francs CFA (about $6), for 12 months

We have a building in the village of Parcelles Assainies, at the Centre dExcellence des Parcelles Assainies, number 10. The team of instructors is already organized, with two teachers working with the children at present.

Original French:

Le programme TIC enfance est n du constat de labsence daccs des enfants aux programmes dveil quoffre lexplosion de linformatique au Sngal. Cette situation sexplique par linexistence dune infrastructure, linadaptation des programmes lorsquils existent, le manque dintrt des parents sur cet outil et sur lopportunit quil offre et la chert des cybers pour les enfants. Le projet TIC enfance rpond ce besoin et a pour objectif dlever le niveau daccs des enfants linformatique. Il se veut une contribution lveil de la petite enfance et la formation des jeunes adolescents.

*Lobjectif du prt est de financer lachat dquipement et la mise en place dun fond de roulement pour les diffrentes activits raliser dans ce projet :

-Mobilisation de linfrastructure et des quipements

-Initiation de modules dducation

-Confection et commercialisation de produits

-Promotion des produits

-Organisation et gestion du projet

*Lexcution de formation pour 90 enfants par mois sur les 250 du programme EPOM suivi pour une scolaritde 3000 sur 12 mois.

Ymca dispose dun local (aux Parcelles) le CEPA (Centre dExcellence des Parcelles Assainies) lunit 10. Une quipe pdagogique existe dj avec 2 professeurs travaillants linitiation des enfants.

Don Roberto es un hombre de 60 aos est casado y junto con su esposa atienden su negocio de farmacia , ellos tienen 4 hijos y aprendi el negocio desde su padre que fue uno de los pioneros en la ciudad de Victoria en el giro. De su padre tambin adquiri los conocimientos de botnica, lo que le ha permitido elaborar medicinas alternativas a base de hierbas y plantas por mas de 40 aos. Conocedor que la temporada de invierno es poca en que surgen con mucha frecuencia las enfermedades, quiere incrementar su inventario de medicinas alternativas, ya que son muy demandadas por sus clientes debido a que tienen menores efectos secundarios en las personas y la gente las prefiere por ser naturales. l esta solicitando un crdito por $ 925 USD para incrementar su inventario de medicina alternativa y piensa pagarlo en un trmino de 6-12 meses.

loan.use: To purchase raw material for natural medicine

loan.name: Humberto Gabriel

texts.en:
Humberto is 36 years old and has a shoes repair business, in this business he repair all kind of shoes from his clients and additionally has video games machines in his work place. He learned this activity from his father and he get this business approximately 10 years. Humberto needs a loan of US$ 925 to purchase raw materials that he uses in his place and also purchase an additional video game machine because a lot of child came to his place to play. He offer to pay in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Humberto es un hombre de 36 aos de edad que tiene un negocio de renovacin de zapatos, es decir, ah se hacen composturas a los zapatos de sus clientes, y adicionalmente tiene maquinas de videojuegos en su local. l aprendi el oficio de su padre que tambin era zapatero y tiene con su negocio ya independiente cerca de 10 aos. Humberto necesita un prstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 USD para comprar materiales que usa en su taller y adquirir una maquina adicional de videojuegos, dado que ha tenido mucha aceptacin en esa zona. El plazo para pagar que solicita es de 6-12 meses.

loan.use: To purchase raw materials and a video game machine to his business

loan.name: Jose Abelardo

texts.en:
Jose is married and has two sons, he is a very hard worker and also visionary, when he was fired he and his wife decided to start a business but their incomes were so low to do this investment and not enough to support the family expenses he decided to study any cooking courses because he wanted to be a chef, and then he opened a dinners sales business which today is very known in his city, Jose is requesting for a loan of US$ 925 to purchase materials because his business grow and also he offer now a service of chair and tables rent business to increase his incomes. He offer to pay this loan in 6 months at least.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Don Jos esta casado y tiene dos hijos, es un hombre muy trabajador y visionario, que cuando se quedaron sin empleo el y su esposa decidieron iniciar un negocio de comercio pero como sus ingresos eran insuficientes para cubrir los gastos de su familia, decidi tomar cursos de cocina para llegar a ser chef, y fue as como inici posteriormente su negocio de banquetes, el cual hoy en da es bien conocido en la regin. l esta solicitando un crdito por la cantidad de $ 925 USD para capital de trabajo, ya que como amplio su giro al ofrecer la renta de sillas, mesas y manteles, se quedo corto de efectivo y requiere del financiamiento para darle un empujn a su negocio. El plazo que esta solicitando es de 6-12 meses.

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria S. is 60 years old. She is single, and has dedicated her life practically to take care of her mother; her mother is an older person. She has dedicated 6 years to her business which is a stationery store; which was established to be close to her mother. She is a very popular person and she always gives the best service to her clients. Mrs. Maria S. requires a loan of $ 700.00 to expand her business. She wants to increase her activity and generate a greater income that will help her to take care of her mother in life and in death.

Espaol

La Seora Mara Severa tiene 60 aos, ella es soltera y ha dedicado su vida prcticamente al cuidado de su madre, quien es una persona de edad avanzada, tiene 6 aos dedicada a su negocio una papelera; la cual estableci para estar cerca de su madre; es muy reconocida en su comunidad pues siempre esta pendiente de las necesidades de sus clientes y la calidez de su atencin es tambin muy reconocida. Ella requiere ampliar su negocio para lo que necesita un capital de $ 700.00 y pagarlos en 12 meses, ya que quiere incrementar su actividad y generar mayor flujo que le permita enfrentar la eventualidad de que se deteriore la salud de su madre.

loan.use: expand her business

loan.name: Khadijatou

texts.en:
This loan will be shared among the twenty members of Ujamoral, a womens rotating credit and savings association based in the tiny island village of Carabane at the mouth of the Casamance River. The Diola people who live on the mangrove islands of the Casamance River have developed a complex trading system in which each island village produces its own specialty good, such as dried shrimp or palm oil. Small-scale commerce is traditionally a womens activity here, and the Diola women spend a lot of time crisscrossing the river in handmade wooden canoes to buy and sell the various island products. The island of Carabane is especially well known for its oysters, which are reputed to be among the best in West Africa, as well as for a strong wine made from the pressed fruit of the cashew tree. However, most of Carabanes residents earn their living from fishing, and the women there often produce smoked fish and oysters which they transport and sell in markets as far away as Dakar and Banjul, where they are in high demand for flavoring traditional stews and sauces. The Ujamoral group has applied for a loan to launch just such a smoked seafood business, to cover the purchase of a canoe for fishing and collecting shellfish, equipment for smoking the seafood, and transportation of the finished products to market. The groups leader, Khadijatou N., submitted the following business plan:

The Ujokoral group is made up of the women of the village of Carabane who are active in the production and trade of seafood products. The group aims, among other objectives, to improve the standards of living of its members and of the surrounding community through its revenue-generating activities. The group proposes to undertake the following activities:

Harvesting and selling seafood (oysters, shellfish, shrimp, and fish which are in high demand on the national market)

Processing and smoking fish: smoked fish are in high demand in countries neighboring Senegal (Gambia and Guinea-Bissau)

Local commerce: sale of these products for domestic usage

In order to execute these activities, this group of twenty members requests from SEM a loan of 700000 F, which they will share among themselves in order to resolve the precariousness of the life they are living right now.

Budget:

Purchase of a pirogue (a handmade wooden fishing canoe): 300000 F

Supplies for the processing and smoking of fish (knives, cutters, and equipment for a smoking oven): 150000 F

Purchase of fresh fish: 100000 F

Transportation for the sale of our products at markets at the national level: 150000 F

Total: 700000 F

Original French:

Contexte du Projet. : Le groupement Ujokoral regroupe des femmes de lco village de Carabane qui sactivent dans la production et lcoulement des produits halieutique et de commerce dappoint

Objectifs du Prt : Le groupement sest fix entre autre objectifs celui de pouvoir amlior les conditions de vie de ses membres e de son entourage travers des activits gnratrices de revenus.

Activits : Le groupement se propose de mener les activits suivantes :

- Cueillette et vente de fruits de mer (hutres, coquillages, crevettes, yt qui sont trs sollicits dans le march national.

- Transformation et fumage de poissons : recherchs dans les pays voisins du Sngal.

- Commerce dappoint : vente de produits usage domestique.

Pour mener bien ces activits, le groupement qui compte 20 membres sollicite auprs du SEM un financement de 700 000F quelles se partageront entre elles afin de pouvoir faire face la prcarit de la vie quelles vivent actuellement.

Budget :

Achat de pirogue : 300000 F

Matriel de transformation et de fumage de poissons (couteaux, coupe-coupe, et matriel pour un four de fumage) : 150000 F

Achat de la matire premire (poissons frais) : 100000 F

Transport pour la vente du produit dans le march au niveau national : 150000 F

Total : 700000 F

Background

Senegal is one of the worlds poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Estela M., and her husband, Mr. Pedro , is a very united and very enthusiastic working couple. They have 4 years working together to achieve their goals in their grocery store. Their Grocery store is already very recognized in the neighborhood and they have a lot of customers. They start selling basic products, and the business grows rapidly. The customers are asking for school supplies and more variety of foods, and dairy products. They ask for a loan of $ 800.00 to increase the product stock and buy school supplies for the business. The repayment term will be 12 moths. Espaol

La Sra. Maria Estela M. y su esposo el Sr. Pedro, son una pareja muy unida y personas muy trabajadoras ya tienen 4 aos de esfuerzo, logrando que su tienda de abarrotes sea reconocida en su colonia teniendo as muchos clientes; iniciaron con la venta de productos bsicos; han crecido y les demandan artculos escolares y ms variedad de alimentos, bsicos y lcteos. Solicitan $ 800.00 de apoyo para incrementar su inventario y adicionar a su negocio el giro de la papelera, ellos planean pagarlo en in plazo de 12 meses.

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria M. Chavez is married woman, she has a daughter. 3 years ago Mrs. M. decided to help her husband with the house expenses. In addition of her necessities she gets in charge of her sister who suffers a handicapped problem. She start selling food to the neighbors; at the present time she already has more clients, and she needs to acquire one more a stove that allows her to prepare more variety of foods, to cover the demand of his clients. On weekends her husband helps her with the food elaboration and distribution. She comments "I need to work very hard; I want that my daughter continues studying because she is very intelligent; she goes to the school and obtain very good notes". Maria Socorro requires $950.00 to grow her business and realizes her objectives.

Espaol

La Sra. Maria Martnez Chvez es casada y tiene una hija, hace 3 aos la Sra. Martnez decidi apoyar a su esposo en el gasto familiar pues adems de sus necesidades qued a cargo de su hermana que sufre de una discapacidad motriz; inici vendiendo comida a vecinos; hoy ya tiene ms clientes y necesita adquirir una estufa ms grande que le permita preparar ms variedad de alimentos para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. En los fines de semana su esposo le ayuda en la preparacin y distribucin de lo alimentos que prepara. Ella comenta Necesito trabajar muy duro; quiero que mi hija siga estudiando pues es muy inteligente; ya va a la escuela y tiene muy buenas notas Mara del Socorro requiere $ 950.00. Para hacer crecer su negocio y lograr su objetivo

loan.use: buy a bigger stove and ingredients

loan.name: Ndong

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared among eight young women who work as housemaids in the village of Yoff, just outside Senegals capital Dakar. These maids come from Serrer farming villages in the interior, where food production has declined so much in recent years that outside sources of income are needed to avert famine in the months before the October harvest season. Those that manage to find work as housemaids in the city typically earn around $20 a month, plus a sack of rice to send home to their families. This group of maids, led by Ndong D., learned about the SEM microfinance program through the evening literacy classes they were attending at our partner organization, CRESP. They submitted the following proposal for a loan to finance a plan to move beyond maids work by starting a business to sell local produce, snacks and meals from street-side stands:

This project is to sell bissap (a sweet, bright-red drink made from the flowers of the African bissap plant), vegetables and sandwiches; buying millet (in bulk from producers) and reselling it to the women who sell couscous and millet porridge; selling bread (in Senegal women purchase loaves from the bakeries each morning and resell them from simple street-side stalls); buying beans, tables, and eggs (for preparing and selling simple meals and snacks). We want to do this in order to improve our way of earning a living, and also in order to be independent and work for ourselves, and to be in a better position to help our families. We are sure that we are going to repay the loan without any problems.

Budget:

To start the project : Project total 225,000 CFA

Senegal is one of the worlds poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loan.name: Adrien

texts.en:
This loan will be shared by a group of ten entrepreneurs who live in the seaside village of Ngaparou, whose hotels and campgrounds are popular with tourists. The group, known as Diokoo and led by Adrien C., submitted the following business plan:

Background: Situated in the center of the country in the region of This, dpartement of Mbour, Ngaparou is a traditional village composed mainly of fishermen. Some of the village women dedicate themselves to the processing of fish and other seafood, while others are more interested in earning their livelihood from the tourist industry. The Diokoo group belongs to the latter category.

Loan objectives: To use access to credit to better undertake commercial activities; to help to improve the living conditions of our group members. To contribute to the economic development of our community and of the country overall.

Activities: The principal activity planned by the Diokoo group is commercial; it consists of buying and selling eggs at the local hotels, sea stations, and tourist campgrounds. The group members will purchase the eggs by order from Dakar, and will rent a vehicle to deliver their merchandise to them. A bicycle will be purchased and used to deliver the eggs within the village of Ngaparou and in the surrounding villages.

Budget:

Purchase of eggs : (400 boxes*800F) 320 000 F

Rent of a vehicule to deliver the eggs from Dakar to Ngaparou : 80 000 F

Setting up a storage facility : 50 000 F

Purchasing a bicycle for local delivery of the eggs : 50 000 F

Total : 500 000 F

Original French:

Contexte du Projet: Situer au centre du pays dans la rgion de This dpartement de Mbour le village de Ngaparou et un village traditionnel compos en majorit de pcheurs. Les femmes se donnent en partie la transformation des produits halieutique pendant que dautres sont plutt intress par le tourisme et les activits touristique, cest dans ce cadre que sinscrit le groupement Diokoo.

Objectifs du Prt : Avoir accs au crdit, pour pouvoir mener des activits commerciales ; aider amliorer les conditions de vie des membres du groupement. Contribuer au dveloppement de la localit en particulier et du pays en gnral.

Activits ; Lactivit principale que se propose le groupement Diokoo est commerciale ; il sagit dachat et de vente duf dans les htels de la station balnaire, les campements touristique. Les membres du groupement achteront le produit Dakar sur commande ainsi ils dplaceront un vhicule de location pour la livraison de leur marchandise. Un vlo sera achet pour les livraisons dans lco village de Ngaparou et les villages environnant.

Budget :

Achat des ufs : (400 tablets*800F) 320 000 F

Location de vhicule de livraison de Dakar Ngaparou : 80 000 F

Amnagement dun magasin de stockage : 50 000 F

Achat dun vlo pour les livraisons interne : 50 000 F

Total : 500 000 F

Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.
