loan.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a young single woman, dynamic and entrepreneur that learned how to do business when she was a child because her grandmother had a business and Lourdes used to help her with the business. In 2001 she started her snacks sales business but it was so elemental with so few merchandise, little by little she was investing in more products and her business are near to a school so she began to sell school articles having success and she could buy a photocopy, a showcase and shelves. Lourdes is requesting for a loan of US$ 475 to purchase merchandise that she uses in some handmade articles for Christmas because her demand increases this season. She offers to pay this loan in 5 months.

**\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Lourdes es una mujer soltera muy dinmica y emprendedora que aprendi el comercio desde pequea, pues su abuelita tena un negocio y ella acostumbraba ayudarla en el mismo. En el 2001 inici su negocio de venta de snack de manera muy elemental, con lo mnimo de mercancas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo en mas productos y aprovechando la cercana con una escuela empez a vender artculos escolares, teniendo muy buen xito, a tal grado que compr una copiadora, enmicadora, vitrina y estanteras. Lourdes est solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de $ $ 475 USD para poder surtirse de mercanca que se usa en la elaboracin de manualidades, ya que por la temporada navidea se incrementan la demanda por ese tipo de materiales. El plazo solicitado para pagar es de 5-10 meses.

loan.use: To purchase raw materials

loan.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a dynamic and enthusiastic woman; she is married and has two sons, all her family work in her chicken, egg and fruits sales business. Additional she has three employees. She started her business two years ago because her husband was work in a chicken farmer and learned too much there. When she began her business she first sold her products on a moving market, but at this moment she has an establish place. Irma is requesting for a loan of US$ 475 to purchase merchandise and she is thinking to pay this loan in 6 months.

**\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Doa Irma es una mujer muy dinmica y entusiasta, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, todos juntos trabajan en su negocio de venta de pollos, huevos y frutas. Adicionalmente les dan trabajo a tres personas. Iniciaron su negocio hace dos aos, ya que su esposo trabajaba en una granja de pollos y aprendi lo relacionado con el giro ah. Cuando iniciaron vendan sus productos en los mercados rodantes, pero en estos momentos estn establecidos formalmente en un local. Doa Irma esta solicitando un crdito de $ 475 USD para la compra de pollos y frutas y piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Martha Carolina

texts.en:
Martha is a single mother and has three sons; she started her business selling tamales, cakes and cookies of fine pastry shop and with the pass of the time she learned to make floral adjustment, so during November and December she offers her products. Martha is requesting for a loan of US$ 550 to purchase raw materials to make her products and will pay this loan in 5 months at least.

**\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Doa Martha es una madre soltera de tres hijos, inici su negocio vendiendo tamales, pasteles y galletas de repostera fina y con el tiempo aprendi a elaborar arreglos florales por lo que durante los meses de noviembre y diciembre ofrece sus coronas de muertos. Ella esta necesitando un financiamiento por la cantidad de $ 550 USD para comprar materiales para usar en la elaboracin de las coronas de flores que son tan demandadas en esta temporada y quiere pagarlo en un plazo de 5-10 meses.

loan.use: To purchase raw materials

loan.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is from Puebla in the center of the country but he came to Linares looking for a better future; he is married and has two sons. His family always was a business people, for this reason he started his business in 1985, following with his tradition of clothes sales. With the pass of the time he adds other products to his business like flower adjustment for dead people (this is a tradition in Mexico, especially in November and December). Pedro is requesting for a loan of US$ 325 to purchase raw materials to elaborate his products and also purchase merchandise for the next season and have more diversity to offer to his clients, he needs 4 months to pay this loan.

**\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Pedro es originario de Puebla en el centro del pas, pero se vino para Linares en bsqueda de un mejor futuro, el esta casado y tiene dos hijos. El proviene de una familia comerciante, es por ello que inici su negocio en 1985, siguiendo con la tradicin de venta de ropa. Con el paso del tiempo fue incorporando tambin la elaboracin de coronas para muertos en los meses de Noviembre y Diciembre. Don Pedro esta solicitando un prstamo por $ 325USD para la compra de material para elaborar las coronas y para comprar ropa para la prxima temporada y tener un mayor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes, El plazo que solicita para pagar el crdito es de 4-8 meses.

loan.use: To purchase raw materials

loan.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Ten years ago Isabel started her electrodomestic sales business because she had to support in her family economy and also widen her home. She is a very active woman and entrepreneur; she is married and her husband is a mechanic, they have five sons and all of them are married as well. When she started her business she did it as a raffle but actually she sells her products by credit and has a portfolio of almost 100 clients, with the incomes of her business she could buy a truck as a work tool because she now can transport her merchandise. Isabel is requesting for a loan of US$ 925 to purchase merchandise and be prepared for Christmas season when her sales increase.

**\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Hace 10 aos que Isabel inici su negocio de venta de artculos electrodomsticos, con la intencin de ayudar en la economa familiar y para poder ampliar su casa. Ella es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora, esta casada, su esposo es mecnico y tienen cinco hijos, ya todos casados. Cuando inici lo hizo a travs de rifas y tandas, actualmente vende sus productos a crdito y tiene una cartera de casi 100 clientes, con los ingresos de su negocio se compr una camioneta que le sirve para transportar sus mercancas. Solicita un crdito por $ 925 USD para comprar mercancas y estar preparada para la prxima temporada navidea en donde se incrementan sus ventas, piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.en:
Silvia is very entrepreneur woman, she is a single mother and love to learn and study, and for this reason she studied to be and stylist and open her own beauty salon business. She started 15 years ago because she had to maintain her daughter and she has a lot of clients. Silva is requesting for a loan of US$ 550 to purchase materials that she use in her business and offer a better services to her clients. She is thinking to pay this loan in 4 months.

Silvia es una mujer muy emprendedora, ella es madre soltera y le gusta mucho aprender, es por eso que tomo cursos de capacitacin para ser estilista y poder iniciar su negocio de saln de belleza. Hace 15 aos inici su negocio para poder sacar adelante a su hija, y ha tenido muchas satisfacciones, ya que sus clientes la prefieren. Silvia est solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de $ 550 USD para la compra de materiales que utiliza en su negocio para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela, y piensa pagar el crdito en un plazo de 4-8 meses.

loan.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Don Gustavo sells fruit and other items in the large outdoor markets of Guayaquil. He owns a small parcel of land in his hometown, Rocafuerte Manabi. He pays two of is nephews to maintain the land and grow a small variety fruits. Once a week Don Gustavo travels to his hometown with his two sons in order to pick up the fruit from his farm and buy more from other farms. His wife also sells fruits from their home in Guayaquil. Don Gustavo will use this loan to be able to buy larger amounts of fruits when he travels to Manabi. He also hopes to invest in new products such as cheese and meats.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in fruits and other products to sell in his market

loan.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi L. runs a very small market out of her home. She sells a variety of items including fruits and hygienic products. She started doing business about three years ago thanks to her husband who contributed $200 in start up capital. He realized that the family badly needed another source of income but he was concerned about his wife working and not being able to care for their 4 small children. The store has been a great solution as Mayi has a stable flow of revenue without having to leave the children alone. Every month her husband tries to give her about $20 in order to invest in the store. Mayi is seeking this loan in order to buy in bulk from wholesalers and to start investing in the physical appearance of the market.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Increase and diversify the inventory in her market

loan.name: Vctor

texts.en:
Victor is a vendor at local markets and fairs in Guayaquil. He sells a variety of items including cell phone accessories, baseball caps, sunglasses and others. He begins selling at 6 every morning and works until the sunset. He first started doing this type of business when he was ten with his father. He got married when he was 17 and now has a 3 year old daughter. He still lives in his parents home in an apartment they made for him. His goal is to increase his sales in order to one day have a home of his own for his young family. He plans to use the money from this loan in order to invest in new products for the Christmas season.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy cell phones, baseball caps, sunglasses and other products to sell

loan.name: Franco

texts.en:
Sofia works as a jewelry and clothes vendor in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She started off a seamstress who worked from home. She was able to save about $100 and invest in jewelry as a new activity. Her husband also helped her accrue these savings with the profit from his aluminum and glass workshop that is also run out of their home. This couple works closely together in order to support each others businesses because these microenterprises are the main source of income in their household of 3 children. Although they have always financed their businesses through their own savings they have come to realize that they need loans in order to increase revenue and profits. They will use these loans in order to invest fabric, clothes and jewelry for Sofia and in glass for the workshop.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in fabrics, clothes and other materials

loan.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a street vendor in Guayaquil, Ecuador. He uses a tricycle with a large platform in order to travel around his community selling a variety of items. He generates a good amount of business because his items are very accessible to the people in his neighborhood. His wife helps him by buying the products and sometimes traveling along with him in his daily route. He is seeking a loan in order to purchase his products at wholesale prices and possibly invest in a second tricycle for his wife to use. He works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon trying to cover as much ground as he can. He and his wife have two children together and they hope that with the profits generated from their investments they can improve their wooden house by starting to build cement sections.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy products at wholesale prices and invest in a new cart

loan.name: Ablavi Sli

texts.en:
Single and mother of 2 children from different fathers, Miss A. is an unmarried mother who is very dynamic, but who has not had the chance to find a good husband. For a very long time, her older brother took care of her in Lom and her children were living far away from her: one with her grandmother in the village and the second one was with her in-laws in very poor conditions.

Worried about taking care of herself and providing education for her children, Miss A. has started working as a house girl in order to get the working capital she needs to start small income generating activities.

Such a second hand Clothings trade allows her to do the following:

* Create her own job and to improve progressively her socio-economic living conditions

* Decrease the alienation she feels with her senior brother through her self sufficiency

* Contribute to her children\'s education and well-being.

The project exists to strengthen the second hand clothing trade which could be very profitable to Miss Seli Ablavi A. if she is successful buying the bales as a whole, instead of in retail. Buying the bales in retail requires having more consistent funds, and she does not have this luxury.

Furthermore, she forecasts expanding her activities to the cereals trade by buying and storing the agriculture products in abundance and reselling them for a profit. The project perfect implemention will allow her to improve her business\' profitability and grow her income enough to take care of her children\'s educational needs.

The credit of $800 will serve to rent a small shop and will allow her to have at her disposal suitable goodwill to strengthen her businesses. Currently, such a project deserves to be supported with the goal to help blossom businesses run by women in difficult economic situations. Franais

Clibataire et mre de 2 enfants de diffrents pres, Mlle A. Abla Fli est une fille mre trs dynamique mais na pas eu la chance de tomber sur un bon mari pour crer un foyer. Elle est reste trs longtemps la charge de son grand frre Lom et les enfants sont parpills chez les proches parents dans des conditions pitoyables. Soucieuse de se prendre en charge et de soccuper de lducation de ses enfants, Mlle A. a exerc le job de domestique pour se faire un capital pour dbuter une petite activit gnratrice de revenus. Ce commerce exerc lui a permis, entre autres de : se crer un emploi et damliorer progressivement ses conditions de vie socio-conomique - Rduire sa dpendance vis--vis de son grand frre par son auto prise en charge - Contribuer la scolarisation et au mieux-tre de ses enfants ; Le projet consiste renforcer le commerce de friperies qui pouvait tre trs rentable Mlle A. Ablavi Sli si elle arrivait acheter elle-mme en gros les balles au lieu du dtail, ce qui ncessite des moyens financiers plus consistants quelle ne dispose pas actuellement. Par ailleurs, elle prvoit tendre ses activits au commerce de crales en achetant et stockant les produits agricoles en priode dabondance pour les revendre en priode de soudure. La parfaite ralisation de projet lui permettra damliorer la rentabilit de ses affaires et daccrotre ses revenus en vue de prendre entirement en charge lducation de ses enfants et subvenir ses besoins.

Le crdit de $ 800 sollicit servira louer un petit magasin et lui permettra de disposer dun fonds de commerce adquat pour renforcer ses affaires. Aujourdhui, un tel projet mrite dtre soutenu en vue de lpanouissement de cette jeune femme en situation conomique difficile.

loan.use: Warehouse renting and Second hand clothing bales purchasing

loan.name: Yawa Enyonam

texts.en:
Mme. Yawa Enyonam T., 41 years old, is a mother of 04 children. Abandoned by her husband, her current income does not cover her needs and that of her children who are all at her charge. Very enterprising and experienced in nutrition, she has undertook soy processing activities which provide for her a substantial income allowing her partly cover her household expenses. This project consists in strengthening her soy beans by-product processing and marketing activities, namely: soy milk, soy yogurt soy cakes and doughnuts, soy flour for porridge or for the soup made with the Moringa leaves very rich in proteins and vitamins and well appreciated by patients living with HIV/AIDS to strengthen their nutritional immunity. The production is surrounded with an exceptional hygiene and quality of the product is well appreciated by the consumers. The proof is in the increasing demand registered that the currently production does not succeed to cover. The market is growing and is far from saturated. The credit requested will serve to acquire the small material and production equipment (vegetable mill, Cooker, Stove). It will also give her the working capital necessary to have a safety stock in order to assure the production of best quality all over the year.

Franais Age de 41 ans Mme T. Yawa Enyonam est mre de 04 enfants. Abandonne par son mari, ses revenus actuels narrivent pas subvenir ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants qui sont tous sa charge. Trs entreprenante et exprimente en nutrition, elle a entrepris cette activit de transformation de soja qui lui procure un revenu substantiel lui permettant dassurer en partie les charges de son mnage. Le projet consiste renforcer ses activits de transformation et de commercialisation des produits drivs du soja, notamment : le lait de soja - le yaourt de soja - le gteau et beignet de soja - la farine de soja pour la bouillie ou pour la sauce associe avec les feuilles du Moringa trs riche en protines et en vitamines et bien apprci par les personnes vinant avec le VIH/SIDA pour renforcer leur immunit nutritionnelle. Le crdit de $ 800 sollicit va servir acqurir le petit matriel et outillage de production (Moulinette, cuisinire, fourneau, etc.), disposer dun fonds de roulement ncessaire pour avoir un stock de scurit afin de garantir la production de meilleure qualit sur toute lanne.

loan.use: Soya beans by-products processing and marketing (Agribusiness)

loan.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Madam Yawa A. is an illiterate woman, about 39 years old. She is the mother of five (05) children and one among the several women of a husband virtually absent. She lives in the remote and enclosed village of Wougome-Dogbede-Kope without electricity and where the sole source of light is the kerosene lamp or oil lamp. To have a small quantity of kerosene, the inhabitants are obliged to cover a long distance of 5 to 15 km. Very talented in the identification and businesses opportunities analysis, she has made the choice as main activity the selling of paraffin oil which is increasing enough well. But due her very limited financial means, she is faced with many demands which she is unable to satisfy. Today, she needs the amount of $850 which will serve to buy a tank of 200 litres and to increase her stock of products. This new possibility will help her to satisfy not only the needs of her village, but also those of the five (05) other surrounding villages. This will allow Madame Yawa A. to live from the fruit of her work and to better satisfy her needs such as: foods, health, children dressing and education.

Mme A. YAWA est une femme analphabte ge de 39 ans environ. Physiquement bien portante, elle est mre de cinq (05) enfants et lune des multiples femmes dun mari virtuellement absent. Elle vit dans le village recul et enclav de Wougome-Dogbedakop sans lectricit et o la seule source de lumire est la lampe ptrole ou le lampion. Pour avoir un peu de ptrole, les habitants sont obligs de parcourir de une longue distance de 5 15 km Trs doue dans lidentification et dans lanalyse des opportunits daffaires, elle sest choisie pour activit principale la vente du ptrole lampant qui lui russit assez bien. Cependant, par ses moyens financiers trs limits, elle est confronte beaucoup de demandes quelle est incapable de satisfaire. Elle a besoin aujourdhui de $ 850 qui serviront installer une cuve de 2000 litres et disposer dun stock marchand consquent en vue daugmenter son chiffre daffaires. Cette nouvelle possibilit lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement les besoins de son village mais aussi ceux de cinq (05) autres villages environnants. Ceci permettra Mme Yawa A. de vivre du fruit de son travail et de mieux subvenir ses besoins immdiats, notamment: lalimentation, la sant, lhabillement et lducation de ses enfants.

loan.use: Tank acquisition and kerosene purchase

loan.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
About 45 years old, Madam Ablavi A. is a mother of four (04) children, and has at her charge two (02) motherless orphans. Tireless and very talented, she has the sense of a good educator and she is fighting for the success of her children. She is makes a living through the processing of palm oil into red oil, which is well appreciated and widely consumed in Togo. Her seasonal activity is flourishing due to the usefulness of the by-products of palm oil which provide her other sources of income. The activities of Madame Ablavi A. require a financing of $550 to buy palm nuts and tanks to make an significant stock to be sold in the case of shortage. That opportunity will allow her to increase her production and thus her income to ensure the essential needs of the numerous children for whom she is responsible.

Age de 45 ans environ, Mme Ablavi A. est mre de quatre (04) enfants et a sa charge deux (02) enfants orphelins de mre. Infatigable et trs dvoue, elle a le sens dune bonne ducatrice et se bat pour la russite de ses enfants. Elle vit Klm Sangura o elle exerce lactivit la transformation de la noix de palme en huile rouge trs apprcie et consomme au Togo. Cette activit saisonnire est trs florissante cause de tous les drivs de la noix de palme qui constituent galement dautres sources de revenus. Les activits Mme Ablavi A. ncessitent aujourdhui un financement de $ 550 pour lachat des noix de palme et de tonneaux pour faire un stock important tre revendu en priode de soudure. Cette opportunit lui permettra daccrotre sa production et de facto augmenter ses revenus pour assurer les besoins lmentaires de ses nombreux enfants qui sont presque tous abandonns elle seule.

loan.use: Palm nuts purchasing for palm oil fabrication and trading

loan.name: Massan

texts.en:
Madam Massan D., spouse of ATCHON was born in 1954 at Ekpui, in the prefecture of Vo. She made her studies in Ghana and has always kept the Anglophone style. Married and mother of 4 children, she is a very devoted and dynamic woman in commercial activities and operates a food shop situated in Lom, the area of Ntifafa-Kom. She has always shown the proof of good management and her previous credits have been promptly repaid and without incident. Her selling of food is coupled with the selling of the Brassiere beverages in retail. In order to increase the profitability of her activities, she needs a financing of $550 in order to be able to respond to the increasing demand of her customers. This credit will serve to constitute a stock of foodstuffs and beverage products in view of the end years activities, and especially the Christmas and New Year feasts

Madame D. Massan pouse ATCHON est ne en 1954 Ekpui dans la prfecture de Vo. Elle a fait ses tudes au Ghana et a toujours gard le style anglophone. Marie et mre de quatre enfants, elle est une femme trs dvoue et dynamique dans les activits commerciales et tient une boutique dalimentation gnrale sise Lom quartier Ntifafa-Kom Lom. Elle est une femme qui se respecte et se fait respecter par son entourage. Elle a fait preuve de bonne gestionnaire travers ses crdits antrieurs promptement rembourss et sans incident. Ce commerce dalimentation gnrale est coupl avec la vente de dtail des boissons de la brasserie. Le dveloppement et la meilleure rentabilit de ces activits ncessitent un financement de $550 pour pouvoir rpondre la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientle. Ce crdit servira constituer un stock de produits alimentaires et de boissons en vue des activits de fin danne, et surtout des ftes de Nol et de Nouvel An.

loan.use: To buy and storage foodstuffs and beverages products

loan.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Madam Akossiwa A. was born in 1955 in Tsvi in the Prefecture of Zio. She is the mother of five (05) children. Very dynamic and hardworking, she undertook early the trade of wood charcoal and cereals, two activities which are flourishing very well currently. The charcoal is bought by households for cooking, and cereals constitute the main basic food in Togo. She has shown many times her good management ability and demonstrated hard work. Considering the success implemented in her activities and significant increased demand, she needs greater financial means in order to respond to the market. The offer of this $450 credit will allow her to rent a store and assure a permanent stock for her activities and profitability.

Mme A. Akossiwa est ne en 1955 Tsvi dans la prfecture de Zio. Elle est mre de cinq enfants. Trs dynamique et audacieuse, elle a trs tt entrepris le commerce du charbon de bois et des crales, deux activits qui lui fleurissent aujourdhui trs bien ; le charbon tant trs sollicit dans les mnages pour le chauffage et les crales constituant lessentiel de lalimentation de base au Togo. Elle a dmontr plusieurs reprises sa capacit de bonne gestionnaire et sa rigueur au travail. Vu le succs quelle ralise dans ses activits et les demandes de plus en plus importantes, elle a besoin de plus de moyens financiers afin de pouvoir rpondre aux exigences du march. Loctroi de ce crdit des $ 450 lui permettra de louer un emplacement et dassurer un stock permanent pour la prennit et une rentabilit de ses activits.

loan.use: To rent a location and make important storage of charcoal

loan.name: Mathias

texts.en:
This loan will be shared by five members of the Yonn Njal Association, represented by Mathias D.. The group hails from Palmarin, a tiny fishing village on the edge of the immense salt flats of the Saloum River delta in central Senegal. Palmarins location favors the production of gejj, the salty dried fish that is a staple of traditional Senegalese cooking and is in high demand by housewives throughout the country. The loan will be used to purchase fresh fish from the fishermen of the village, salt and dry the fish on racks in the sun, and transport the finished gejj to markets in distant towns and cities.

Background

Senegal is one of the worlds poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegals networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loan.use: Dried fish production

payment.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loan.name: Vernica

texts.en:
Veronica owns a small store where she sells a wide variety of items including: snacks, jewelry, appliances and office supplies. She started her business off with only $5 in capital when she only sold tortillas and coffee. Slowly she began to grow and with the help of her mother she was able to open her small store where she sold rice, sugar, chicken, eggs and other foods. Now she sells many different products that are not food and she still prepares tortillas and coffee on the weekends. Veronica is a single mother who lives with her parents who have supported her since she separated from her husband. She hopes to invest in new and diverse products with the loan she receives from Kiva and Mifex. She is also contemplating opening up a second operation selling clothing.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Diversify and increase product offerings

loan.name: Belgica

texts.en:
Blgica is a single mother with 3 children. She supports her family with the income she makes from selling chickens and water. She began to work in poultry sale with her ex-husband. They owned a business together where she was in charge in preparing the chickens for her husband to sell. 3 years ago they got divorced and Blgica was forced to open her own business with $100 she had saved up. She bought a cart to sell chicken from and now she has also begun to sell water. Because she could not make it on her own she was forced to move in with her mother who helps her by taking care of the children. She has observed that there is plenty of demand in her community and needs the loan in order to buy more poultry and water for her clients. She hopes that with the profits she can move out on her own with her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy chicken and drinking water to sell

loan.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Don Miguel has been making sandals since he was a young boy. He learned his craft from his father and has since passed his knowledge of the sandal trade to his wife, whom he works with every day. Mr. B.s entire family helps out with the business one way or another, and each individual plays a crucial part in keeping the shop going. Miguel is applying for this loan so that he can purchase raw materials for his sandals, such as leather soles, straps, laminant, and glues. In order to prepare himself for the Christmas holiday, when more buying happens than at any other point during the year, Miguel would like to take out this loan through Kiva and Mifex. The sandal business has been good to Mr. B.. He says that although he is not rich, he is proud that he owns his home and has two boys who study hard in school. One of Miguels dreams is to open a storefront in one of the fairs or markets in Guayaquil, but in order to do that, he says, he will need capital to jumpstart his business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Buy materials for sandal making

loan.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Don Ricardo owns a repair shop where he fixes electronics. He specializes in audio and visual equipment but also works on computers and household appliances. He has been working in this type of activity for over 25 years since he was an assistant in his grandfathers shop. Don Ricardo has 3 children who are fully grown, but he and his wife insist on surviving by their own means and working in this shop. One of his sons and a nephew also help him with repairs and by bringing in clients. Don Ricardo will use the loan in order to buy replacement pieces and electrical materials at wholesale prices. This will help his business by reducing costs and increasing productivity as he will have a stock of replacements at his shop and will no longer have to go out and buy these items every time he needs them for higher prices.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loan.use: Invest in repair pieces for his workshop

loan.name: Kodjo

texts.en:
Mr. V. was born on October 13, 1973 in Lom, in the prefecture of Golf. Having not been able to continue his studies, he has been trained in high fashion design, for which he has demonstrated success. Married without children for the moment, he is living with three (03) dependents. He is the design master with 27 apprentices of whom 23 are young girls. Very social, calm and cool, he is a likable man and appreciated in his suburb and in the area. Also generous and charitable, he is training some girls in his workshop for free, and helps out with some of his apprentices\\\\\\\' needs like health care and lunch in the centre. His workshop is well attended and his machines are sufficient to respond to the current demand, considering the very high number of the apprentices. He plans now to acquire additional sewing machines and to undertake haberdashery trade near his workshop. This expansion of his activities requires a credit of $850, allowing him to acquire the two sewing machines and haberdashery articles.

M. V. est n le 13 octobre 1973 Lom, dans la prfecture du golfe. Nayant pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses tudes, il sest fait former en haute coouture quil exerce impeccablement aujourdhui. Mari sans enfant pour le moment, il a pourtant trois personnes sa charge. Il est matre tailleur avec 27 dapprentis dont 23 jeunes filles. Trs sociable et plus fministe, son air trs calme et sa patience font de lui, un homme trs aim et apprci dans son entourage et dans le quartier. Aussi gnreux que charitable, il forme gratuitement dans son atelier certaines filles trs ncessiteuses et subvient certains besoins de ses apprenties comme la sant et la djeuner au centre. Son atelier est trs bien frquent et ses machines sont insuffisantes pour rpondre aux exigences du moment vu le nombre trs lev dapprentis. Il prvoit alors dacqurir des machines coudre complmentaires et dentreprendre le commerce de mercerie (vente de tissus et des articles de couture) ct de son atelier. Cette extension de ses activits ncessite des moyens financiers de $ 850 lui permettant dacqurir les deux machines coudre et les articles de la mercerie

loan.use: To buy two sewing machines and haberdashery articles

loan.name: Madam Adjovi Sraphi

texts.en:
Madam Adjovi Sraphine S. was born in 1976 at Kouv. Married and mother of five (05) children, she is a hair dresser by trade and has opened her own hair dressing workshop COIFFURE REVELATION in Lom. Her good work made her reputation in the area. Moreover, Madam S. has well understood that, in Lom, the best equipped hair salons are more attended by the customers. So, to attract more customers, she plans to enlarge and equip her hair dressing salon with modern and higher performance materials. Very enterprising, she also wants to sell quality beauty products at her salon. This will provide her additional income to contribute to the needs of her household. The credit of $650 will serve to buy two (02) hair driers and to increase her stock of beauty products and cloths. This ambitious project deserves to be supported.

Mme Adjovi Sraphine S. est ne en 1976 Kouv. Marie et mre de 5 enfants, elle est coiffeuse de formation et a ouvert son atelier de coiffure COIFFURE REVELATION Lom. Son travail bien fait, fait sa rputation dans le quartier. Toutefois, Mme S. la si bien compris qu Lom, les salons de coiffure les mieux quipes sont plus frquents par les clients. Aussi, uvre-t-elle en ce sens. Ainsi, pour sduire et attirer davantage sa clientle, elle prvoit agrandir et mieux quiper son salon de coiffure par de matriels modernes et plus performants. Trs entreprenante, elle joint aujourdhui son mtier de coiffure, le commerce de produits de beaut. Ce qui lui procurera des revenus complmentaires pour contribuer aux besoins de son foyer. Le crdit de $ 650sollicit servira acheter deux schoirs et faire un stock de produits de beaut et de tissus. Cet ambitieux projet mrite dtre soutenu.

loan.use: To buy two hair driers and storage beauty products and clothes

loan.name: Madam Slom Kafui

texts.en:
Madam Kafui Slom G. operates a beverage bar and food store in the area Nkafu. A young, dynamic woman of 29 years old, she is married and is a mother of a child and had four (04) dependents. A hair dresser by trade, she had to abandon this career which was not profitable.She launched her retail business in 2004 with the opening of her own shop. She started her commercial activities with her own financial means of $180 and is entirely dedicated to her trade. She had benefited twice from a credit of $550 and promptly repaid and without incident.

Her commercial activity lies mainly in selling beverages and staple grocery products (sugar, soap, milk, tomatoes). Today, this trade is coupled with the opening of a restaurant which has been growing marvelously for about more than five (05) months. This secondary activity, which she only runs during the weekend for the moment, is well-liked because the menus and meals presented to the customers. Today, considering the significance that her activities are taking on, Madam G. is requesting a credit of $ 750 to increase her trade and to respond to her customers needs.

Madame G. Slom Kafui est dtentrice dun dbit de boisson et dune boutique dalimentation gnrale et de divers au Quartier Nkafu. Jeune femme trs dynamique ge de 29 ans, elle est marie et mre dun enfant et a en charge quatre (04) autres personnes. Coiffeuse de profession, elle d abandonner ce mtier qui ne lui tait pas trs rentable pour se lancer dans le commerce depuis 2004 avec louverture de sa propre boutique. Elle a commenc ses activits commerciales avec ses propres moyens financiers de $180 et sest sacrifie totalement son commerce. Elle avait bnfici deux fois de suite dun crdit de $ 550 promptement rembours et sans incident. Son activit commerciale repose essentiellement sur la vente des boissons de la Brasserie et des produits alimentaires de premire ncessit (sucre, savon, lait, tomate). Ce commerce est coupl aujourdhui avec louverture dun restaurant qui marche merveille depuis plus de cinq (05) mois. Cette activit secondaire qui se fait uniquement les week end pour le moment, marche trs bien compte tenu des plats et des mets proposs et trs apprcis par les clients. Aujourdhui, compte tenu de limportance que prennent ses activits commerciales, Mme G. de sollicite un crdit de $ 850 pour agrandir son commerce et rpondre aux besoins de sa clientle.

loan.use: To buy sugar, soap, milk tomatoes and beverages

loan.name: Madam Ayl Catherin

texts.en:
Madam Catherine Ayl D., spouse of ADJO, is living in the area of Nkafu (Toyota Bar) in Lom. This woman of 30 years old is a mother of three (03) children among whom two are twins (girls). Beside her own children, she takes care of an orphan dependent. Her husband is an unemployed printer and all the household duties are left up to her. She has started her business selling basic groceries, (sugar, condensed tomato, fresh tomato, soap, detergents and others) over the past two years with only the limited means she had at her disposal. Her business did not move forward significantly at the beginning on account of the insufficiency of the working capitals, is today enough flourishing due to the devotion and determination of Madam D., who deserves to be supported financially. The demand growing due to the very commercial location of the business, but her supply is insufficient.

Madam D. requests currently $ 500 to build up a significant stock of merchandise in order to respond to the customers demands. To finance this woman is to save a whole family.

Madame D. Ayl Catherine pouse ADJO est domicilie au quartier Nkafu (Toyota Bar) Lom. Cette femme ge de 30 ans, est marie et mre de trois (03) enfants dont des jumelles. En dehors de ses propres enfants, elle a en charge un autre enfant de parents trs dmunis. Son mari est un imprimeur rgulirement en chmage et presque tous les besoins de foyer repose trs souvent sur elle. Elle a commenc ses activits de vente des produits alimentaires de premire ncessit (sucre, tomate en bote, tomate frache, savon, dtergents et autres) il y a deux (02) ans avec les moyens drisoires quelle disposait. Cette activit qui navait pas connu une volution significative au dpart pour insuffisance de fonds de commerce, est aujourdhui assez florissante cause du dvouement et de la dtermination de Madame D. qui mrite dtre soutenue financirement aujourdhui. La demande se fait de plus en plus pressante cause de lemplacement trs commercial de lactivit mais loffre est insuffisante. Madame D. sollicite aujourdhui $ 500 pour constituer un stock important de marchandises tre revendu en priode de soudure afin de rpondre la demande de sa clientle. Financer cette femme, cest sauver toute une famille.

loan.use: To supply merchandises (sugar, soap, milk, sweets, chocolate, etc.)

loan.name: Kouassi

texts.en:
Mr. Kouassi H. was born in Lom on August 16, 1952. He is married and father of four (04) children but has five (05) dependents. Accountant by trade but unemployed, he started his private business by selling fresh water and ice blocks. Currently, he has at his disposal two centres of water processing at Attikpodji not far from the big market and the second at Kgu, a suburb of Lom. In Togo, ice blocks are in very high demand especially during the dry seasons due to the warmth. Owing to that activity, Mr. H. has at his disposal a substantial income which allows him today to nourish his family.

The credit of $500 which he is requesting currently should serve to buy one freezer and two coolers and to set up another retail location for the coming dry season when the demand is greatest.

H. Kouassi est n Lom le 16 aot 1952. Il est mari et pre de quatre enfants mais prend en charge cinq autres personnes. Comptable de formation sans emploi, il sest vite lanc dans linitiative prive par la vente deau et de moule de glace. Il dispose actuellement de deux centres de transformation Attikpodji non loin du grand march et le second Kgu, banlieue de Lom. Au Togo, les moules de glace sont trs recherches surtout pendant les saisons sches cause de la chaleur. Grce cette activit, M. H. dispose dun revenu substantiel qui lui permet aujourdhui de nourrir sa famille. Le crdit de $ 500 quil sollicite aujourdhui devra servir acheter un rfrigrateur, et deux glacires pour agrandir ses activits et installer un autre centre lapproche de cette saison sche qui sannonce o la demande est plus forte.

loan.use: To buy one freezer and 2 coolers

loan.name: Hlne

texts.en:
Miss Helene K. is a young, dynamic woman and mother of a girl whose father has been missing for three years. Abandoned and on her own, she has many difficulties to overcome and much to finance: food, rent, her child\'s education, clothing, etc. Born in 1974, she successfully completed her secondary education. She had her first professional experience in a private school. As a misfortune never happens alone, she had to put an end to that activity of teaching as her already low salary was not even paid to her. Very bewildered but keeping her courage, as she has nobody to help her, she has undertook the trade of sweets, biscuits and chocolates with $35 which she had at her disposal. After that she received a credit of $100 she repaid. Her second credit of $200 allowed her to expand her activities to shoes and beauty products, which could bring her more income if she has possessed a more consistent working fund. Currently, at the coming of the year end feasts, she needs $550 to buy articles, namely: womens shoes and beauty products. This will help her to grow her income and to improve her own living condition and that of her children.

Mlle Hlne K. est une jeune femme trs dynamique et mre dune fille dont le Pre est introuvable depuis trois ans. Abandonne elle-mme, elle a du mal joindre les deux bouts : nourritures, loyer, scolarit de son enfant, habillement, etc. Ne en 1974, elle est une femme lettre qui a termine le second cycle de lenseignement gnral. Elle a eu ses premires expriences professionnelles dans une cole prive. Comme un malheur narrive jamais seul, elle a d mettre fin cette activit denseignante qui tourne la msaventure car le maigre salaire aussi ne se payait pas. Trs dsempare mais gardant son courage car nayant personne lui venir en aide, elle a entrepris le commerce de bonbons , biscuits a chocolats avec $ 35 quelle disposait. Par la suite elle a obtenu un crdit de $ 100 quelle avait bien rembours. Son second crdit de $ 200 lui a permis dtendre ses activits la vente de chaussures et produits de beaut qui pouvait lui rapporter si elle possdait un fonds de roulement plus consistant. Aujourdhui, lapproche des ftes de fin danne, elle a besoin de $ 550 pour acheter les articles, notamment des chaussures de femmes et des produits de beaut en vue daccrotre ses revenus et damliorer ses propres conditions de vie et celles de ses enfants.

loan.use: To buy women shoes and beauty products,

loan.name: Dieudonn Mawuna

texts.en:
Mr. Dieudonn Mawuna A. is a carpenter by trade and works in his own workshop in Lom. Born on 15th March 1965 at Kovi, he is married and a father of seven (07) children from three different mothers. After middle school, he had to abandon his studies to be trained in carpentry. Due to a lack of financial and material means, he was faced with very difficult situation after his training. Very enterprising, the creative spirit that he possesses allows him to attract and win continually the trust of his customers. Through his good work he continues to gain customers and this makes his reputation excellent in his area. With the success of experience with the first two credits of $300 and $550 which were repaid without problem, he plans to expand his business to wood selling in order to increase his profit margins and to take care of his numerous family members. They will be sold to other carpenters who travel most of the time long distances to get woods. This will be more profitable to his businesses and will increase his income allowing him to improve his family living conditions. The credit of $ 850 he requests will serve to buy the small working tools, wood supplying and transportation from the inner country to Lom.

Monsieur Dieudonn Mawuna A. est menuisier de formation et travaille dans son propre atelier Lom. N le 15 mars 1965 Kovi, il est mari et pre de sept enfants de trois femmes diffrentes. Aprs son second cycle de lenseignement, il a du abandonner ses tudes pour se former en menuiserie. Il a connu un dbut trs difficile aprs sa formation d au manque de moyens matriels et financiers. Trs dynamique et entreprenant, il possde un esprit de crativit qui lui permet de sduire et de gagner continuellement la confiance de sa clientle. A travers son travail bien fait, sa clientle ne fait que saccrotre, ce qui fait sa rputation dans son quartier. Avec ses expriences russies de ses deux premiers crdits de $ 300 et $ 550 rembourss sans problme, il prvoit tendre ses activits la vente de bois en vue daugmenter ses marges bnficiaires et soccuper de sa nombreuse famille. Il va en vendre dautres menuisiers qui parcourent souvent de longues distances pour en trouver. Ce qui rentabilisera davantage ces affaires et augmentera ses revenus lui permettant damliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le crdit de $ 850 sollicit servira de fonds de commerce pour lacquisition de petit outillage, lapprovisionnement et le transport du bois depuis lintrieur du pays jusqu Lom

loan.use: Small working tools, woods supplying and transportation

loan.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Madam Antoinette F. has had for two (2) years a small trade of cold water, ice, and fruit juice production in Lom. This activity has taken an important place due to the high demand which exists in the area and especially during the dry seasons where the warmth is excessive and where members of the population are consuming to refresh themselves. Born on January 17th, 1967 and mother of three (3) children, Madam Antoinette is an accountant by trade. Unfortunately, she didnt have the luck of a stable job. Therefore, she decided to launch in this trade which provides an income that allows her to cover her needs. Considering the importance that constitutes this activity characterised by increasingly higher demand, Madam Antoinette forecasts to expand her project by selling other products like frozen fish. The proximity of her trade near the market of Nkafu proves a great advantage. The credit of $650 that she is soliciting today will serve to buy one freezer, two coolers, supplies of fresh fish and chicken, and fruit juice fabrication products.

Madame Antoinette F. tient depuis deux ans Lom un petit commerce de production et de commercialisation de la glace, deau frache et de jus de fuit. Cette activit a pris une ampleur importante cause de la forte demande qui existe dans le quartier particulirement pendant les saisons sches o la chaleur est excessive et o les populations en consomment assez pour se rafrachir. Ne le 17 janvier 1967 et mre de trois (03) enfants, Madame Antoinette est comptable de formation, mais elle na pas eu la chance davoir un emploi stable. Aussi, a-t-elle dcid de se lancer dans ce commerce qui lui procure un revenu qui permet de subvenir ses besoins. Compte tenu de lengouement que suscite cette activit caractrise par une demande de plus en plus forte, Antoinette prvoit tendre son projet par la vente dautres produits comme les poissons congels. La proximit de son commerce ct du march de Nkafu lui est un trs grand avantage pour lcoulement rapide de ses produits. Le crdit de $ 850 quelle sollicite aujourdhui va servir acqurir un conglateur, deux glacires et sapprovisionner rgulirement en poisson, en poulet et en produits de fabrication du jus de fruit.

loan.use: To buy one freezer and two coolers

loan.name: Ccile

texts.en:
Madam Ccile A. is 35 years old, married, and a mother of two (2) children. Her husband is a house-to-house photographer who does not have a stable income. As a result most of the household expenses rest on her such as rent, food, childrens clothing, etc. Madam A. has been fabricating and selling LOUGA for eight (8) years. It is a biscuit made from groundnut and sugar and is popular during feasts and large gatherings. The beginnings of this activity have been not easy for Madam A. due to her very limited means. She had started her activities with $50. With her faith in what she is doing and by her courage, she has succeeded to increase her capital to $300 thanks to three consecutives credits which have been repaid well. She also associated to this trade of LOUGA the selling of grilled and bottled groundnut. Considering the quality of these products, she was made by the women the supplying in whole and to resell in detail. Today, the demand is so high that some put in orders at least one week in advance but are not fulfilled. Madam A. is not able to satisfy all of her customers due to a lack means. She is requesting a credit of $500 for storage of raw materials to promote the growth of her production and then automatically to increase her income. The credit will be used for buying sugar and groundnut for the entire year\'s production.

Madame A. Ccile est ge de 35 ans, marie et mre de deux (02) enfants. Son mari est un photographe ambulant et donc ne dispose pas dun revenu fixe si bien que la plupart des charges du foyer repose bien sur elle : loyer, nourriture, habillement des enfants, etc. Il y a huit (08) ans que Madame A. fabrique et vend du louga. Cest un biscuit obtenu partir de larachide et du sucre et bien apprci par la population pendant les ftes et les grandes manifestations. Les dbuts de cette activit nont pas t faciles pour Madame A. cause des moyens trs limits. Elle avait commenc ses activits avec $ 50. Avec sa foi en ce quelle fait et par son courage, elle a russi augmenter son capital $ 300 grce trois crdits successifs qui avaient t bien rembourss. Elle associe aussi ce commerce du louga, la vente de larachide grille embouteille. Compte tenu de la qualit de ses produits, des bonnes femmes viennent sen procurer en gros chez elle pour les revendre. Aujourdhui, la demande est si forte que certains clients passent des commandes au moins une semaine davance, mais nen trouvent pas. Madame A. nest pas en mesure de satisfaire toute sa clientle cause de linsuffisance de ses moyens. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crdit $ 500 pour accrotre la taille de sa production et daugmenter ses revenus. Le crdit servira constituer un stock permanent darachide et de sucre favorisant la production sur toute lanne

loan.use: Fabrication and selling of LOUGA (biscuit of groundnut)

loan.name: Massan

texts.en:
About 35 years old, she is a widower and mother of three (3) children. Having not the chance to go to school, Madam Massan N. swore that none of her children will remain illiterate like her and is fighting for their education. Very clever and active, she remains one of the working women in the village of Ahonkp where she lives with her orphans. Her main activity is to purchase cassave and process it into flour (cassava flour), one of the basic foods in south Togo. Madam N. has shown proved to be an honest and trustworthy woman through the repayments without incidents of her first two credits granted. The flour production is a very hard activity with many risks of injury due to a lack of suitable tools. Buying a tool, the rough, with a credit of $750 will provide an important opportunity to increase her production and income. The rough could even be rented to other women in the area. This will provide to them significant income. Having the rough avoids making a 3 to 5 km trek to have the cassava rasped. The remainder of the credit will serve to buy cassava in other farms to have sufficient raw materials for the regular production all over the year.

Age de 35 ans environ, elle est veuve et mre de trois (03) enfants. Nayant pas eu la chance de sinstruire, Mme Massan N. a jur quaucun de ses enfants ne restera analphabte comme elle et se bat pour leur ducation. Trs intelligente et trs bien applique, elle reste lune des femmes de rfrence dans le village de Ahonkp o elle vit avec ses orphelins. Son activit principale est lachat de manioc et sa transformation en gari (farine de manioc), lun des aliments de base au Sud du Togo. Mme Massan N. a fait preuve dhonntet et de femme de confiance travers les remboursements sans incidents de ses deux premiers crdits obtenus. La fabrication du gari est une activit trs pnible avec tous les risques de blessures dus au manuel traditionnel de rpage du manioc car ne disposant pas de rpeuse. Le financement dune rpeuse et dun fonds de crdit de $ 750 serait un apport trs capital pour augmenter sa production et facto ses revenus. La rpeuse pourra mme tre loue dautres femmes de la localit, ce qui lui procurerait dautres recettes non ngligeables. La disposition sur place de la rpeuse vitera de parcourir de longue distance de 3 5 km pour aller se faire rper le manioc. Le reste des fonds servira acheter des champs de manioc afin de disposer suffisamment de matire premire pour la production rgulire sur toute lanne.

loan.use: To buy rough and cassava farms

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: For improving the business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To start up a business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: For buying Motor Engine

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To Equip the guards

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To improve on carpentry stock.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To improve on business

loan.name: Dd

texts.en:
Madam Dd D. was born in 1962 at Aneho (Togo). Married and mother of a single child, she also supports two (2) dependant children. She started her activities with a small table along the road with about $45 which today has transformed into a foodstuffs shop. Very devoted, dynamic and imaginative, she has began selling cold water and ice for her area as it is cruelly not provided drinking water. Still not satisfied with her activities, she added a phone box to her shop which is a necessity in her area. With all of these projects, Madame Dd D. has decdied to leave her current trade place which is situated in the big market of Lom, for her new area in the suburb of Lom, which will offer more growth opportunities. The credit of $850 she is requesting will serve to enlarge her shop in order to acquire a financial autonomy and cover her family\'s needs. Madame Dd D.\'s dynamic personality should be encouraged in order to serve as an example for her young sisters.

Mme D. Dd est ne en 1962 Anho (Togo). Elle est marie et mre dun unique enfant mais a deux (02) autres enfants sa charge. Elle a commenc ses activits avec un petit commerce de table au bord des rues avec soit $ 45, mais, elle dtient aujourdhui une boutique dalimentation gnrale. Trs dvoue, dynamique imaginative, elle a associ sa boutique, la vente deau et de glaon car son quartier nest pas desservi et manque cruellement deau potable. Comme ces activits ne lui suffisaient pas, elle a install une cabine tlphonique qui est une ncessit dans sa zone. Avec tous ses projets, Mme D. Dd a prfr quitter sa place qui se trouve au grand march de Lom pour assainir sa nouvelle zone dans la banlieue de Lom, ce qui lui fera dvelopper plus ses activits. Le crdit de $ 850 sollicit va servir agrandir sa boutique afin dacqurir une autonomie financire et subvenir aux besoins les plus lmentaires de la famille. Le dynamisme de cette femme mrite dtre encourag afin de servir dexemple pour ses jeunes surs.

loan.use: To buy one freezer and many other products

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To improve on transportation business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To improve on stock

loan.name: Batrice

texts.en:
Madam A. was born in 1956. Married and mother of four (04) children, she is a perseverant and courageous woman. Still very active but having not a lot of means, she is exercising a small trade of beans in order to contribute to the household expenditures. But since the date her husband was retired, the situation has become very difficult in the family. The small old age pension of her husband (which is ofte late) is insignificant for the household needs. So, it belongs to the woman to take in to pay for the nearly total charges of the household. The income benefits from her small trade are not at the level of this responsibility. With a credit of $ 650, Madam A. will increase the size of her activity and get a substantial income in order to respond to the requirements she is facing. The amount solicited will serve to rent a warehouse, to buy, treat, stock and resell beans in higher quantity.

Madame A. est ne en 1956. Marie et mre de quatre (04) enfants, elle est une femme persvrante et courageuse. Encore trs active mais nayant pas beaucoup de moyens, elle fait un petit commerce du haricot pour pouvoir participer aux charges du mnage. Mais depuis que son mari est admis la retraite, la situation est devenue trs difficile dans la famille. La petite pension du mari (qui se paie mme avec des mois de retard) est insignifiante pour les besoins du mnage. Cest alors quil revient la femme de prendre en charge la quasi-totalit des charges du mnage. Le revenu tir de son petit commerce nest pas la hauteur de cette responsabilit. Avec un crdit de $ 650, Madame A. va augmenter la taille de son activit et dgager un revenu substantiel afin de faire face aux exigences qui se posent elle dsormais. Le montant sollicit servira louer un magasin, acheter, traiter, stocker et revendre du haricot en grande quantit.

loan.use: Warehouse renting and beans storage

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To add stock of carpentry.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To improve on business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To improve on stock

loan.name: Mawunyo Ekp

texts.en:
Mr Mawunyo Ekp B. is a man 43 years old. He is married and father of two (02) children. Jeweller by trade, he is not succeeding to exercise his career due to the lack of means for the very expensive raw materials for the Jewell fabrication. Then, he decided to make a training in aviculture as there were true demand of eggs and consuming chicken on the market of his locality. Being back from his training, he started the chickens breeding with his own limited means at $ 75. He has benefited from three consecutive credits of $ 200; $ 300 and $ 550 which he had well managed and regularly repaid. But still today, his offer is not always at the level of his demand. With his experiences, Mr B. desires highly to expand his activity in order to be able to increase his incomes and improve his family living conditions. To that purpose, he is requesting a credit of $ 850 to enlarge his henhouse and to have at his disposal the fund for the acquisition of provisions.

Monsieur B. Ekp Mawunyo est un homme g de 43 ans. Il sest mari et est pre de deux (02) enfants. Bijoutier de formation, il narrive pas a exercer son mtier cause du manque de moyens pour sinstaller, les matires premires pour la fabrication des bijoux tant trs rares et trs chres. Il dcida alors de faire une formation en aviculture car il y avait une demande relle duf et de poulet de chair sur le march de sa localit. De retour de sa formation, il commena llevage des poules avec des moyens ses propres moyens limits $ 75. Il avait bnfici de trois crdits successifs de $ 200, $ 300 et $ 550 quil avait bien grs et rgulirement rembourss. Mais ce jour, loffre nest toujours pas la hauteur de la demande. Avec ses expriences, Monsieur B. dsire vivement tendre son activit afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crdit de $ 850 pour largir son poulailler et disposer de fonds pour acquisition les provendes.

loan.use: Henhouse building and provendry purchase

loan.name: Adjovi

texts.en:
Madam Adjovi N. is 38 years old, married and mother of five (05) children with also three (03) dependants of her died brother. Her husband has not any stable economic activity, that is the reason why she is taking in to charge all the family needs. Dress maker by trade, she realized that this career was not so profitable to her as it is only profitable in the feast period. Then, she has decided to make trading. So, she buys paddy rice at Kovi (Togo), husks, stock and resells it on the market of Anho. This activity is very flourishing for her as she is succeeding to make a profit which allows her to provide for her family needs. With all the experience that she has in this trade, she wishes to increase her activities in order to be able to respond to the more and more high demand on the local market. With the credit of $ 850 solicited, she could have at her disposal a consequent working capital to have a permanent stock of rice.

Madame N. Adjovi est ge de 38 ans, marie et mre de cinq (05) enfants. Elle a galement en charge 3 enfants de son frre dcd. Son mari na pas dactivit conomique fixe, ce qui fait quelle prend en charge tous les besoins de la famille. Couturire de formation, elle sest rendue compte que ce mtier ne lui tait pas trop rentable car il nest lucratif quen priode de fte. Elle a donc dcid de faire du commerce. Ainsi, elle achte du riz paddy Kovi (Togo), le dcortique, le stocke et le revend sur le march dAnho. Cette activit est trs florissante pour elle car elle arrive dgager un bnfice qui lui permette de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Avec toute lexprience quelle a dans ce commerce, elle souhaite augmenter ses activits afin de pouvoir rpondre une demande de plus en plus forte sur le march local. Avec le crdit des $ 850 sollicits, elle pourra disposer dun fonds de commerce consquent pour avoir un stock permanent de riz.

loan.use: Paddy rice storage

loan.name: Massogbl

texts.en:
Waterproofness man by trade, Mr Massogbl T. is married and father of five (05) children. Having not the means to create his own enterprise which necessitates enough high cost and to exercise his career, he was launched in the market of gardening in order to have at his disposal an income resource. Realizing that this activity is profitable, Mr T. has trade in that domain for another specialization. The market gardening production. Particularly, the dry season cultures are very profitable because at that period the products are nearly nonexistent on the markets and those who are doing it, make much benefits. To that purpose, motor pumps are needed, what Mr T. does not have unfortunately. What limits his production and his income could help to save his family from poverty and misery. To increase the size of his production and make much profits, Mr T. needs a credit of $ 700 to acquire a motor pump and fertilizers. He has at his disposal several advantages of lake Togo which crosses his village.

Etanchiste de profession, Monsieur T. est mari et pre de cinq (05) enfants. Nayant pas de moyen pour crer son entreprise qui ncessite un cot assez lev et exercer son mtier, il sest lanc dans le marachage pour pouvoir disposer dune source de revenu. Voyant que cette activit est rentable, Monsieur T. sest fait former en la matire pour une autre professionnalisation. La production marachre, particulirement, les cultures de contre saison (pendant les saisons sches) sont trs rentables car en cette priode les produits sont presque inexistants sur les marchs et ceux qui en font, en tirent beaucoup de profits. Pour cela, il faut disposer de motopompe, ce que Monsieur T. ne dispose pas malheureusement. Ce qui limite sa production et ses revenus pouvant permettre de sortir sa famille de la pauvret et de la misre. Pour augmenter la taille de sa production et en tirer beaucoup de profits, Monsieur T. a besoin dun crdit de $700 pour acqurir une motopompe et des intrants. Il dispose de plusieurs atouts dont le lac Togo qui traverse son village.

loan.use: Motor pomp and fertilizers purchase

loan.name: Adakou

texts.en:
Madam Adakou A. is 43 years old. Today, she is a widower and with six (06) children at her charges. This big responsibility recommends her to undertake income generative activities in order to be able to provide for her childrens needs: feedings, health cares, education. That is how she is launched in the fire wood trade with the modest amount of $ 55 which she had at her disposal. This activity consists concretely to travel to the villages to buy fire wood and in return to sell it at Kpm where she is living and where the wood is very rare, especially for the kitchen. Madam A. does not succeeding to satisfy all her customers because she hasnt enough fund to make a permanent storage of fire wood. She tries sometimes to refer to the usurers, who destroyed her more for the interest rates are high, more than 300%. So, today, she needs $ 450 to constitute a working capital for the supplying, the fire wood transportation and storage to increase her activities and to improve her family living conditions.

Madame A. Adakou ge de 43 ans. Aujourdhui, elle est une veuve et a sa charge six (06) enfants. Cette grande responsabilit lui recommande dentreprendre des activits gnratrices de revenu afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants : alimentations, soins de sant, scolarisation Cest ainsi quelle se lana dans le commerce du bois de chauffe avec la modeste somme de $55 quelle disposait. Cette activit consiste en pratique aller dans les villages pour acheter du bois de chauffe et venir le revendre Kpm o elle rside et o le bois se fait trs rare, surtout pour la cuisine. Madame A. narrive pas satisfaire tous les clients parce quelle ne dispose pas dun capital suffisant pour faire un stock permanent de bois de chauffe. Elle tente parfois de faire recours aux usuriers, ce qui la ruin davantage car les taux dintrt sont exorbitants, plus de 300%. Elle a donc besoin aujourdhui dun crdit de $ 450 pour constituer un fond de commerce pour lapprovisionnement, le transport et le stockage du bois de chauffe pour augmenter ses activits et damliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: Fire woods supplying,transportation and storage

loan.name: Diane Awan

texts.en:
Born from a numerous and very poor family, Miss Diane Awan A. (Diana) has succeeded to attend the primary and secondary school in the very difficult conditions. Obliged to give up early her studies for lack of support, Miss Diana has successfully completed her training in the modern kitchen (African, European and American meals). Unfortunately, she was unemployed after her training. Very laborious and without complexity, she started to cook and sell before the schools from the small financial support of $300 got from MICROFUND. With such good experience, Miss Diana wants to increase her activities by the opening of a small Bar Restaurant with traditional menus well appreciated nowadays. The project forecasts also the training on job of young girls in difficult situation. In the day time, she will serve the traditional meals and in the evenings, she will serve spaghettis, salads, tea or coffee, fried etc. This project, if it happens to be realized as forecast, will allow among others, to: - Be self employed and create jobs for three (03) young girls as salaried contributing thus to the jobless decrease - Serve the meals of quality but at less cost to the customers -Increase her incomes and improve her living conditions on the social, economic and financial plans in order to escape the circle of poverty. The credit of $850 requested will serve to rent one location and build a shed, acquire the kitchen materials and utensils to have consequent revolving funds at the size of the activity.

N dune famille nombreuse et trs pauvre, Mlle Diane Awan A. a russi boucler les tudes primaires et secondaires dans des conditions assez difficiles. Oblige dabandonner prmaturment ses tudes par manque de support, Mlle Diane a russi se former en cuisine moderne (spcialits africaines, europennes et amricaines). Malheureusement, elle sest retrouve en chmage aprs sa formation. Trs lgante, laborieuse et sans complexe, elle a commenc par prparer au bord des rues et devant les coles. Avec cette exprience russie, Mlle Diane veut agrandir ses activits par louverture dun petit Bar restaurant aux menus traditionnels trs bien apprcis actuellement au Togo. Le projet prvoit galement la formation sur le tas des jeunes filles en situation difficile. Dans la journe, elle servira des repas traditionnels et les soirs, spaghettis, salades, th ou caf, frites, etc. La ralisation de ce projet, lui permettra, notamment daugmenter ses revenus et damliorer ses conditions de vie afin de sortir du cercle vicieux de la misre. Ceci est dautant plus vident quelle vitera de sexposer ou de se retrouver dans les mains des hommes peu scrupuleux avec VIH/SIDA qui svit aujourdhui. Le crdit de $850 sollicit servira louer un petit emplacement ou local et acqurir les matriels et ustensiles de cuisine, disposer dun fonds de roulement la taille de lactivit.

loan.use: To buy kitchen utensils and rent local
